She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Larissa Sandrine

texts.fr:
Larissa M. W. est une commerçante de HOPE Congo, âgée de 25ans, universitaire et célibataire sans enfant. 

Elle débute son acticité dès l’âge de 15ans avec un capital de 25000. Ses revenus journaliers sont de 80000 à 150000frs. 

Avec ce second prêt elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbon.

Elle veut devenir une grande commerçante dans l’avenir ainsi que finir ses études universitaires et fondé une famille afin d’offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Larissa M. W. is a merchant with HOPE Congo. She is 25 years old, a university student, unmarried, and has no children. With 25,000 francs in capital, she started her business at the age of 15.  Her revenues range from 80,000 to 150,000 francs per day.

With this second loan, Larissa wants to bolster her business by buying sacks of charcoal. She wants to become a major merchant in the future, along with finishing her university education and starting a family, so as to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Saad

texts.en: Saad is a 34-year-old married man from Nablus. He owns a wood shop in Nablus. He lives with his wife and five children, three of whom are in school. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store and buy new equipment. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to increase the size of his store and buy new equipment.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en: Nazia lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 16 years. She is 29 years old, married to M. S. and has three children. Unfortunately, none of them are able to attend school due to financial constraints. Nazia's husband has a business selling Punjabi food. He has a small restaurant where he sells different types of food items such as Nan Chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and Daal Chawal (made with lentils and served with rice and pickle). These dishes have a very good taste in his hands and his clients like his food very much. Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to improve his business further. With this loan, he will buy required ingredients such as lentils, cooking oil, rice, spices and chickpeas, etc., that will enable him to prepare better quality food and increase his profits. Nazia is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him more profits in future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul M. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to a farmer. She has a daughter and two sons. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The first son works as a security guard and the second son studies at school. 

Baktygul, together with her husband, cultivates agricultural products. She has been doing it since 1991. Her husband also earns money for the family budget by transporting passengers from Balykchi to Bishkek. 

With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to purchase potato and wheat seeds. In the future, she plans to improve the family’s living conditions and provide her younger son a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift valley Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years and sells her milk locally. She also earns additional income from her small-scale farming of tea which she sells to the local market.

Emily has made a loan request of 50,000 Kes to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her five children. She faces the challenge of not enough dairy feed which affects her production. She hopes to increase the number of her dairy cows and plant enough dairy feed in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Aydee

texts.es: Rosa Aydee vive con su compañero de vida y sus  tres hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca de la localidad donde residen. Ella posee una venta de artículos de uso personal, y su venta es muy conocida en el lugar pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y  tienen precios accesibles, además los clientes la prefieren porque les ofrece un buen servicio, siempre esta alegre y los atiende con gran amabilidad; Rosa es una mujer que quiere superarse para ella la manera en la que atrae y motiva a las personas a comprar sus productos es lo que definirá su éxito; esto la impulsa a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como shampo, cremas, desodorantes, cosméticos, perfumes, calcetines entre otros. Con esto Rosa siempre mantendrá mercancía para lo que sus clientes necesiten y tiene fe que los frutos de su negocio le darán la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Rosa Aydee lives with her life partner and three children who attend school close to their home. She has a shop where she sells personal items and her business is well known since she sells high quality products with reasonable prices. In addition, clients prefer her because she offers them great service. She is always cheerful and attends to them kindly. Rosa is a woman who wants to succeed in life. Her ability to attract clients and motivate them to buy her products are what she considers to be her success. This motivates her to request INTEGRAL a loan to buy products such as shampoo, creams, deoderants, cosmetics, perfumes, socks, etc. With the loan Rosa will always be able to have products available for her clients and she has faith that the profits she makes from this business will give her opportunities to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, creams, deoderants, cosmetics, perfumes, socks, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jessica es una persona que le gusta luchar por si sola ella tiene un salon de belleza que dia a dia lo atiende ella nos cuenta que sus clientes han aumentado y gracias a eso sus ganacias han cresido, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para salon de belleza ya esta conbecido de que lo falta mas capital para trabajar, el sueño de ella es tener otro salon de belleza para que en un futuro estar mojor economicamente.
texts.en: Mrs. Jessica likes to strive to support herself.  She has a beauty salon where she works day by day.  She shares that the number of her clients has increased and thanks to this, her earnings have grown.  She is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics for the beauty salon.  She realizes that she lacks the capital to work.  Her dream is to have another beauty salon so that in the future she will be better off economically.

loans.use: buy cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SOUMBA, la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour(sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi II group are married women, who average 40 years of age an 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the village in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, pearl millet, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Soumba (first one standing on the right) intends to buy fertilizers, small tools, and pay for weeding to maintain about 0.9 hectare of rice and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) during the season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicide, and small tools, and pay for weeding

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es:
Santiago de 54 años es un hombre que se dedica al servicio de mantenimiento y reparaciòn de vehículos motocicletas y bicicletas, además de vender repuestos para su mantenimiento y reparación técnica y mecánica, en su taller ubicado en su lugar de vivienda ubicado  en el municipio de Soledad, cerca de Barranquilla, donde muchos lo conocen y habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 21 años, con los que sueña ver prósperos y desarrollando su propio éxito. 
Su negocio nació hace 16 años, cuando se instaló en el departamento del Atlántico, procedente de su pueblo natal  y debió entonces buscar la forma de sostener a su familia,  generando  ingresos autónomos.  Al principio en su negocio solo cargaba de aire los neumáticos de motos y algunos vehículos, posteriormente su capacidad observadora le facilitó captar la oportunidad de vender accesorios como guayas, llantas, neumáticos, codos, tensores, con los cuales aún sigue trabajando  y ha logrado un M. creciente. Santiago   muchas veces siente que le hace falta capital para responder  oportunamente a todas las  necesidades de sus clientes. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, con él comprará variedades de rines, neumáticos, y guayas de moto.  Con esta inversión tendrá en su negocio de todo un poco y resolverá el tema de respuesta efectiva a sus clientes. Su gran sueño y desafío es tener una serviteca en un local bien ubicado, donde diversifique totalmente su oferta y logre con su negocio ser reconocido cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 54, provides maintenance and repair services for motorcycles and bicycles.  In his workshop he also sells replacement parts for technical and mechanical maintenance and repair.  His shop is located where his home is.  It is in the Soledad municipality close to Barranquilla, where a lot of people know him.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 21.  He dreams of seeing his children prosper and develop their own success. 

His business was born 16 years ago when he left his native town and set his business up in the Atlántico department.  He needed to look for a way to support his family and generate income on his own.  In the beginning he only worked on air in tires for motorcycles and some other vehicles.  Later, his observational ability helped him seize the opportunity to sell accessories like control cables, tires, rims, elbow adaptors, and turnbuckles.  He still uses them to work, and he has managed to get a growing market.

Santiago often feels that he does not have the money to opportunely respond to all of his customers’ needs.  This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy a variety of motorcycle rims, tires, and control cables.

With this investment he will have a little bit of everything in his business .  This will be an effective solution for his customers.  His biggest dream and challenge is to have a service station in a good location.  That is where he will totally diversify his services, and he will make his business increasingly well-known.

loans.use: to buy a variety of motorcycle rims, tires, and control cables.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is involved in the teaching profession. She has studied till intermediate level and teaches different subjects to her students. She is a very good teacher and her students like her way of teaching very much. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her brother’s embroidery business. He operates his business from his home and is an expert in his field. Due to his good quality work, he receives regular orders every month.  

With the loan, he will buy embroidery materias in bulk quantity which will help him fill his orders on time and increase his profits. He has been doing this business for the past five years and Rabia is confident that after the loan investment, her brother will be able to meet requirements of his customers and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Jeenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Jeenbubu is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and two daughters. The first son and the older daughter are married and live separately with their families. The second son works in construction and the youngest daughter studies at school. In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, Jeenbubu breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after fattening. With money received from the loan, Jeenbubu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz de 45 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 14 años. Allí tiene un negocio llamado “Confecciones Aldescu”, que inició desde hace 10 años, como una alternativa de ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su hogar y complementar los gastos que hasta el momento estaban a cargo solamente de su esposo. Muy pronto su negocio que nació de una manera doméstica ofreciendo el servicio de costura, fue creciendo y ya sus clientes no  le llevaban solo las telas e insumos para obtener un vestido sobre medidas, sino que ella lo fabricaba a todo costo  y  también exhibía las prendas por tallas; gradualmente fue agregando mercancías como cosméticos, labiales, perfumes entre otras y sus ventas se incrementaron. En la actualidad aprovecha las épocas en las cuales repuntan sus ventas, surtiendo su negocio de lo que conoce que sus clientes requieren. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita su credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para fabricar vestidos, perfumería, cosméticos, calzado entre otros artículos, pues se acerca el día del amor y de la amistad y aprovechará para hacer su gran venta.  Porque su sueño es tener un local amplio para ubicar su taller, generando empleos y posicionado en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 45 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children who range in age from 4 to 14. There she has a business called “Confecciones Aldescu”, which she started 10 years ago as a way to help support her household and cover some of the expenses since only her husband was contributing at the time. Soon after her business was started, she began offering sewing services from her home. Her business grew, but her customers did not provide her with the fabrics and supplies that she needed to make a particular dress, so she began producing at all costs and also started exhibiting dresses of different sizes. Martha gradually acquired more merchandise such as cosmetics, lipsticks, perfumes, and other items so that she could increase her sales. At the moment, she is taking advantage of the time of year when her sales rebound by stocking her business with products that she knows her customers will need.

For this reason Martha is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy raw materials for making dresses, as well as perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items in time for the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian equivalent to Valentine’s Day). Martha will take advantage of this time to make many sales. Her dream is to have a larger space where she can relocate her workshop so that she can create jobs and position herself within the community.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
For the last four years Erickson has been operating a curio shop in West Gate, in the town of Westlands. He is 25 years old and is married to Evelyn.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy ready made African curios which he will later sell at a profit.

In future Erickson hopes to expand his business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy ready-made African curios which he will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Carmen Emperatriz

texts.es:
Carmen Emperatriz tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero niños y niñas.Las compras de la mercadería lo hace en una distribuidora y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.El crédito lo solicita para comprar mercaderia variedad de ropa interior y poder ampliar el local  para aumentar los ingresos económicos.

El sueño es  ampliar el negocio y adquirir más mercaderia para obtener mayores utilidades.En el tiempo libre le gusta enseñar las tareas al hijo y pasear con el.
texts.en:
Carmen Emperatriz is 32 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives with her child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '1º de Mayo' community bank is located in 1º de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  The bank's members work in commerce.

Carmen sells men's, women's and children's clothes.  She buys her merchandise from a wholesaler's and sells it in Ventanas market.  She is requesting this loan to buy a range of underwear and to expand her premises so that she can increase her income.

Carmen's dream is to expand her business and acquire more merchandise so that she can make more profit.  In her free time, she enjoys teaching her son and going out for walks with him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (a range of underwear) and to expand her premises

loans.name: Florina

texts.en: Florina is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan city, Isabela. She is 49 years old and has been engaged in the piggery business for 10 years. She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation. Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide for their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog raising business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and the father of two children.

Mohamad has owned a shop since 2004, selling mobile phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where a lot of potential customers pass by.

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 11 years. 

Merriam has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela has been operating a pharmacy business for the last two years in order to help support her family. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman. Thanks to a previous loan through Faulu Kenya, she has managed and improved her business. Previous to starting her own business, she was employed elsewhere. 

Pamela has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She and her husband have two children, both enrolled in school.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy medicines to offer for sale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Pamela also dreams of buying a piece of land in future.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.es: Maria Enriqueta: de 50 años de edad ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos de telares,y a la costureria desde hace 10 años, ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque gracias a Dios su negocio a prosperado,y que a demas es una forma de ayudar a su familia,poreso ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos con telar, a la compra de tela para seguir costurando y asi de esa forma seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Enriqueta is 50 years old and has been weaving and sewing for 10 years.  She says that she’s happy because, thanks to God, her business is prospering and it provides a means for her to help her family.  This is why she is requesting this loan.  She will use the money to buy weaving materials and fabric in order to continue her work and her business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar a sus 26 años de edad es un emprendedor quien decide hace 5 meses iniciar su negocio con la finalidad de obtener ingresos adicionales a su actual trabajo. El señor Cesar trabaja en su tienda en las horas de la mañana y en la tarde deja a una persona encargada. Gracias a capacitaciones que el señor Cesar ha recibido en su actual trabajo ha podido mejorar su tienda.  El señor Cesar desea comprar surtido como arroz, aceite, panela, productos de aseo personal y del hogar, además de una vitrina y sillas para su tienda. El sueño del señor Cesar es ver crecer su negocio y que este posicionado en el sector, con el fin de dejar su actual trabajo de medio tiempo y así poder estar tiempo completo en su negocio, asimismo el señor Cesar espera brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 26, is an entrepreneur who decided five months ago to start a business, with the aim of earning additional income to supplement what he receives in his current job. Cesar works during the morning hours in his store, and in the afternoon, leaves someone in charge. 

Thanks to the training Cesar has received in his current job, he has been able to improve his store. Cesar wishes to buy stock such as rice, cooking oil, brown sugarloaf, personal hygiene products and home products. He also wants to buy a display case and chairs for his store. 

Cesar's dream is to see his business grow, and be well-established in the neighborhood; with the aim of leaving his current half-time job and being able to work full-time in his business. Cesar also hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy stock and fixed assets.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She has operated a grocery stall for the last two years, a business she set up from her savings.

Joyce learned of Milango from her friends and is now applying for a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase dry fish, potatoes, greens, and tomatoes. The main business challenge she faces is inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. Her ambition is to open a cereals wholesale shop. She will use the extra income to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish, potatoes, greens, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mari's Group

texts.es:
Mari's Group es una sociedad de mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean mejorar su calidad de vida, en esta sociedad María es la presidenta ya que es una mujer alegre, responsable y trabajadora. María tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive en Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador.

María tiene un local de comidas, negocio que le ayuda a mantener y dar el estudio a sus dos hijos ya que es el único ingreso económico de su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un horno para asar pollos ya que quiere innovar y variar las comidas en su negocio, esta inversión ayudará a que gane más clientela y así incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mari’s Group is a society of women workers and entrepreneurs who want to improve their quality of life. 

María is 38 years old. She is single and has two children. She lives in Otavalo in the province of Imbabur in northern of Ecuador.

María  has a food stand. Her business helps her to support and pay for the studies of her two children and is the only source of income for her family. This is the first loan that she has asked for through Fodemi. She is going to use the money to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food in her business. The money from the loan would help her to win more customers, increasing her sales and profits.

Her dream is that her business grows and she wants to have a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 41 years old and married with three children, aged 9, 14 and 17. She runs a retail shop where she sells maize flour, rice and sugar to earn a living. She earns extra income from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Kimyin

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Kimyin is 44 years old and married. She has two children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming, growing oranges and chili peppers for 10 years. Besides this, Kimyin also raises fish and cows to earn additional income. The current business earns about 56,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

Kimyin has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fish to raise and spend some of it on a pumping machine for supporting her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy more fish and a pumping machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase Milk Cans and expand milk buying business.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
Ayoko A. was born in 1977 and lives in Atchamé. She is married, the mother of two, and is also responsible for her brothers and sisters. And since her husband does not work, she is essentially the head of household. The principal source of Ms. A.'s income derives from making coconut oil out of coconuts. It must be said that the meager income from this business is not enough to support her household. Her previous loans have allowed her to see some progress and have indeed been repaid.

To reinvigorate her business, she is asking for a loan of $650 to stock up on firewood and coconuts. She would also like to buy a cart for transporting the coconuts. This will augment her production in hopes of increasing her revenues.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame A. Ayoko est née en 1977 et est domiciliée a Atchamé. Elle a également ses frères et sœurs en charge et joue pratiquement le rôle de chef de ménage, le mari étant sans activité. La transformation des noix de coco en huile de coco constitue son activité principale d’où elle tire son revenu. Il faut dire que cette activité ne lui permet pas avec le revenu maigre qu’elle en tire, de supporter toutes ses charges. Les crédits antérieurs lui ont permis de réaliser des progrès et ont été bien soldés.

Pour redynamiser ses activités, elle sollicite $650 pour s’approvisionner en bois de chauffe, en noix de coco et pour acheter un pousse-pousse pouvant lui permettre de transporter les noix de coco. Ceci augmentera sa production en vu d’accroître son revenu.

loans.use: To stock firewood and coconuts and to buy a cart

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 15, 17 and 19. Cirilo, her husband has worked for the Ferromex Railroad Company for 18 years, but because the wages that he receives are not sufficient to cover the household costs and the education of their three children, it is necessary for her find a way to bring in extra income. For the past three years Maria has worked selling used clothing and orange juice, which she makes herself.

Love for her family and dedication to her husband drive Maria to work harder every day. She is asking for a $275 loan with she will use to purchase merchandise so that she can offer greater variety to her clients, and by doing so increase her sales. This will proviD. important help in the life of this family and in the growth of this business, and they thank you for your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 36 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. tres hijos, D. 15, 17 y 19 años. Cirilo, su esposo, trabaja desD. hace 18 años como ferrocarrillero en L. empresa Ferromex, pero el ingreso que recibe es muy poco para solventar los gastos D. su hogar y D. L. educación D. sus tres hijos, ante L. necesidad D. obtener un ingreso extra, Maria decidió iniciar, hace tres años, son L. venta D. ropa usada y jugos D. naranja, que elL. misma prepara.

El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo son los motivos más grandes D. Maria para esforzarse cada días más, ahora necesita D. un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas. Se parte importante es L. viada D. esta familia y en el crecimiento D. este negocio, ellos agradecen tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Mr Lucas started his supply business in his own house some nine years ago. Due to familial difficulties over the course of six years, his shop deteriorated. He was able to find a new location where he aquired property and built a new house and a new shop. Right now, his business prospers due to this strategic and centralized location.

Mr Lucas asks for a loan to purchase more merchandise for his clients living on the outskirts of the city who regularly stop in his shop on their travels to and from the city in search of work. He believes that with more merchandise his profits will increase and his business will prosper.

Mr Lucas is 49 years old and has one child who is in school. His wife helps him with the business. His house is made of cement, and he is certain that with the business' prosperity he will be able to provide the stability for which his family has been looking.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Lucas empezó su negocio de venta de víveres en su propia casa hace unos nueve años pero después de seis por dificultades familiares su tienda decayó ahora el encontró un nuevo sector donde pudo adquirir un terreno y hacer una casa y de nuevo implanto su tienda en ese sector. Actualmente su negocio ha prosperado mucho por que esta ubicado en un sitio estratégico y céntrico.

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería ya que ahora los clientes de pueblos aledaños salen en busca de trabajo a la ciudad y necesariamente pasan por su despensa y así llevan su producto. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero

El Sr. Lucas tiene 49 años de edad y tiene un hijo que estudia, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio su casa de cemento y Él tiene certeza de que con la prosperidad de su negocio va a poder darle a su familia la estabilidad que tanto ha buscado

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Abulfas

texts.en:
Mr. Abulfas is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 50, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Abulfas and his son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Abulfas sells beef in the Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle. Their volume of beef sold is growing. To supply the demand of his customers, Abulfas decided to apply for a $1000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. In the Caucasus region, the price of a cow is up to $400. If Abulfas receives the loan, he will add two cows more to his herd. It will allow him to provide the necessities of life for the family.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Ni Nengah Nerti

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Nerti at this time lives with her husband and 2 high school aged children. Ni Nengah Nerti is in the red sugar making business. She is already in this business for several years, since Ni Nengah Nerti saw that her income as a common tenant farmer who only work on the fields the traditional way, would not be enough to meet ever increasing family needs. With a capital of Rp700,000 (about US$77), Ni Nengah Nerti with the help of her husband started to make red sugar from 15 coconut trees in their field. Every day Ni Nengah Nerti could produce 15 kg of red sugar, that she sold for Rp60,000 (about $6.60), sugar price per kg is Rp4000 (about 44cents), and within a month Ni Nengah Nerti could have an income of Rp1,100,000 (about $121) from this business. From this income, Ni Nengah Nerti could meet her household needs, including education of her 2 children, and repair her simple home. Ni Nengah Nerti also sees an opportunity to expand her business, by being a red sugar distributor, buying sugar from others, and resell it to a large vendor. However because of capital limitations, Ni Nengah Nerti could not expand it freely. However with Dinari's laon, Ni Nengah Nerti hopes her business could expand again, and income would also increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Nerti saat ini tinggal bersama suami dan 2 orang anaknya yang masih SMA. Ni Nengah Nerti menjalankan usaha sebagai pembuat gula merah. Usaha ini sudah digelutinya sudah beberapa tahun lamanya karena Ni Nengah Nerti melihat bahwa pendapatannya sebagai petani biasa yang hanya mengelola lahan kebunnya dengan cara tradisional tidak mampu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yang sudah semakin meningkat. Dengan modal Rp. 700.000,- Ni Nengah Nerti dibantu suaminya memulai usaha pembuatan gula merah dengan memanfaatkan 15 pohon kelapa yang ada di kebunnya. Setiap hari Ni Nengah Nerti mampu memproduksi 15 kg gula merah dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 60.000,- ( harga gula per kilogram = Rp. 4.000.- ) dan dalam sebulan Ni Nengah Nerti mendapat hasil dari usahanya Rp. 1.100.000,-. Dari pendapatannya inilah Ni Nengah Nerti memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya termasuk menyekolahkan ke dua anaknya dan memperbaiki keadaan rumahnya yang masih sangat sederhana. Ni Nengah Nerti juga melihat peluang untuk mengembangkan usahanya dengan menjadi pengepul gula merah yaitu dengan membeli gula dari orang lain dan kemudian dijual lagi kepada pengusaha besar tapi karena keterbatasan modal yang dimiliki Ni Nengah Nerti tidak bisa leluasa mengembangkannya. Tetapi dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI Nengah Nerti berharap usahanya bisa berkembang lagi dan hasilannyapun bisa bertambah.

loans.use:
To buy red sugar from other makers, so that it could be sold at higher price to large vendor

Membeli gula merah dari pembuat gula merah lainnya sehingga bisa dijual kembali dengan harga yang lebih tinggi kepada pedagang besar

loans.name: David Radney

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and has 4 children: a girl and three boys. Their ages are 6, 4, 2, and a newborn baby boy who is 16 days old. His wife, Julieta, is taking classes at the university to become a high school teacher. David has a high school education, but he wants his children to go to the university.

David has had his woodshop for three years, and therefore, was able to secure an individual loan from Esperanza. In his woodshop, he takes orders from the community for items such as doors, tables, chairs, and bed frames. He is going to use his next loan from Esperanza to buy more machinery, such as an additional saw and drills to be able to expand the kind of furniture he can produce. He has one employee, and he also lets two neighborhood boys (ages 9 and 13) help out around the shop so they can learn the trade.

loans.use: To purchase more machinery, such as an additional saw and drills to be able to expand the kind of furniture he can produce

loans.name: Desak Made Sarini

texts.id:
Living in a field quite far from residence living area, made Desak Putu Sarini ideal to raise pigs, and with husband Gusti Permadi, also raise cows. To pay for living expenses, Desak Putu Sarini raises 1 mother pig, 1 male pig, and 2 to be roasted piglets (Translator's Note: Bali delicacy). Now the mother pig is pregnant, and will give birth in about a month, Desak Putu Sarini bathed the mother pig 2X/day, while feeding. Profit from the roasted piglets are about Rp80,000/piglet (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), after raising them for 3 months. That profit was used to pay for living expenses, and also schooling expenses for their 9th grade child. Her hope is that with Dinari's loan, Desak Putu Sarini would build a pig stall, so that the pigs would not walk around her house yard.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di ladang yang cukup jauh dari pemukiman penduduk ,membuat Desak Putu Sarini sangat cocok beternak babi dan bersama suaminya, Gusti Permadi, juga memelihara ternak sapi. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya, Desak Putu Sarini memelihara induk 1 ekor, pejantan 1 ekor, dan anak babi untuk gulingan 2 ekor. Sekarang induk babinya sedang hamil dan lagi 1 bulan akan melahirkan . Desak Putu Sarini memandikan induk babinya 2 kali sehari, sambil memberi makan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh untuk babi yang diguling sebesar Rp. 80.000,- perekor selama masa pemeliharaan 3 bulan. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk pendidikan anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMP kelas III. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Desak Putu Sarini akan membuat kandang babi agar babinya tidak berkeliaran di pekarangan rumahnya.

loans.use:
To buy piglets and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en: Yanti, 25, mother of 2 children, has a little poultry business. Every day she sells her chickens at the market and earns $15 a day. Her husband, U., is a rock coolie who earns very little income. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her poultry business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 43 year old widow with one child, age 19. Asha sells soft drinks; she started this business in 2005. Every day she works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business, where she earns a monthly profit of up to $50.

In the past, Asha has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 32-years-old and is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 4. She sells cloth and is also a wig designer. Aisha started these businesses in 2001. She works from 9AM to 7PM and can earn a monthly profit of approximately $300.

Aisha has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She now hopes for a new loan to purchase more items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina has been a member of the communal bank MIlenio for 3 years. She is 22 years old, married, and has a 2 year old son. Karina travels to the markets in the region twice each week to buy cereal, cheese and small animals which she sells to shops and markets in the city of Ayachuco . She needs the loan to purchase corn, potatoes and hens. Karina's dream is to have her own house and grow her business.

Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 3 años.

Karina es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo de 2 años, Karina viaja a las ferias de la región 2 veces por semana donde compra cereales, queso, animales menores y luego lo comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho a tiendas y mercados. Además Karina en algunas oportunidades trabaja pelando papa.

Karina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, papa, gallina.

Los sueños de Karina son tener una casa propia y que su negocio mejore.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CORN, POTATOES AND HENS FROM THE REGIONAL MARKETS, SO SHE CAN  SELL THEM IN THE SHOPS AND MARKETS IN HER CITY.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam R., 36 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province where she is a vegetable seller earning $6 per day. In a country where the majority of the population is involved in rural farming, vegetable selling is a vital and competitive profession. Her husband runs a taxi route between Kampong Cham and Phnom Penh, earning about $10 per day. Both of their children are students in elementary school.

Sam R. wants to take out a fairly large loan for the purchase of a motorbike to transport vegetables and to increase her stock of vegetables. She believes this will make her business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy both a motorbike and vegetables.

loans.name: Deborah Nakiguli’S Group

texts.en:
Deborah N. is a 45-year-old single mother of three. She runs a grocery business from a stall she rents at a large open air market in Kampala, where she sells tomatoes, beans, sweet potatoes, bananas (known locally as matooke), Irish potatoes and a ground nut paste that she makes herself. She buys her produce from a market in the center of town, and gets matooke from an outlying village. She manages her stall by herself six days a week, with Friday and Saturday being her busiest days. She has operated this grocery business for the past 10 years. Before that, she waited tables at Makarere University, but the salary was not enough for her and her family. On her own, she knows she can have all of the profits, and she finds the market a much better place to work.

Still, she faces considerable challenges. Power outages often make it impossible for her to use the machine that grinds the groundnuts into paste. At home, she doesn’t have power at all but uses paraffin lanterns, and she gets water from a nearby pump.

Deborah has been a member of MCDT for the past seven years and, working with her group, has received numerous loans. She says that getting these loans has changed her life, giving her the capital needed to maintain her business and send her son to school. With a new loan, she will expand her business, buying more stock to sell. She also wants to finish building a home, so that she no longer has to rent. Her eventual goal is to build houses that she can rent out to others.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a grocery store and finish work on a house

loans.name: Mwantatu

texts.en:
45-year-old Mwantatu is married with two children, aged 14 and 12. She has been selling clothes since 2006 and earns a sales profit of approximately $125 per month.

Mwantatu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for business

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan who has settled in Khirdalan town. He is married and has two children. Ten years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy the necessary materials to make furniture and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making furniture

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz A. is 36 year old and is married with two children. He sells men's clothes. The store is located in the central local market and has been open for 8 years. 

In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any price, Ramiz travels every month to the capital of country, Baku, to purchase new goods. While he travels, Ramiz’s wife helps him sell in the market. 

Ramiz has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not able to fully meet their demands. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. He would like to increase his inventory to earn more income so that he can provide his children with a good education and a better future. Your generosity can help change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Boubacar S. est un transporteur, il fait l'inter-urbain. Ce habitant de Tiléne sollicite ce crédit pour réhabiliter son véhicule. Son activité est rentable et il arrive à subvenir à ses besoins
texts.en:
Boubacar S. is an inter-urban transporter. He lives in Tiléne and is requesting this loan to repair and refurbish his vehicle. His business is making money and he manages to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing and refurbishing his vehicle

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: амсуддинов Раджабмурод житель города Нурек. Не женат. Живет с родителями в очень большой семье. Уже пять лет он занимается бизнесом . Привозит товар из города ДУшанбе и реализует в розницу у себя на рынке. Бизнес приносит доход , как ему , так и населению , которое покупает  одежду у него по доступным ценам. Кроме того им не приходится выезжать в город Душанбе за покупками . Сейчас Раджабмурод планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить свой товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod S. lives in the city of Nurek. He is not married, and lives with his parents in a very large family. He has been in business for five years, transporting goods from Dushanbe to sell at retail prices in his local market. The business is profitable for him as well as for residents who buy clothing from him at reasonable prices. They also don't need to travel to Dushanbe to go shopping. Now Rajabmurod wants to use a loan to increase the volume of sales. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales Volume

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet D. L. C. is a married mother of two (ages 7 and 4) who sells mazamorra morada (a Peruvian breakfast dish) in her neighborhood in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru.  She is requesting a loan of 200 soles to be paid over 4 months in order to buy more ingredients for her mazamorra.  She has been in the business for the past six months, selling two sizes of mazamorra for 50 centavos and 1 sole respectively from 3pm to 6pm every day.  Her goal for the business is to expand it a little and use the profits to buy shoes and school supplies for her two children.  Though she entered the business because she sometimes did not have any food when her children would ask her, she hopes to end her business career many years from now, with them becoming professionals and having better lives.

loans.use: To Buy More Product

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 39 años, convive por 15 años con su pareja, tiempo que le ha permitido construir su casa y darles comodidad a sus hijos. Hace 5 años estuvo dedicada a la venta de pollos y en horas de la tarde vendía de productos de la marca Unión, la cual produce panes y variedades de queques y pasteles, pero exactamente hace dos años se propuso a dedicarse solo a la venta de estos productos, porque todo este tiempo le ha servido para hacer clientela y por ello han aumentado sus pedidos. Olga empieza a visitar a sus clientes a partir de las 7.00am, y así continúa hasta 10.00am, luego regresa a casa para cocinar los alimentos para su esposo e hijos, y luego, nuevamente a las 3.00 de la tarde empieza con las cobranzas hasta las 8.00pm. A Olga le agrada conversar con sus clientes acerca de las bondades de su producto, y de paso les va dando una orientación acerca de nutrición y alimentación, ella está muy contenta de vender estos productos, ya que le es muy rentable, además tiene plazos para que pueda pagar su cuenta a la promotora que le proporciona la mercadería. Olga viene trabajando con su banco comunal durante casi 3 años, este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y al momento de solicitar dicho crédito ha renovado su promesa de pagar todas sus cuotas. Con este dinero comprará panteones, postre tradicional que vende por navidad e inicios de año, el resto de meses ofrece panes y pasteles.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, has lived for 15 years with her partner, allowing her to build her house and make her children comfortable. She had sold chickens for the last 5 years, and in the afternoon she sold Unión brand products, such as breads, cakes, and pastries. Exactly two years ago she decided to exclusively sell these products, because in all that time she had built up her clientele and increased her orders. Olga starts visiting her clients at 7:00am until 10:00am, then she returns to her house to cook food for her husband and children, and then again at 3:00pm she works on collections until 8:00pm. Olga enjoys talking with her clients about the benefits of her product, along the way giving them information about nutrition and healthy foods. She is so happy to be selling these products, it is very profitable for her, as well as that she is able to pay her bill to the merchandise distributor in installments. Olga has been working with her communal bank for almost 3 years, and this will be her sixth loan through MFP. At the time she requested this loan, she renewed her commitment to pay every payment. With this money she will buy "panteones", a traditional dessert sold at Christmastime and New Years, and the breads and pastries she sells the rest of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise she has to sell

loans.name: Karibea Group

texts.en:
Happy S., age 35, is single. She has a tailoring business which she started in 2007, and she works daily from 8am until 8:30pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 222.

This will be Happy’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to expand and improve the tailoring business and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to further expand the business.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group, Karibea, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Happy is second from left, seated, in pink.

loans.use: To expand her sewing business

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
Matilde G. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de mariscos en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León. Es una persona muy destacada debido a que en todo momento ha logrado sustentar su hogar compuesto por ella y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales actualmente solamente uno está en su responsabilidad y es un pequeño estudiante.

Una situación que ella atraviesa es que es madre soltera y por esta razón debe de esforzarse doblemente para salir adelante. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada  con un crédito para la compra de los mariscos y ofertarlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Matilde G. sells seafood in the Mercado La Terminal in the city of Leon. She is highly respected due to the fact that she has always been able to support both herself and her four children. Of her four children only one currently lives at home and they are a young student. One challenge she has had to overcome is being a single mom. As a single mom she has had to work twice as hard to get ahead in life. Matilde has requested a loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase seafood to sell at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood

loans.name: Foster

texts.en:
Foster O. is 37 years old. He is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. According to him, all his children are in junior high and the basic school. His wife is a fishmonger. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming.

Foster is a farmer and at the same time runs a provisions store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, milo, toffees, etc. He says he procures his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is located by the roadside. Foster has been in business for 10 years. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He desires to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị T. năm nay 45 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có hai con đã trưởng thành.  Chị T. là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị T. đều vay vốn và sử dụng vào công việc chăn nuôi. Hiện tịa đây cũng là công việc đem lại cho gia đình T. nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.   Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị T., 45 years old, has three children, two of which are now adults. Mrs. T. has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2006. During the time she has participated in the Fund, she has used her loans to invest in raising animals. Currently, this activity earns her family 2,000,000 VND (117 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en: Gantuya N. is 27, married and the mother of two sons. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a rented home in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district. In 2006, together with her husband Gansuh, she started running a family tailoring business. They sew many types of clothes for men and women including heavy coats and sell them through the "Mongol baraa" shop. With the profit, she has bought two sewing machines and one cross machine. As her equipment improved, her working income and working capital has increased. Gantuya is a very responsible woman and her hope is to have her own tailoring company in the future. With this loan, she will buy more cotton for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cotton for her tailoring business

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El señor Israel C. vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, son una familia unida y muy responsable. 
El es propietario de un taller de carpintería fina, que tiene establecido desde hace 5 años; acaba de obtener un local para su taller un poco mas grande, pero le esta haciendo falta algunos detalles interiores, ya que le quiere dar otro acabado.
Este es el motivo por el cual esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Israel C. lives with his wife and their three children. They are a very close and responsible family. He is the owner of a fine carpentry workshop, which he has owned for 5 years. He just obtained a new location for his shop that is a little bit larger, but it lacks certain interior details. He would like to give the space a different finish, and is therefore requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of work location (home)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia M. D. M. is the owner of a business that sells odds and ends in the city of Santa Rosa. This loan will be used to purchase goods from Brazilian suppliers, as their products are low price allowing a large profit on sales. The loan will be useful for the business and for the family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a general store

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Mr. Arnaldo M. is 27 years old, single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. At age 14 he began to sell mattresses that his mother made. Six years later he began his own business selling and delivering handicrafts to the cities of Altos, San Bernardino and Cordillera by a motorcycle that he was able to buy with income from his job.  He also has to support and care for his mother, who is dependent on him. 

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as comforters, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Darling Scarlet

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Darling G. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de alimentos y bebidas las cuales han sido comercializadas desde hace 15 años en su establecimiento.

De manera muy inteligente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bebidas para el negocio y también para comprar la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así comercializar dichos productos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling G. is devoted to her business selling meals and soft drinks at the Central Market of Chinandega. She has been selling them for 15 years.

She has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of soft drinks and ingredients to make the meals that she will sell at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicitación

texts.es: Vicitacion tiene 43 años, es natural de la ciudad de Andahuaylas, vive con su esposa Catalina de 43 y su hijo Andy de 9, ya que sus demás hijos son independientes. Desde hace 18 años se dedica al negocio de la albañilería, aprendió de su tío todas las técnicas para realizar trabajos de calidad y dejar satisfechos a todos sus clientes. Hace 20 años migró de su natal Andahuaylas para establecerse en la ciudad de Lima, donde viene trabajando incansablemente por un futuro mejor para su familia. Felizmente tiene una buena cantidad de clientela, pero las cosas no son fáciles, ya que para dejar los acabados como se necesitan debe tener las herramientas necesarias, de las cuales carece. A futuro, Visitación quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender gas, ya que es un negocio muy lucrativo. Hace 4 años que trabaja con MFP y siempre le ha ido muy bien, este es su segundo préstamo individual y es puntual en sus pagos. El dinero solicitado será para la compra de algunas herramientas que le facilitarán su trabajo como albañil.
texts.en:
Vicitación is 43 years old, and is originally from the city of Andahuaylas. He lives with his wife Catalina, who is 43, and their son Andy, 9. Their other children are independent. For 18 years, he has been in the business of bricklaying; his uncle taught him all the techniques he needs to do high-quality work that leaves all his clients satisfied. Twenty years ago he moved from his native Andahuaylas to live in the city of Lima, where he has been working tirelessly to make a better future for his family.

Fortunately, he has a large number of clients, but things are not easy because he lacks the necessary tools in order to properly finish his jobs. In the future, Vicitación wants to have a store where he can sell gas, which is a lucrative business.

He has been working with MFP for four years, and it has always gone well. This is his second individual loan, and he is punctual with his payments. The money he requested will be used to buy some tools that will help his work as a mason.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns and runs a small clinic in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. She has been running this business for three years. Mary would like to diversify her income and has requested a loan of Ksh. 35,000 to add a larger stock of medicine and purchase a water tank. Given the drought Kenya is facing, water distribution has become a good source of additional income. A true business woman, Mary also hopes to enter the real estate business in the future. On a personal level, Mary hopes to one day own her own home. She describes herself as a self-disciplined and hard-working woman.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of medicine and buy a water tank

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle B., 33, hails from Silang, Cavite. Her 35-year-old husband, Danny, works for a private security agency.  They have three school-aged children.

Annabelle buys old cars and sells them with a little price mark-up after a few touches of new paint and other accessories. But she makes more earnings from her computer shop. She earns at least 20,000 Philippine pesos a month out of these combined businesses.  

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She started with only two personal computers. With loans from CCT, she now has five personal computers. She was also able to purchase two tricycle units from her profits.

Now on her 13th loan cycle, Annabelle needs a loan of P45,000 for the expansion of her business. She will buy additional computers for her computer shop. She also wants to try buying and selling motorbikes.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Purchase of new computer units

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 41 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 02 hijos, y estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio San Martín  Av. Republica 1211.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años no recuerda,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando abarrotes. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, etc. Para vender en su tienda, los días D. feria prepara comida para vender.

Su deseo es ser mayorista en ganadería para engorD. con todo tipo D. animales, para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Bartolina Sisa” communal bank, which is located in the Llave District, in El Collao Province, in Puno Department. She is 41 years old, is married, is the mother of 2 children, and studied through high school. She lives in the San Martín neighborhood on Republica Avenue. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for several years, she doesn’t remember how many. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase grocery items. She is currently requesting 1,000.00 PEN to buy rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell in her store. On market days she makes food for sale. She would like to buy and sell livestock of all sorts for fattening, so that she can educate her children. She likes the meetings and informative speeches [at Movimiento Manuela Ramos].

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. de 40 años, es una mujer que desde joven trabaja para sobresalir a delante junto con su familia, su negocio es la venta de comida que desde hace diez años administra con su esposo, reside en el bario Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,  tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian la primaria uno tiene 7 y 12 años de edad, cuando inicio el negocio lo hico con un poco de ahorro y préstamo en grupo solidario, luego con el tiempo opto por prestar en Afodenic en donde lleva cuatro ciclos, y se ha beneficiado por la taza baja de intereses y para mantener sus ventas. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos y perecederos para aumentar la venta de comida y poder obtener mejores ganancias para poder terminar de hacer su casa, poder apoyar  a sus hijos para que estudien ya que yo no tuve la oportunidad por escasos recursos económicos que mis padres tener. Su objetivo es poder tener un cafetín y poder seguir a delante en mejores condiciones. Agradece a la institución por el financiamiento que ha logrado estar en su negocio firme.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 40 years old, and is a woman who has worked to move forward together with her family since she was young. She has a business in food sales that she has been managing with her husband for ten years. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children in primary school, who are 7 and 12 years old. When she began the business, she did it with little savings and with a group loan. Later on, she applied to borrow with Kiva partner Afodenic and is now on the fourth loan cycle. She has benefited from the low interest rates and maintained her sales. With this loan she will purchase basic grains and perishable goods to increase her food sales and be able to earn greater earnings, finish constructing her house, and support her children's studies. This way, it is not as though she will not have the opportunity because of limited economic resources like her parents had. Her objective is to be able to have a cafe and move forward in better conditions. She thanks the institution for the financing that has allowed her to achieve her steady business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and perishables

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Kory Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 23 people, is located in Pun Phnum Village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Sam K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. All the members are shown in the photo except one who’s face is blocked.

Mrs. Sam K. is a fruit seller in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to sell.

Mrs. Sam K. is 39 years old and is the mother of six children, four of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are one and three years old. Her husband, Mr. Thach Cheang, is a fish breeder.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, is currently married, and is the mother of four children. All her children are currently in school.

Mary is determined to raise her business to a higher level through hard work, motivation and commitment. To achieve her dream, she does not play with business; she has been selling cosmetics with products like spray, powder, lip gloss, lingerie etc. and sells in the community market. She has been in business for six years now.

Mary says that the selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results she expects.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Ivonne S. es casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, mucha ropa de bebe,  lleva seis años vendiendo para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de luz, agua y gastos de colegio, tiene 29 años de edad, y vive en un barrio 380, en donde hay mucha delincuencia, es por eso sus planes es seguir mejorando su casa para tenerla segura. En los últimos meses las ventan han disminuido lo cual quiere comprar otros productos que le generen ingresos comprara con este préstamo cajas de manzanas y uvas para atraer la captación de clientes nuevos y poder mejorar sus ventas, con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su casa y da las gracias a la institución por apoyar a crecer en su negocio como los beneficios de tener una casa mejor y bonita.
texts.en:
Ivonne S. is married and has two beautiful children aged 8 and 9. She sells clothing and cosmetics, including a lot of baby clothing. She has had this business for six years to help her husband cover the lighting and water bills and school fees. She is 29 years old and lives in an area where there is a lot of crime so she plans to keep improving her home to keep it safe.

In recent months, sales have decreased, which is why she wants to use this loan to buy other products to increase her income including boxes of apples and grapes in order to attract new clients and better her sales. She used her earlier loans to improve her house and wants to thank the organization for supporting the growth of her business and allowing her the benefits of a better and more beautiful home.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes of apples and grapes to attract more clients and vary her merchandise

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres.
Desde hace 10 años trabaja de manera independiente, generándose sus propios recursos. Su negocio es la crianza de pollos y la venta de licores, especialmente durante los fines de semana en las fiestas de su pueblo.
El resto de la semana, Elba se dedica a su granja de pollos, a los cuales alimenta con maíz que ella misma cosecha de sus tierras de cultivo, Elba siembre sólo para su consumo personal. 
Para el futuro, ella está planeando emprender otro negocio, es sería la venta de diversos productos según la demanda de la temporada. 

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, ella es una miembro activa de su banco comunal, y en esta ocasión renueva su compromiso de responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero  que ahora solicita lo usará para dos propósitos: para la compra de un suplemento alimenticio para sus pollos, y con la otra parte comprará flores para vender durante la festividad por el día de los muertos, cuando la gente visita los cementerios.
texts.en:
Elba is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in the house she inherited from her parents. She has worked independently for 10 years and is able to generate her own resources. Her businesses include raising chickens and selling liquor, especially on the weekends for all of the village parties.

During most of the week, Elba spends her time on her chicken farm. She feeds her birds corn that she grows herself. Any crop that she raises is strictly for personal consumption. In the future, she plans to start yet another business selling different products based on the season.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Elba is an active member of her Communal Bank and renews her commitment to be responsible with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used for two purposes. First, she will purchase nutritional supplements for her chickens. Secondly, she will use part of the proceeds to buy flowers to sell for the Día de Los Muertos festivities for when people visit the cemetaries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional supplements for her chickens & flowers for her new business

loans.name: Nejuan

texts.en:
Nejuan P. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock drinks like sodas, packed juice, milk, etc. to sell. Nejuan is 26 years old and is married; her husband is a driver. She has five children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock drinks like sodas, packed juice, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 52 años de edad, es casada con 5 hijos, y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, juguetes, perfumes y zapatos usados. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de perfumes, sabanas, ropa y mosquiteros para la época que se acerca, ya que desea aprovechas los precios bajos de estas fechas. Ya que es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is 52 years old and is married with 5 children; all work independently. She sells general merchandise, principally clothing, toys, perfumes, and used shoes. She has been in this business for more than five years. She began with a small amount of capital and saved little by little until she achieved a sufficient clientele. The loan will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, sheets, clothing and mosquito nets for the coming season, since she wants to take advantage of the current low prices. She is a very enterprising and hard working. Her goal is to have a variety store which can be attended to by the members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eliane

texts.fr: G. Eliane est née en 1972 au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs 37 ans que Eliane réside à Zogbo. Eliane est mariée à HOUNKPE Moïse un pêcheur, et est mère de six enfants. Le couple a quatre autres enfants à charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Eliane vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Eliane n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Eliane vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique (bols, plats, sceaux, etc.) de façon ambulante. Eliane vend également du pain, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenu. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Eliane s'approvisionne. Eliane a déjà 8 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Eliane souhaite renforcer son capital et agrandir son activité, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus d'épargne. Cependant, Eliane manque de moyens financiers pour y parvenir.
