C'est pourquoi Eliane sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Eliane was born in 1972 in the Zogbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in Zogbo for about 37 years. She is married to HOUNKPE Moïse, a fisherman, and is the mother of six children. Some of the children are in school. Eliane works in aid of her husband when it comes to family expenses, thanks to the revenues she brings in from her work. Eliane did not attend school. To cope with her different responsibilities, she goes door to door selling plastic kitchen utensils (bowls, plates, buckets, etc.) She also sells bread, which enables her to multiply her sources of revenue. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she goes to stock up on supplies. She already has eight years of experience in this domain and is on her third loan with ALIDé. She would like to boost her capital and to expand her business. This will allow her to make more money. Yet, she lacks the financial means to do so. This is why Eliane is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying plates, bowls, plastic buckets, and some bread

loans.name: Bolivia

texts.es:
Bolivia P. A. tiene 46 años, es casada,  tiene  3 hijos que se llaman Boris de 21, Klever de 16  y Shirley de 12 años.  Viven en el recinto Santa Deriana Parroquia San Jose del Tambo perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “Juntos Venceremos”.  La misma que esta conformada por 11 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Bolivia trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son la naranja, maíz,  cacao, yuca y verde.   Vende los productos los días viernes, sábados y domingos en Bucay.
Celinda solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno y seguir incrementando sus sembrios.  Su meta es  construir una casa de cemento armado y que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus estudios.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son las permanentes plagas a los cultivos, por lo que gasta mucho dinero en insecticidas y pesticidas para el cuidado de sus productos.
La zona donde viven es  subtropico con diferentes variedades de productos. Bolivia en sus tiempos libres le gusta estudiar la Biblia y ayuda también a la comunidad a organizar algunos eventos.
texts.en:
Bolivia P. A. is 46, married, and has three children. Boris is 21, Klever is 16, and Shirley is 12. They live in the Santa Deriana precinct, Parish of San Jose del Tambo, which belongs to the Chillanes Canton, Province of Bolívar. She is a member of the Junto Venceremos Communal Bank, which is comprised of 11 members. Most of them are devoted to agriculture and livestock. Bolivia has worked in agriculture all of her life. It is the main source of income for her family. The crops that stand out the most in the region are oranges, corn, cocoa, yucca, and vegetables. She sells her products on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays in Bucay. Bolivia is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land and keep increasing her crops. Her goal is to build house of reinforced concrete and that her children continue on with their education. The challenge that she faces is the persistent pests in the fields. She spends lots of money on insecticides and pesticides to take care of her products. The area where she lives is subtropical and has a variety of different products. In her free time Bolivia likes to study the Bible. She also helps organize events in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piece of land and keep increasing her crops

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena U. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin province. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lucena owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Lucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kimrong

texts.en:
Mr. Kimrong T., age 43, and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun Kean, age 33, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Kimrong is not in the photo, but his wife was available instead. 

Kimrong and his wife have been selling finished silk fabric for two years. They buy it from weavers in their village and transport it to sell in other provinces far way from their home. 

Kimrong wants to expand his business, so he is requesting his first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase more finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline A. is a 37 year old enterprising widowed mother of two children ages 5 and 15 years old.  She has been operating a poultry business for the last two years in Siaya, a town located in the western part of Kenya along the shores of Lake Victoria.  Magdaline buys chickens in large quantities and supplies them to hoteliers in Siaya town. A good contact with the hoteliers has seen her maintain a ready and steady demand for poultry meat. 

Magdaline is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd and she intends to use the funds to purchase more chickens for sale since there is demand. She intends to maintain a good credit history so that she might be considered for a second loan. Her desire is to get a Kiva lender, through KADET Ltd., to enable her to take the business to another level of excellence.

She aspires to diversify her business by opening a retail shop because she feels that would increase her income level.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Caaguazú Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité se formó en el Barrio Bernardino C. D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, las integrantes poseen el espiritu emprendedor que se necesita, son solidarias unas con otras y muy responsables, son 18 señoras que integran el comité, cada una posee un trabajo independiente, luchan día a día para mantener a la familia con el deseo D. superación constante en cada una. 
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Buenaventura Ocampos quien posee una carniceria y su actividad es dedicarse a las labores D. la casa y atender su carniceria, ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que le deja buena ganacia.
Quiere comprar una conservadora especial para la carniceria, para la compra del mismo solicita el crédito ya que D. esa manera contará con mayor cantidad D.  producto.
texts.en:
This committee was established in the Bernardino C. neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. The members possess the necessary entrepreneurial spirit. They work closely with one another and are very responsible. The committee consists of 18 members. Each one works independently and strives each day to support their families in hopes of making constant improvement. One of the members is Sra. Buenaventura Ocampos, who owns a butcher shop. Her activity is dedicated to performing her housework and attending to her business. She is very satisfied with her work and is able to generate a good income. She wants to buy a special refrigerator for her butcher shop, so she is requesting a loan so that she can acquire the highest quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more fish, palm oil and rice

loans.name: Guadalope

texts.en:
Guadalope B. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells foods, snacks, and a variety of clothing. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $185 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Guadalope joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Guadalope is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Hilza T. D. 48 años D. edad  tiene 2 hijos D. 20 y 14 años integra la Alcancía Comunal  Virgen D. Chapí D. Yanacoto  conformado por 9 socias que se dedican a labores diferentes.
Hilza se inicio en el negocio D. la venta ambulatoria D. queso, ella los trae D. la parte D. la sierra  y los venD., al transcurrir el tiempo decidió  invertir en un negocio que le pueda ofrecer un mejor ingreso y empezó a vender en su domicilio gaseosas y cervezas, este actual préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. 6  cajas D. gaseosas y 7 cajas D. cervezas.
Los planes que tiene en mente  y está segura que lo lograra,  es D. poder abrir en una  tienda con la venta D. todos los productos como son  abarrotes, golosinas, gaseosas y cervezas, y sobre todo apoyara sus dos hijos que aun están estudiando.
texts.en:
Hilza T. is 48 years old and has 2 children, aged 14 and 20. She is a member of the communal bank "Virgen D. Chapí D. Yanacoto," which is maD. up of 9 members who work in different areas. Hilza started her business as a street vendor selling cheese. She brings cheese from one part of the sierra and sells it. Over time she decided to invest in a business that offered a better income, so she started selling soft drinks and beer from her home. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of 6 crates of soft drinks and 7 cases of beer. The plans she has in mind, that she is sure she will make happen, are to open a store where she can sell all kinds of products such as groceries, snacks, soft drinks and beer, and most of all, to support her two children who are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 6 cases of soft drinks and 7 cases of beer

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine M. est une habitante de la localité  de Baye Laye. Elle est âgée  de 40 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis décembre  2009. Elle est mariée,  mère  d’un enfant et ayant a sa charge une autre personne. Madame M. vient de démarrer  une activité de vente de petit déjeuner  et souhaiterait la développer. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs. Les bénéfices  qui seront générés  par son activité  lui permettront d ‘apporter  une assistance financière a son mari concernant les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Yacine M. is a resident of the town of Baye Laye. She is 40 years old and has been an associate of the credit association since December 2009.  She is married and the mother of one child and has another person to support.  Yacine just started a business selling breakfast and wishes to develop it.  Consequently, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs.  The profit that will be generated by her business will allow her to help out her husband financially regarding family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth M., 54, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Currently separated from her husband and solely supporting her child, Elizabeth is working hard to be able to provide a high quality education for her child. That is a dream for most Filipino parents like Elizabeth.  She is a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Elizabeth operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Juanita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at piece rate. Elizabeth’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php21, 000. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Elizabeth dreams of having her own house someday.

loans.use: Expand her product inventory

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en: Florenia U. is a 47-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, selling Ready-To-Wear clothes (RTW) and school supplies, and a herbal medicines dealership. She lives in Barangay Talisay, Santa Fe, Bantayan Island, Cebu. Florenia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store , RTW and school supplies business and herbal medicine dealership, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 10,000. Florenia is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that her can increase her working capital. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Florenia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Uiese

texts.en: Uiese S. is 31 and married with two children, ages 1 and 4. She owns a business venture to sell pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). Uiese has one year of experience in this business. Uiese needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or about $83 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2010, Uiese joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Uiese's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La Señora Honorata es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el distrito de Santiago de Pupuja,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y no tiene  hijos,   la señora estudió hasta 3ro de  educación secundaria.

La señora Honorata esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como ovino y otros.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar  más animales para luego venderlas en cantidad.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar los animales y  mejorar su casa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, tener un seguro de vida y las capacitaciones que dan.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the community bank “Mataro Chico” located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, province of Azangaro, department of Puno, she is 43, married with no children, she studied until 3rd year of secondary school. Honorata has been working with Manuela Ramos for four months, with her first loan of 500 new soles she was able to increase working capital of her buying and selling business of livestock, such as sheep and other. Currently, she requests a loan for 800 new soles, money that will allow her to buy more livestock to sell in the future. Her dream is to have better livestock and improve her home. What she likes the most about her community bank are the meetings, having life insurance and the training she gets.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ovine livestock

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle T. is from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old. Michelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle manages a vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Michelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Michelle from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Novena

texts.en: Novena T., 34, is married to a very industrious man by the name of Almario T.. He is 36 years old, a fisherman and at the same time fish vendor. He can also drive a boat. The couple has 5 children, the eldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. Their primary source of income is selling fresh and dried fish wherein both husband and wife are involved. She is applying for a new loan of PHP 20,000.00 pesos to buy bulk fresh fish to be delivered in their town market or even nearby municipalities. She hopes to earn more profits so that she can provide the financial necessities of her children, particularly in their schooling. She joins Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA, in the Philippines because she wanted to provide a better standard of living for her family. As a member, she properly utilized all her loans to earn profits for their future. She is praying that many KIVA lenders will support her in all her future business plans like having their own motorized boat for the convenience of delivering their products from the island to the market and establishing a fish stall in their town market.

loans.use: To buy bulk fresh fish for selling.

loans.name: Maria Margoth

texts.es:
Maria Margoth Y. C. tiene 23 años. Es casada vive con los hijos y el esposo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 2 hijos.  

Maria  pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.
Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria Margoth Y. C. is 23 years old.  She is married and has two children.  They live in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

Maria is a member of the Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración [New Inspiration Group] which is located in the Anchoveta neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, a group dedicated to short-cycle workers, who mostly grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  The group has 13 members.

Maria works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She buys them in Guayaquil and sells them in a store near her home and in the market in Ventanas.

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise to increase her business.  This loan will help her economically to meet the needs of her family.  Her dream is continue farming to make money and purchase a car.  She likes to cook.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to grow her business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina tiene 43 años, está separada de su marido hace 10 años aproximadamente, ya que este es un alcohólico y lo único que hacía es maltratarla y pedirle dinero para comprar su bebida, entonces ella decidió separarse, juntos tienen 4 hijos de (21, 19,17 y 10) años   de los cuales se hizo cargo la señora Valentina, el hijo mayor se encuentra en la Republica de Argentina trabajando, las otras tres hijas están estudiando.
Doña Valentina vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Esquilan Chico, su principal actividad económica es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero y de esta manera incrementar la producción de la leche, y así seguir creciendo en su actividad generando más ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas de la señora Valentina es que sus tres hijas puedan terminar de estudiar y tener una carrera profesional y de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida, que el hijo mayor pueda volver de Argentina y realizar alguna actividad económica junto a su madre.
texts.en:
Sra. Valentina is 43 years old and has been separated from her husband for approximately ten years because he is an alcoholic. Since he was being abusive and using money to buy liquor, she decided to separate. Valentina has four children (ages 21, 19, 17, and 10) for whom she is reponsible. Her eldest son is currently in Argentina working while her three daughters are in school.

Doña Valentina lives in the community of Esquilan Chico in the city of Cochabamba. Her main business activity is raw milk production. She sells her output to a company that makes dairy products.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that she can increase her milk production. This will help keep her business growing so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwangi Mugo

texts.en:
Mwangi is 47 years old, a businessman and a farmer. He is married to Susan, who manages their retail shop. They have two children. 

Mwangi has been running a retail shop and farming for the past three years. His monthly income is approximately $215, which he uses to support his family. With the loan he plans to add stock to his store, including cooking fat, wheat flour and milk, and to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer. 

With the anticipated profit from their businesses he intends to construct rental houses and to expand his farming and the retail shop.

Mwangi has never borrowed from any MFI (micro-finance institution) before. He was introduced to KADET LTD through a KADET credit officer, and this is his first loan. His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop, educate his children and enable them to achieve their dreams in life.

loans.use: To add stock e.g cooking fat,wheat flour and farm input.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve commercial space and provide expansion

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine B. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Catherine is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Catherine owns & operates a  business, primarily buying and selling fish in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Catherine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Catherine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber, 40, belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Wilber has a common law wife and six children. His business is the sale of cell phones, cell parts and accessories for mobile phones in “El Hueco”.  He also is involved in the sale of used clothes in the Baratillo part of Cusco. He is looking to invest the loan in the purchase of more inventory for both of his businesses.

He is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in mobile phone and used clothes business.

loans.name: Jackson Ole

texts.en:
Jackson Ole N. is 24 years old. He is married to Naibartun N. and blessed with two children. Jackson has been farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

Jackson learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, to buy a bigger piece of land and to build a permanent home. Jackson is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri Nakkazi lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Eseri has a business of selling charcoal and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Eseri sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Eseri has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. The main business challenge(s) for Eseri include transportation and the ever increasing prices of bananas and charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot and to build rental rooms and also to start selling by wholesale only. Eseri lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita N. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, in Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Virgincita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgincita owns & operates a business selling cosmetics and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Virgincita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Virgincita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgincita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Virgincita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish for sale. This loan will be Editha"s 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen T. sells second-hand clothes and cooking utensils in Abrafo, near the town of Abura.  She has been doing this for a year. Married to a driver, she and her husband have one child. Her earnings help pay household expenses. 

She wants to improve her earnings and plans to do so by expanding her business. The loan will help her purchase more goods for sale. Queen plans to reinvest any additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Deisy Jacqueline

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad.  Su cónyuge trabaja como obrero en un establo. Vive en el Distrito de Monsefú. En este distrito es uno de los que se dedican a la artesanía y trabajos manuales propios del departamento.

Deysi se dedica a la producción de palitos de anticuchos y chupetes en su domicilio el cual esta ubicado en la zona rural del distrito e Monsefu donde la artesanía o trabajos manuales es su ingreso principal.

Deysi desea comprar una mesa de trabajo y más herramientas ya que tiene una mayor demanda de sus productos y a la vez contratará a una persona para que le ayude en este trabajo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Deysi is 25 years old. She is married and has 3 minor children. Her spouse works as a laborer in a stable. She lives in the district of Monsefú. In this district, she is one of those who work in artisanal crafts and handiwork in the department.

Deysi makes kebab and lollipop sticks in her home, located in a rural area of the district of Monsefu, where artisanal crafts or handiwork is the main source of income. 

Deysi wants to buy a work table and more tools since she has a higher demand for her products. She will also hire a person to help her with the work. That is why she has decided that it is useful to get a loan for 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy a work table and more tools for her business.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mrs. Chhorn, born in 1953, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sam who was born in 1952, are farmers. They own a 2-hectare plot of land on which they grow corn and winter melons for supporting their family. In order to improve their farming, Mrs. Chhorn would like to ask for a loan to help support her farming crops. With the rest of the loan, she will buy a supplies for fishing.

This couple has two children who are seamstresses in the garment factories.

loans.use: to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery N. sells smoked fish in Elmina, which is a major fishing town in Ghana’s Central Region. She has been in this trade for three years now. 

She is married to a farmer and they have four children. Her income from selling smoked fish helps pay their children’s school fees and the household utility bills. 

To increase her earnings, Mery needs a loan from Kiva to allow her to purchase larger quantities of fish and boost her sales. She intends to reinvest any extra earnings from the increased sales back into her business. Her long-term goal is to ensure she has put aside enough to support her children through their university education.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish.

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children.

Shaker has had a shop for fixing car air conditioners since 1985. He has a long experience and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $3000 to make a sliding door and to buy an auto air conditioner compressor. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to buy an auto air conditioner compressor.

loans.name: Yesenia Lissette

texts.es: Yesenia Lissette, de 31 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con sus padres y dos hermanos. Yesenia se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. Como toda mujer emprendedora ha hecho de su casa un negocio y desde hace mucho tiempo que ha trabajado duramente en la costura y cada día los clientes la prefieren mas  por ser una mujer dedicada en su trabajo, ofrecer buenos precios, calidad y por siempre satisfacer las necesidades de estos.  Ella elabora cualquier tipo de prenda de vestir y siempre trata de estar al día con los estilos y nuevos modelos de ropa. Doña Yesenia tiene muchos sueños y uno de ellos es ver su negocio florecer. Todo esto la ha impulsado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la esperanza de que de esta manera va mejorar su situación y lograra alcanzar su sueño. El crédito lo quiere para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima  como: variedad de telas, hilos, botones, zíper, entre otros. Con la fe puesta en Dios que lograra su objetivo.
texts.en:
Yesenia Lissett, 31, lives in the family home with her parents and two siblings.  Yesenia manufactures articles of clothing to sell.  Like all enterprising women she’s turned her home into a business and has worked hard for a long time sewing; every day customers prefer her more because she’s a woman that’s devoted to her work, who offers good prices and quality, and who always strives to satisfy customer needs.  She will make any type of article of clothing and always tries to be up-to-date with the latest styles and new models of clothing.  Yesenia has many dreams and one of them is to flourish.

All this has encouraged her to request a loan from INTEGRAL with the hope that this way will improve her situation and she will reach her dream.  The loan will be used to buy raw materials like: a variety of fabrics, thread, buttons and zippers, among others.  With her faith placed in God she knows she’ll reach her objective.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like: an assortment of fabric, thread, buttons and zippers, among others.

loans.name: Las Rosarinas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lina es secretaria del grupo LAS ROSARINAS  son  07 socias  ellas viven en San Martín D. Porras -  Lima Perú, Lina es casada  tiene 04 hijos  con el negocio que ella tiene pueD. ayudar a solventar algunos gastos familiares y así ayudar a su esposo. Su librería bazar se llama “GISEL” que es el nombre D. una D. sus hijas  empezó a trabajar por que quería ser independiente y fue por medio D. un familiar que se animo a poner ese tipo D. negocio  los útiles escolares y  las fotocopias tienen demanda todo el año por la época escolar  estos ingresos le permiten  cubrir los gastos  D. sus hijos sobretodo  sus estudios,  su meta próxima es ampliar su librería  sobretodo el bazar quiere tener mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes  también incursionar el rubro D. productos D. limpieza  para esto que invertirá su préstamo ya que desea seguir progresando.
texts.en: Lina is the secretary of the group "Las Rosarinas". They are 7 members and they live in San Martin D. Porras, in Lima, Peru. Lina is married and she has 4 children. Through her business she is able to help cover some of the family's expenses, to help her husband. She has a bookstore gift shop is called "Gisel". It is the name of one of her daughters. She started working because she wanted to be independent and she was encouraged by a family member to set up this type of business. School supplies and photocopies are in demand all year by the schools. This income helps her cover her children's expenses, especially for their schooling. Her next goal is to improve her bookstore and gift shop to have more products to offer her clients. She also wants to start selling cleaning products. She will invest her loan in all of this to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning supplies for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 5 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU, la première debout à gauche avec une écharpe blanche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 5 Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, small millet, rice and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan with the institution.

Kadiatou, the first woman standing at the left-hand side of the photo and wearing a white scarf, intends to use her new loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.8 hectares of farmland to grow small millet and groundnuts. The harvest will be sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and farming tools.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years-old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 

Jocelyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. She earns PHP 15,000.00 a month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000.00 from Kiva partner GDMPC in order to purchase more fish varieties to sell in the market and her rental stall.

Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her rented fish stall in the market and obtain another stall in an adjacent town.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 35-year-old married woman, who has four children to raise, together with her husband. To help her husband in supporting the family, Huda started a small retail business five years ago selling clothes and towels as shown in the picture.

Now Huda has applied for a loan to make a display area for the products she is selling, hoping that she will have her own clothes store in the future.

loans.use: To make a display area for the clothes she sells.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, age 50, is an experienced farmer. She has been involved in farming since 1983 on her own farm, which is near her village.  From this work, she is able to earn about 2 dollars daily. 

Von is married to Chan, age 47, who is also a farmer. The couple has four children, one of them is already married and lives away from her parents, and the other three children are all single.  Presently, two of her kids are employed as blacksmiths in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.   

Because Von's children work far away from the village, they face difficulties with their traveling needs because they must always pay a lot of money to a taxi driver when they want to go to their workplaces and other places. Therefore, Von hopes to reduce her children's expenses for transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Alicia Yisenia

texts.es:
Alicia Yisenia tiene 35 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de catorce,  trece y ocho años de edad en el  Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Alicia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder agrandar la casa que tiene  para poder vivir  mejor y cómoda con la familia .En su  tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música mientras se ocupa de los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Alicia Yisenia is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children (ages 14, 13, and 8) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Alicia is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Alicia is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to expand her house so that she can live better and more comfortably along with her family.

During her free time, Alicia enjoys listening to music while she is busy with the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Oyunbaatar

texts.en:
Oyunbaatar is 46 years old and retired from the army. He lives with his 4 kids and wife in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Previously he was in the Mongolian Border Force, but he retired early. For the last month, he has been working as a bus driver for a secondary school.  
In 2008 he started to build a small house within his fence. He could not finish it due to the lack of money. Recently he completed the building of part of his house and he needs additional money to finish it before the winter. Therefore he is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to finish the house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to finish the building his house.

loans.name: Maxima Flora

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del  Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza I”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 6 hijos, 2 de ellos son independientes.  Estudió hasta 1ro de educación  primaria.
Hace dos ciclos trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/.  500 .00 nuevo soles, comprará fideos, azúcar, arroz, huevo, gaseosas, galletas, golosinas, para  abastecer su tienda, también vende helados, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo.
La señora desea mejorar  su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Máxima is a member of the “Alto Alianza I” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 54 years old and has six children.  Two of her children live independently.  Máxima studied up to the first year of elementary school.

Máxima has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 500 soles and she invested that money in her grocery store business.

With this new loan for 500 soles, Máxima will buy noodles, sugar, rice, eggs, soda, cookies and candies with which to stock her store.  She also sells frozen treats.  Her children and husband help her in the business.

Máxima would like to improve her business in order to increase her profits.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, rice, eggs, soda, cookies and candies

loans.name: Gune

texts.en:
Gune, 30, is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.

She has a business of selling breads in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Gune requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more breads for resale.

She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more breads for sale.

loans.name: Nyamzav

texts.en: Mr. Nyamzav is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian ger, a nomadic tent. He works as a driver at a bus company. His wife is an assistant worker in a cashmere factory. They both have a fixed income. He is a very hard working and honest person. Currently he and his family have been living in a house which is cold to live in during the winter time. Therefore, he started to build a new family house that is warm and comfortable. Now he needs some money to finish building the house. He is requesting a loan to purchase two vacuum windows, a door, and some bricks for completing the house.

loans.use: To purchase two vacuum windows, a door, and some bricks for completing the house

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Silveria makes and sells snacks like rice, cheese & pancakes . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks .
Silveria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Silveria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia se dedica a la agricultura y ademas tiene una pequeña cantidad de cabezas de ganado lechero; su esposo se dedica al auto transporte. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche y por ende mejorar los ingresos de la familia. Vive en casa en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz; Delia es casada y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que Delia obtiene un crédito a través de Impro  y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señora Delia works in agriculture and also has a small number of dairy cows.  Her husband works in car transportation.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of a pair of dairy cows to increase her milk production and therefore improve her family's income.

She lives in her parents' home, which is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the department of La Paz.  Delia is married and does not have children.

This is the first time that Delia is taking out a loan through Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of diary cows to improve her milk production.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Soledad nació en la ciudad de Sicuani y radica 10 años en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 25 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a reciclar botellas descartables y estos productos los envía a la ciudad de Lima. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Soledad requiere el préstamo para comprar botellas descartables.
 
Soledad se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She was born in the city of Sicuani and has lived in the city of Cusco for 10 years. Soledad is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She recycles disposable bottles, which are then sent to the city of Lima. Soledad has been in this business for several years and has done very well. She is requesting a loan to buy disposable bottles.

Soledad is grateful to the opportunity that has been given to her and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy disposable bottles.

loans.name: La Reforma 1, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Alexandra is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma 1, 4 & 5 (Reform). She has a long term partner, four children and lives in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity here is the free trading zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.

For around eight years Alexandra has operated a colmado: a shop where you can find basic food staples. Colmados are within short walking distances from neighborhood homes. She started her business with a loan she receive from a friend. She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory by purchasing rice, sugar, canned food, vegetables, flour and other foods. 

Alexandra is a hard-working mother. She uses her profits to provide any needs for her family. She also she uses her profits to save and to reinvest in her business. She still is dreaming about her future and she wants to have a better life, live in tranquility and safety, rebuild her house, and have a stable business.

Alexandra says that her biggest goal is to have her own house. That is why she is saving and dividing her home expenses with her husband's income. She is very thankful for all your support. Your support for her and other members in this group can make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, canned food and other foods.

loans.name: Sope Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitement pratiquement ensemble et ont de bonnes relations sociales 

Madame Seynabou (est debout à gauche de la photo habillée en robe noir) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 23 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère d'un enfant.

Elle fait un petit commerce d'habits pour bébé depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs CFA elle va acheter des ensembles d'habits bébé (garçon comme filles) pour revendre dans le quartier.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices , elle va soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales en en contribuant à l'achetant de riz ,huile ,sucre, lait ,fournitures scolaire et ordonnances pour son enfant en cas de maladie.
texts.en: This solidarity group was created on November 23, 2011. It is composed of twelve women who essentially live together and have good social relations. Madame Seynabou (standing on the left of the photo in a black dress) is the leader of the group.  She is married and is the mother of one child. For several years, she has been running a small shop selling baby clothing. With her new loan of 50,000 CFA francs, she will buy sets of baby clothing (for boys and girls) to sell in her neighborhood. With the help of her profits, she will support her husband in managing family expenses by contributing to the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, milk, school supplies, and prescriptions for their children in case of illness.

loans.use: Purchase baby clothing for retail

loans.name: Las Divinas De La Union Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y unidas, así está conformada  el grupo  de las divinas de la unión, integrada por 8 personas,  sobresalen grandes mujeres y hombres, cada uno con una historia en particular una de ellas es la señora Maribel de 41 años de edad, soltera y  desde muy pequeña vivió rodeada de ejemplos y coraje que la animaron a emprender el negocio de Venta de comida (comidas de la región) ya con 15 años en el negocio a podido dar lo mejor a su pequeño hijo , ya que comenzó en la puerta de su casa y poco a poco lo ha ido mejorando que hasta ahora vende raspadilla y dulces, con grandes sueños y metas por cumplir  piensa poner un local para la venta de su comida, y con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar  más insumos y poder tener lo necesario para salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: The communal bank Las Divinas de la Unión is made up of several enterprising, hardworking and united women. The group consists of 8 people, men and women who excel, each with their own story. One of them in particular is Señora Maribel who is 41 years of age and single. From a young age she lived surrounded by living examples of courage which encouraged her to start a business selling food (regional dishes). Now with 15 years in the business, she has been able to provide her small son with the best. Having started out with the business at her front door, little by little she was able to improve the business and now sells shaved ice drinks and sweets. With grand dreams and goals to meet, she is thinking of opening a locale to sell food. She will invest her recent loan in buying more ingredients and having what it takes to succeed for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette  est une vendeuse de poissons âgée de 45 ans qui vit sur le territoire  sénégalais, dans l’une de ses communautés villageoises. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre5 et 25 ans.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Mais  parallèlement  elle commercialise du  couscous. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion dans le but de gagner des bénéfices et de satisfaire ses besoins. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons qu’elle va revendre. Son  souci est de renforcer son fond de roulement  et augmenter ses bénéfices pour mieux soutenir ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Maguette is a 45-year-old fish vendor who lives in a village community of Senegal. She is married with seven children ranging in age from 5 to 25 years old. She has over 10 years of experience in her activity. As a sideline, she also sells couscous. She chose to work in trade out of passion, and to earn profits allowing her to support herself. She joined a U-IMCEC branch in August 2011. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 francs to buy fish for sale. Her goal is to bolster her working capital and increase her profits to better support her children.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Teko Sanda Traders Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Teko Sanda Traders” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,200,000.00 Sierra Leone leone (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is age 23 and is married with one child. Her husband is a military officer, and her child is still not of school-going age. 

Fatmata retails cooking oil, flour, sugar, onions, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cooking oil, flour, sugar, onions, etc., in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, onions, etc., in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Carmen Esperanza

texts.es: Carmen vive en Libertad, tiene una casa propia de cemento. En su ciudadela cuenta con los servicio de agua, luz y camino pavimentado, aun no tiene alcantarillado pero espera que las autoridades gestiones esta necesidad. Carmen tiene 46 años y vive junto a su esposo quien se jubilo hace varios años de la empresa Petro-ecuador. Como su esposo vive de su pensión y ella era ama de casa, quería tener ingresos extras ya que no les alcazaba. Tiene 5 años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa por catalogo. Al principio era ella quien compraba para su uso pero un día empezó a ofrecer a sus amistades dándose cuenta de que le gustaba. Tomo la decisión de ir e inscribirse para ser vendedora y ahora tiene un stock de productos y ropa que ofrece en su domicilio o en el de sus clientes. El negocio lo realiza sola realizando visitas a familiares, amigos o conocidos, también acude cuando la llaman vía telefónica. Carmen nos dice que no tiene hijos pequeños todos son mayores de edad y viven aparte, a veces la visita una sobrina quien la acompaña a realizar el recorrido. Ella espera que en varios años el esfuerzo que está realizando se vea recompensado con la apertura de un local estable donde pueda laborar sin problemas.
texts.en: Patricia lives in Libertad and she is 47 years old. She is a travelling merchant who sells eiderdowns and sheets. In the area where her home is located, they have basic utilities; her house is made of cement. She is married to Daniel, who is retired and lives off his pension. Patricia tells us that her husband retired 4 years ago and that is was that who pushed her to start her business. Offering and selling products is done with her daughter in the mornings, since the latter has secondary school in the afternoon. Patricia also sells prepared meals to other households. Patricia tells us that the most important thing for her has been the support of her daughter, who is very responsible for her age. She tells us that for a while she was ill and could not make the rounds to sell her products but her daughter took over those tasks. Patricia hopes to help her daughter reach university so that she can have a bright future. Patricia has two other children who attend state-run school. With the loan, she will buy sheets and eiderdowns to sell. Her dream is to have a small restaurant where to serve typical food.

loans.use: venta de productos de belleza y ropa por catalogo

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa sells maize at Eguafo near Elmina. She is divorced and has seven dependents. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay her children’s school fees. 

Theresa needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for resale. With the new profit, Theresa wishes to acquire a large quantity of maize to distribute to the retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is a nurse/midwife who runs a private clinic in Nakuru town Rift Valley. Her facility that serves a slum community was voted as one of the best in the town. She has applied for  US $ 2,778 loan to enable her to renovate, create and equip two more rooms to create more space for her clients towards quality improvement.

loans.use: To purchase the clinic supplies

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Komlan A. was born in Gapé-Centre on December 27, 1969. After finishing primary school, he entered an apprenticeship to get training in electronics. He is now practicing his trade as a radio repairman and is very active in it. He currently runs his own electronic technician’s shop but with all kinds of challenges despite the micro-loans he has gotten. He received four such loans that have all been repaid. As a father, he sets a fine example, enjoying the respect of his friends, neighbors, and family members alike. And that inspires more confidence. Now, for him to acquire new radio parts for sale to customers, he is requesting a loan of $800. He can then improve his family living conditions and his economic situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Komlan est né le 27 décembre 1969 à Gapé Centre. Après ses études primaires, il entre en apprentissage pour se former en électronique. Il exerce actuellement le métier de réparateur de radio et est aussi un membre très actif dans son activité. Il gère actuellement son atelier d’électronicien avec toutes les difficultés du monde, malgré les petits financements reçus. Il a reçu quatre (04) financements qui ont été remboursés. Père de famille, sa conduite exemplaire et le respect dont il jouit au sein de sa famille et de ses proches inspirent plus de confiance. Pour s’acheter de nouvelles pièces de radio qu’il revendra à ses clients, il sollicite un montant de $800 qui l’aidera à améliorer ses conditions de vie sur le plan économique et familial.

loans.use: Commerce in spare parts for household electronics

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela has 12 years of sales experience. She started selling shoes but due to the time and effort this took she slowly stoped this activity. With the help of her husband, she opened a small store out of their home. This business has done very well and now they have expanded to selling fruit. They work every day of the week from 6am to 11pm. They have a cart they use in the afternoon to sell fruit along a route in her neighborhood. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of additional fruits to meet her growing daily demand and to add to the variety of her products. Gabriela is married, and is 23 years old. Together with her husband she has managed to be successful in her business. Currently they do not have any children but they are thinking about it for the future. They live at home with her parents. Her wish is to eventually buy some land where they can build their own home.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Gabriela tiene una experiencia de 12 años en el comercio. Se inicio vendiendo zapatos pero por el tiempo que le demandaba y su esfuerzo decide poco a poco ir dejando esa actividad. Con la ayuda de su esposo deciden ponerse una tienda en su domicilio. Dicho negocio le ha ido muy bien que incluso han incluido dentro de esta la venta de frutas. Trabajan todos los días de la semana desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Tienen un carrito en el cual por las tardes salen a recorrer con la venta de las frutas.

Desea el crédito para poder invertir en frutas ya que su demanda a aumentado en su recorrido diario. Además surtir su negocio con mas frutas

Gabriela es casada. Tiene 23 años. Ella junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante el negocio. Al momento no tienen hijos pero están pensando en la posibilidad más delante de concebir. Viven en la casa de sus padres. Su deseo es poder mas adelante comprar un terreno en donde poco a poco ir construyendo su casita propia.

loans.use: Invest in fruit

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Soeurn has been married since 1992 and has 6 children - a son and 5 daughters. He works as a motorbike-repairer, and has been in this business for more than 20 years. Mr. Soeurn owns a small motorbike-repair shop, while his wife does farming in the village. Mr. Soeurn has obtained primary education. His 3 daughters are currently garment factory workers, since the couple can afford to send only 3 of their 6 children to school. 
Mr. Soeurn is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike and materials for motorbike repair. The family can generate enough income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and motorbike-repairing materials

loans.name: Mahfiratchon

texts.ru:
Mahfiratchon G. is 53. She is married and has 3 children. She has a high school education. She lives together with her retired husband. Her children have families of their own and live separately from the parents. She lost her job after the disintegration of the USSR. Her husband was laid off as well. In order to not be financially dependent on her children and maintain her lifestyle she began working in sales. Back in 2003 her assets amounted to $150. She was selling children's clothing. Thanks to the loan and her commitment to the MicroInvest program she was able to increase her assets to $700. She was able to secure a permanent sales point and expanded her inventory to include children's shoes. In the future she is planing to procureanother sales point and increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гиязова Махфиратчон – 53 лет, мать 3-их детей. Замужем, образование среднее специальное. Муж -пенсионер ,живут они вместе. У детей свои семьи и живут они отдельно от родителей. После развала советского союза Махфиратчон осталась без работы, а ее муж был в числе сокращенных рабочих. Чтобы быть не в тягость детям она начала заниматься торговлей с 2003-го года с активами на 150$, для поддержания уровни жизни. Она занималась торговлей детской одежды. После непрерывного кредитования, целенаправленностью перед программой МЗФ и своею порядочностью, она увеличила свои активы до 700$. Тем самым она приобрела постоянное место деятельности и добавила в свой ассортимент детскую обувь. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну точку торговли и увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: to open another sales point and increase inventory selection

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean S., age 51, works selling clothes at a market, earning around $5 each day. Her husband is retired and too old to work. They have nine children: two who work at a restaurant, four who are students, and three who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase more fashionable clothes to meet her clients’ demands. She believes a greater variety of clothing will attract additional clients and increase revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothing to meet clients' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new products for the high season in December

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 32 year-old Ethel B.. She is single with no children. In 2007, Ethel established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Bukasa B (2026)D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of groceries and motorcycles and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to expand her grocery business. Sarah is 42 years old and is divorced. She has 7 children ranging from age 5 to 27 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for the children Sarah is joined in her small group by Janat N., Milly Nakafero, Joyce N., and Prossy.

Janat N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to add to her stock. Milly Nakafero is currently in the business of selling fruit and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to increase stock. Joyce N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to purchase more clothes for sale. Prossy is currently in the business of fruits and vegetables and is requesting a loan of UGX 350,000 to expand her vegetable business.

loans.use: To expand the grocery business

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!  40 year-old Oliver M. is married with three children, ages 6, 10, and 14.
 
In 1999, Oliver established a hair salon business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $140 per month from this business. Oliver has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan of $875 in order to purchase two hair dryers, a basin, and additional haircare products. In the future, Oliver also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase two hair dryers, a basin, and additional haircare products.

loans.name: Maida

texts.en: Maida is a 39 year old woman from Kobiljača, a suburb of Sarajevo. Her husband works as a carrier and he can earn  about 500 KM monthly. They have 2 children, 4 and 11 years old, and the older child goes to  primary school. Maida intends to use this loan to buy more groceries for her shop. Her wish is to expand her business to offer more selection to her customers.

loans.use: Buy more groceries for the shop.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
I have already almost finished building my house. All that it lacks is the concrete floor, painting and the stucco for the whole house. I request a loan of $1200 in order to finish my house so that my family will have a larger and more secure place to live.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ya casi termino de construir mi vivienda solo que me esta haciendo falta el piso de concreto, pintura y los enjares en toda la casa. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls para la terminación de mi casa y que mi familia ya tengo un lugar mas amplio y seguro donde vivir.

loans.use: To lay the concrete floor, paint and stucco the house.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen Y. E is 54 years old and lives as a housewife in Kampong Cham. Her husband is a low earning farmer making less than 1 US$ per day. The couple has four children. Their two oldest are already married and both live outside the family home. The younger two are also adults and no longer attend school. To support the family, one child works as a tailor in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Another is a clothing vendor at a market in Phnom Penh. She earns 6.50 US$ per day and both send a portion of their earnings home. Phnom Penh is the only large city in Cambodia. Therefore many rural families send their children there with hopes of making ends meet. Yen Y. E wants to purchase a stand in the marketplace for her daughter so she can increase her earnings and live more comfortably as well.

loans.use: To buy a market stand.

loans.name: Delphen

texts.en:
Born in 1971, Delphen M. has been finding difficulties trying to raise business capital to make necessary investments in her pig farm. She is married to Esau Ngoh and has 6 children. She joined GHAPE in 2001 and, she has successfully borrowed and repaid seven loans from GHAPE. She was unable to invest her first loan because of ill health, but now, she has greatly improved on her management skills and is capable of investing bigger loans.

Pig farming is a very profitable business in her community when done on a large scale. Motivated by her ambitions and given this loan, she plans to expand her business through purchasing additional piglets, feed, and feeding troughs. She will use the profits to provide the basic needs of her family. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, feed, and feeders

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 25 years old. She entered the cosmetics industry in 2007. Everyday, she works from 10 AM to 4 PM at her business, selling soap and personal products for a monthly profit of about $30 from sales.

In the past, Asia has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Asia now hopes she can complete another loan to purchase more items and expand the range of her business and clientele.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose O. sells beverages and a homemade pepper soup. She has been in this business since 1995. Bose is 42-years-old, married with four children and lives in Ishaga, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan amount of $1200 to purchase more beverages and ingredients for her pepper soup. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages and pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Remza

texts.en:
Remza H. was born in 1986. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 1. Remza lives with her family in  Mahmutovićima near Kalesija. Her husband has constant work but he doesn`t earn much, only about 450 KM (~ $330 USD). It is not enough to pay all costs for his family. 

Remza and his husband are busy with farming. They produce several kinds of vegetables and they have a corn field so they can produce food for their cattle. 

Remza has borrowed from Women for Women International several times in the past. Every time that she has taken a loan, she invests the proceeds in her business, as she will this time.
