She has saved some money, but not enough to buy another cow, so Remza will use this loan of 1000 KM ($750 USD) to buy a cow. In this way Remza`s family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Badegna (Parenté) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe badegna est un regroupement de sept femmes du village de kimparana qui ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Toutes mariées elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec des coépouses et autres parents dans la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république Mali).
Unis par des liens professionnel et de voisinage les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le groupe est à son quatrième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de fruits et légumes (bananes, papayes, oranges, mangues, ananas, melon, carotte, aubergine, épices etc.) à partir de la préfecture de Sikasso auprès des producteurs locaux.
Ces femmes vendent leurs produits au marché de kimparana, de porte en porte et souvent au bord de l’artère principale traversant la ville, à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, régler les frais scolaires et les dépenses familiales.  Dans les jours à venir elles ambitionnent devenir des producteurs de fruits et légumes en se lançant dans les plantations et le jardinage.
texts.en:
Badegna is a group of seven women from the village of Kimparana who average 38 years of age and five children. They are all married and live in traditional extended families with co-wives and other parents in San Prefecture (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by ties of profession and community, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. The group is on its fourth solidarity loan (group loan). Each of the preceding loans has been correctly repaid.

They intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables (bananas, papayas, oranges, mangoes, pineapples, melons, carrots, eggplants, spices, etc.) in Sikasso Prefecture, from local producers.

These women sell their goods at the Kimparana marketplace, door-to-door, and often on the side of the main artery crossing the city. They sell to customers composed of a complete cross-section of society.

With this new loan, they intend to realize an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per cycle that will be used to repay the loan interest and to cover school fees and family expenses. In the days to come, they have the ambition of becoming producers of fruits and vegetables by launching into plantings and gardening.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Chetha

texts.en:
Mr. Chetha M. is 44 years old and a pig breeder, who took on this work a long time ago and has much experience in gaining income to sustain his family’s expenses. He also helps in his wife’s business to buy groceries from the local market to sell. His wife, Mrs. Nara Thoang, 40, is a grocery seller who has attracted many clients who buy from her business; most of them are neighbors and live near her house. The couple has two children, both of whom go to high school. They live in the Veal Commune in Pursat Province.

Chetha would like to request a loan of 1,500,000 riel to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Opportunity knocked for Belinda E., 38 , who is married and from South Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  

Her husband who works in the Philippine National Army, gave her the capital to start her piggery business.  They figured that the space did not need to be very big, just big enough for five piglets.  Despite having zero sales in the first few months, it turned out well.   They sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive.  They gave their best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously.  

Belinda is now trying to expand their piggery business.  They presented their project proposal to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to buy additional piglets and animal feeds with a loan of PHP 5,000.  They are thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing their capital needs.  

They will be able to add a number of piglets and purchase sacks of feeds for their business.  In addition, they want to build a cemented piggery in their backyard and deliver pigs in volume to nearby towns.  

With their profits, they wish to send their children to school and have stable careers.  With Paglaum's help, they know they can!

loans.use: buy additonal piglets and animal feeds

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna del Carmen L. Balitan tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Reyna tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 26 años trabaja por cuenta propia su hijo de 24 años no estudia y su hijo menor de 22 años no estudia, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de seguir con la actividad económica por lo que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tiene que buscar el pan de cada día tanto para su familia como para ella misma en sus deseos esta el tener salud para seguir luchando por le trabajo ya que también en sus deseos quiere realizar un viaje al extranjero por lo que le gustaría conocer otras partes del mundo sus sueños son de sacar adelante a su familia para que en un futuro ellos puedan hacerse cargo del negocio y no tengan dificultades para resolver problemas.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general por lo que vende productos como: camisas, ropa interior, calcetines y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Doña Reyna inicio este negocio porque desde que era joven le gustaba trabajar por lo que esto dio la pauta para ella comenzara con otro negocio como lo fue la venta de prendas de oro pero con el tiempo este tipo de negocio no le favoreció por lo que los diferentes clientes no pagaron las deudas contraídas con Doña Reyna por lo que decide iniciar con otro negocio y comienza ofertando los productos como: ropa nueva, cosméticos, perfumes y prendas de plata por lo que así obtiene este negocio y sus diferentes clientes por lo que al principio le fue muy difícil conseguir lo que ha obtenido actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar una serie de compras ya que las realiza en Managua y Chinandega de los siguientes productos como cremas, perfumes, prendas de plata por lo que da las gracias a las Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que dan ayuda para que se lleven a cabo los sueños y los propósitos a cumplir.
texts.en:
Reyna del Carmen L. Balitan is 50 years old. She is not married. Reyna has 3 sons whose ages are the following: her oldest son is 26 years old and works for himself; her 24 year old son is not studying; and her youngest son, who is 22, does not study. Her life partner works for himself. Her goal is to continue with her work because it is the only source of income for her family. She has to look for the daily sustenance for her family as well as for herself. She hopes to have good health so that she can continue with her work; another of her hopes is to be able to travel because she would like to see other parts of the world. Her dream is to help her family get ahead so that in the future they can take over the business and not have any difficulties resolving problems. Reyna works in general sales and she sells products such as: blouses, underwear, socks, and other things. She is a street vendor and has had this business for 15 years. Reyna began this business because she has always liked to work, ever since she was young. This gave her the idea to begin a business selling gold jewelry, but over time this didn’t go well for her because some customers didn’t pay the debts they had with her. So, she decided to start another business and started offering products such as: new clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and silver jewelry. She established this business and gained customers. It was difficult at first, but now things are going well. The loan is for working capital so that she can make purchases in Managua and Chinandega of the following products: lotions, perfumes, and silver jewelry. She is grateful to Fundación León 2000 and the organizations that give their help so that she can carry out her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bibisoleha

texts.ru: Джунайдуллоева Бибисолеха проживает в районе Шахринау. Возрст 31 год.Замужем и имеет четверых детей.Уже семь лет занимается торговлей. Торгует одеждой. Продает товар в кишлаках. Она ходит по кишлакам из дома в дом и таким образом реализует свой товар. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет развивать бизнес и получать больший доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibisoleha J., 31, is married and has 4 children. Bibisoleha lives in Shakhrinaw region. She has been in business for 7 years. Bibisoleha sells clothing. She travels from village to village, house to house selling her goods. Bibisoleha will use this loan to increase sales volume. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to increase sales volume

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun P., 51, is a widow who lives with three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She sells chickens and vegetables at the Phnom Penh market.  She averages the equivalent of $100 in revenue per day. Two of her children are in school and one is a worker. Mrs. Oeun P. would like to take out a loan to increase her supply of chickens and vegetables, in order to meet client demands.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and vegetables.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila de 45 años, es divorciada y vive en su casa propia, no tuvo hijos, pero esa falta la compensa dándoles mucho cariño a sus 2 sobrinos, desea progresar en la vida y vivir su vida tranquila. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a lo largo de su vida ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, a trabajado en muchas cosas, pero por fin hace 7 meses pudo poner su negocio propio, ahora tiene una tienda donde vende de todo y dentro ha implementado un locutorio para que todos sus vecinos puedan llamar a sus seres queridos. Luzmila anhela que su negocio progrese y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que al mismo tiempo puede atender su locutorio y realizar los trabajos del hogar, lo que le da muchas facilidades en la distribución de su tiempo, pero le disgusta tener que quedarse todo el día en su tienda sin poder salir, aun así se siente feliz de tener su negocio propio y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sacarlo adelante. Es el segundo préstamo de Luzmila con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, igual como hizo con su primer crédito, ella es una socia muy alegre y querida en su banco comunal y espera seguir trabajando bien con todas sus socias. El dinero que solicita le servirá para surtir su tienda e implementar mejor su locutorio y así brindar un servicio óptimo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 45, is divorced and lives in her own house. She doesn't have children, but she has two [nieces and/or nephews] who she dearly loves. She wants to get ahead in life and live as well and happily as she can. She works hard, having strived all her life to get ahead, doing many things to pay her way and finally starting her own business 7 months ago. She now has a store where she sells everything and where she's set up a "locutorio" [a business providing phone and Internet services] so that her neighbors can call their loved ones. Luzmila dreams of growing her business and increasing her income. What she most likes about her business is that she can tend both the locutorio and her own house at the same time, something that allows her to balance the two. She doesn't like having to stay in the shop all day, though, without being able to go out. Nevertheless, she's very happy to have her own business and prepared to work hard to get ahead. This is Luzmila's second MPF loan and she expects to pay the installments on time, just as she did with the first loan. She is a valuable and well-regarded member of her community bank and hopes to continue working well with its members. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her store and improve her locutorio which, in turn, will allow her to provide better services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and improve shop.

loans.name: Djiguiya (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 47 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Djiguiya vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Konda, préfecture de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali.) 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité, la transformation des noix de néré  de sounbala destiné à la vente. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Djiguiya a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) le prêt  précédent à été correctement remboursé.
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de noix de néré à Sikasso pour les transformer en sounbala (un condiment très apprécié au Mali). Le sounbala ainsi fabriqué, asséché est conditionné avant d’être vendu au comptant en gros à Mopti (la cinquième région de la république du Mali) 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
All eight women in the Djiguiya group are married. They average 47 years of age and 5 children. The members of the group live in large extended traditional families in the Konda village (prefecture of San, in the Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. They run very similar businesses, namely transforming néré nuts into "sounbala" (a food condiment very much appreciated in Mali) for selling. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, the Djiguiya group sought to solve his problems by joining Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is seeking its second solidarity loan (group loan). The previous loan was repaid without problems.

The women intend to use this loan to buy sacks of néré nuts in Sikasso, in order to transform them into sounbala. It is then dried and packaged, before being wholesaled for cash in Mopti (Fifth region in the Republic of Mali). During this loan cycle, they hope to turn a profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 130) each, to be used to repay the loan and to provide for their extended families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré nuts to make soubala (a food condiment very much appreciated in Mali)

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina T., 64, is married with six children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers four days per week. 

This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala.  SPBD loans are Lina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives, an axe, a ranging pole, a wheelbarrow and a knapsack sprayer

loans.name: Inoyathon

texts.ru: Иноятхон занимается куплей продажей промышленных товаров в местном центральном универмаге. Она занимается предпринимательством уже несколько лет и этим содержит свою семью. Иноятхон 40 лет, она воспитывает 3 детей. В МикроИнвест свой первый получила для покупки мебели для дома. Погасила займ своевременно. Условия кредитования здесь понравились, и она решила получить новый займ. Она собирается приобрести для своего младшего сына комплект спутниковых антенн, телевизор и подставку для него.
texts.en:
Inoyathon is involved in buying and selling of industrial products at the local central supermarket. She has been in this business for several years and has been able to support her family. Inoyathon is 40 years old and has 3 children. She received her first loan at MicroInvest for a purchase of furniture for her home. She repaid that loan in a timely manner. Because she liked the lending terms here, Inoyathon decided to obtain another loan. She plans to purchase a satellite antenna, a television and a television stand for her youngest son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a satellite antenna, a television and a television stand

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “FLOR DE LA CANELA 2” , domiciliada en la Urbanización Municipal  Mz. G1 Lt. 14 en el distrito de calleria, tiene 63 años  y 5 hijos, algunos mayores de edad.

Se inicio con la venta de comida.  Su primer préstamo de s/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para la venta de comida, y así tener más variedades de potajes para ofrecer y así  vender más para  que le permita aumentar  sus clientes.  También compró una mesa de billar, con ello tuvo mas ingresos para su hogar.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,200 lo invertirá en la  compra de otra mesa de billar, ya que su clientela ha aumentado.
En el tiempo que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por que en el Banco Comunal ha encontrado muchas amigas con quien compartir grandes ideas de superación.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the Flor de la Canela 2 Community Bank, and she lives in the Urbanización Municipal Mz. G1 Lt. 14 in the Calleria district. She is 63 and has five children; some of the children are grown. She started selling meals. With her first loan for 300 PEN, she bought food for her meal sales. This way she has a greater variety of stews to offer. Then she sells more, which allows her to get more customers. She also bought a billiards table, which gave her more income for her home. With this loan for 1,200 PEN, she will buy another billiards table since she has more customers. She feels happy about the time that she has worked with Manuela Ramos because she has found many friends with whom she shares great ideas about improving.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a billiards table

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y madre de 9 hijos; de los cuales, 5 viven con ella en su casa, la cual construyó su esposo con la ayuda de ella. Su mayor anhelo, desde hace años atrás, es tener varias chacras cafetaleras, ahora con la ayuda de su esposo siente que está a punto de alcanzar su sueño, por lo que trabaja arduamente en sus plantaciones de café, plátano y piña. Para que le alcance el tiempo se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, a eso de las 8.00am está partiendo a sus chacras en compañía de su esposo, lo que le parece muy placentero. A Marcelina le gusta realizar los trabajos agrícolas, ama a cada uno de sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que gracias a su dedicación y cuidado le resultarán muy rentables. Por ello inculca y enseña a sus hijos a trabajar con seriedad y responsabilidad, ya que mediante la agricultura adquirieron sus bienes materiales; tales como su casa y terrenos cultivables, asimismo les brindaron comodidad a sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores ha trabajado responsablemente en sus pagos, asimismo en el cargo de presidenta de su banco comunal. En este tiempo demostró rigor y seriedad en la cobranza de los montos de cada integrante, quienes la respetan mucho. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de nitrato y potasio (fertilizantes) para abonar sus chacras de café y de plátanos; con otro tanto piensa invertir en la compra de plantas nuevas de plátanos morados.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years of age, a very hardworking woman and the mother of nine children. Five of them live with her in her house which her husband built with her help. Her greatest wish, over the past years, is to have several fields for coffee growing. Now with the help of her husband she feels that the time has come to realize her dream, and she is working hard at this in her fields of coffee, plantain and pineapple. In order to make hay while the sun shines, she gets up at 4am to prepare breakfast and lunch, so that by 8am she is leaving for the fields accompanied by her husband who always seems so agreeable. Marcelina likes doing agricultural work, she loves every one of her crops since she knows that thanks to her dedication and care they will turn out to be very profitable. And thus she instills in her children and teaches them to work seriously and responsibly since by means of agriculture the have acquired their materials rewards, such as their house and farmland and at the same time provided a comfortable life for her children. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and during the previous cycles, she has been responsible with her payments and also in her role as President of her Communal Bank. During this time she has been rigorous and serious in the collection of accounts from each participant, who all have great respect for her. The funds that she is requesting are for the purchase of nitrates and potassium fertilizers in order to fortify her coffee and plantain fields. A portion will also be invested in the purchase of purple plantain seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia,  pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar, ella se alterna con el empleo en un café snack en av. infancia, ella se dedica a procesar el café y vender, tortas, empanadas, gaseosas, te, jugos. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

Nuestra socia se encuentra agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doña Julia is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS". She is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, lives with her life partner and has 4 children. Among her chores she works at a snack cafe on Av. Infancia, she processes coffee and sells sandwiches, soft drinks, tea, juice. She requests the loan for personal use.

Our partner is grateful and appreciates the loan and the opportunity through this means and she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn J. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Ronelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ronelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells a variety of different products in the local community. Ronelyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ronelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's offerings. This is Ronelyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her store's offerings

loans.name: Novrasta

texts.en:
Novrasta M. is the married mother of five children. Knowledge from her parents and grandparents has contributed to Novrasta's work breeding sheep in a special space in her home. Her work in animal sales generates a good income for her family.

Currently she has a small herd of twelve sheep at her house. Little by little, she would like to increase the variety of her animals and is seeking a loan of 2,000 USD. Novrasta’s dream is to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sheep and fodder

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo. Todas las integrantes de este comité realizan diversas actividades con el fin de poder ayudar con los ingresos de la casa. Las actividades que realizan cada señora son: 

Griselda N.T..	Venta de Frutas
Arminda A..	Venta de mercería
Silvia L. A..	costurera
Mara Luz C..	Peluquera
Cyntia M. A..	Venta de Ropas

Gladys T.-	Venta de frutas 
Antonia T..	Venta de cigarros
Mirna R..	Decoradora
Isabel G..	Venta de ropas
Ramona R..	Modista
Florentina B..	Venta de ropas
Andrea M. R..	Venta de Carbón
Clara R. S..	Venta de artículos de limpieza
Carmen C..	Peluquera
Raimunda C..	Venta de cosméticos 
Rocio G..	Venta de mercería
Jessica P. agüero.	Venta de mercería
	


El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercaderías tales como: (Especificar en este campo el uso de los fondos. Ejemplo: compra de cosméticos como labiales, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes, colonias etc., también telas, hilos, artículos de limpieza como: detergentes, frutas como: naranja, banana, piña, melón, manzana, pera, ropas varias como: remeras, short, camisillas, pantalón, pollera, toallas, pulsera,  collar, aros, anillos.
texts.en:
This group is in its eighth loan cycle. All of the members of this group are involved in different activities. Their goal is to be able to help with the household income. Each woman’s activity follows. Griselda N.T.. Sells Fruit Arminda A.. Sells Hardware Silvia L. A.. Seamstress Mara Luz C.. Hairdresser Cyntia M. A.. Sells Clothes Gladys T.- Sells Fruit Antonia T.. Sells Cigarettes Mirna R.. Decorator Isabel G.. Sells Clothes Ramona R.. Dressmaker Florentina B.. Sells Clothes Andrea M. R.. Sells Charcoal Clara R. S.. Sells Cleaning Supplies Carmen C.. Hairdresser Raimunda C.. Sells Cosmetics Rocio G.. Sells Hardware Jessica P. agüero. Sells Hardware The loan they are asking for is to buy various merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various merchandise

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 01 hijo, ella  estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Laykacota. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta  de carnes rojas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de carnes rojas para vender en su puesto del mercado.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los prestamos
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalia is a partner of the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, Province of Puno, in the Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and has one son. She finished primary school and lives in Barrio Laykacota.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years, her initial loan was 300 new soles, money that she invested in her business buying and selling red meat.

At this time she is applying for a loan of 500 new soles for the purchase of red meat to sell at her market stall.

Her wish is to continue working. She likes the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of red meat

loans.name: Cesar Javier

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Javier M. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad que les quiere dar lo mejor y un lugar seguro donde vivir.
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia que tiene para poder obtener una casa por medio de un crédito Gubernamental, ya que actual mente vive en casa de sus suegras. Desea que su familia tenga ya su propia casa y un cuarto especial para sus niños. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en una fábrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
Cesar Javier M. is the father of two small children. He wants to give his children the best he can and a safe place to live. It's for this reason that he is requesting a loan, so that he can pay the difference that is necessary to buy a house with a government loan, given that he currently lives in his in-laws' house. He wishes for his family to have their own house and a special room for his children. He plans to repay the loan with income that he obtains from his factory job in the department of production.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the difference of the price of a house that will be partially covered by Infonavit [a government institution]

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beer and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Perina is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a chief. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 46 years old and a married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals such as beans, maize and groundnuts, to her loyal customers at the community market. She takes delivery of stock from Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and retails it to her customers.

Regina says selling these products is very lucrative and, with ten years of experience, she can increase her market share. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to expand her inventory in order to make a good income. This will help her support her family, especially her children's education, and expand her business. Regina anticipates that her sales will increase as we approach Christmas. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts, yams and beans

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Cesar es conviviente, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en casa de sus suegros en caserío El Virrey, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años el se dedica a la crianza de ovejas en el caserío El Morante y todos los días, montado en su mulo, cuida a sus animales mientras pastan. Cesar vende sus animales a los compradores que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio es la única fuente que le provee de ingresos.

Hace poco empezó la construcción de su casa, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alterniva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de calaminas y adobes.

Juan es un joven responsable y trabajador. Su más grande sueño es terminar de construir su casa para darle un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar, 28, has a life partner and lives in his in-laws' home in the El Virrey farmstead, Olmos district, located two hours and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years he has raised sheep in the El Morante farmstead and every day, riding his mule, he cares for his animals while they are at pasture. Cesar sells his animals to buyers who frequent the area. This work is his sole source of income. A short while ago he began to build his house and he needs financing, for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, of 1000 soles to buy metal sheeting and adobe bricks. Juan is a responsible, hard-working young man. His greatest wish is to finish building his house to provide a secure dwelling for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and adobe to build housing.

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
La señora Carla Pastrana tiene su propio tramo en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde vende todo tipo de carteras, falas y billeteras ofreciéndolas a los clientes que visitan el mercado y habiendo mejorado poco a poco a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo.
Ella se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora ya que desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ya está atendiendo su negocio. El crédito que ella solicita es para utilizarlo en la compra de las carteras, fajas y billeteras para continuar vendiéndolas y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Carla Pastrana has a sales stall in Chinandega's Central Market where she sells all kinds of purses, wallets and belts to customers who visit the market daily to do their shopping. As time has gone by, her business has improved bit by bit. She is very hard-working and is at the helm of her business from very early in the morning. The financing she is asking for is to buy purses, belts and wallets to increase her stock inventory so that sales will contine to allow her to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purses, belts and wallets.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B. is from the village of Guinawon, Panalsalan, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Mercedita is married and has 4 school-age children.

To make a living, Mercedita sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mercedita joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seafood products to sell.

loans.name: Gamarra Ramirez's Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. M., TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE SON SU APOYO Y SU ALICIENTE PARA SALIR ADELANTE, ELLA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES SOLIDARIAS", ELEGIDA RECIENTEMENTE POR SUS 9 COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA. ELLAS RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. M., SE DEDICA HACE CINCO MESES A LA ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE DESARROLLA EN UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL ALQUILADO. ELLA INICIÓ GRACIAS AL APOYO QUE RECIBIÓ DE EDAPROSPO, EMPEZANDO CON LA ELABORACION DE  MANUALIDADES,LUEGO INICIÓ CON PIÑATERÍA Y POCO A POCO INCURSIONÓ EN LA ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS,POR AHORA TODO LO QUE OFRECE EN CUANTO A EQUIPOS Y MOBILIARIO ES ALQUILADO.
LE GUSTARÍA CRECER EN EL NEGOCIO Y LLEGAR HA TENER UNA EMPRESA RECONOCIDA EN LA LINEA DE ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS. 
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO Y COMPRARÁ SILLAS Y MESAS.
texts.en:
Señora María is 50-years-old and has 2 children who are her support and her incentive to get ahead. She is a member of the group, "Mujeres Solidarias," and she was recently elected as president of the board by the 9 other members. They live in the district of Carabayllo. Señora María has made a living by planning events for 5 months. She does this is a small rented location. She started her business thanks to the support she received from Edaprospo. She started by making crafts and later started a piñata store. Little by little, she started planning events. As of now, everything she offers in terms of equipment and furniture is rented. She would like to grow her business and reach the point where she has a well-known company in the line of event planning. She will use the requested loan to invest in her business and to purchase tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of furniture she has for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: N. Christine vit depuis 20 ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADJAGBE Michel un pêcheur, Christine est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Zogbo. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Depuis environs 20 ans, Christine vend des crevettes fumées au marché Gbogbanou, ce qui lui procure des revenus qu'elle utilise pour faire face à ses différentes charges. Christine s'approvisionne au bord de la lagune à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de ses clients, Christine n'arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients. Christine ambitionne augmenter le stock de ses produits pour mieux faire face à la demande des clients. C'est ce qui amène Christine à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Christine has been living for twenty years in the Zogbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to ADJAGBE Michel, a fisherman, she is the mother of three children. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents in Zogbo. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. For about twenty years, Christine has been selling smoked shrimp at the Gbogbanou market, and this brings in the revenues she uses to cope with her different responsibilities. She supplies herself from the shores of the lagoon in Cotonou. She is a previous client of ALIDé having already benefited from two loans, which have been repaid. Facing the demand from more and more customers, she no longer manages to satisfy them all. Her ambition is to increase her stock of goods in order to cope better with customer demands. This is what brings Christine to request a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shrimp in bulk

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 40 años, tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (40) y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; Luz (21), Liz (15) y Manuel (12).
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es por eso que cuando se le presenta la oportunidad de un nuevo negocio lo toma, ya que sabe que todo lo realizado con esfuerzo y trabajo siempre tiene su recompensa. Por ello, cuando empezó con la venta de ropa de dormir y polos no tuvo temor, es una muy buena comerciante y trabaja dejando las prendas al crédito.
Por otro lado, también vende productos de belleza de una marca reconocida, y como si fuera poco, durante los fines de semana madruga para preparar tamales (platillo a base de maíz) y venderlos afuera de una panadería de la zona donde vive. 
Estas tres actividades que desempeña le gustan mucho porque se distrae y le generan buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un puesto de ropa en un mercado de su localidad, para tener un lugar estable.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para empezar con la venta por  temporada de verano, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Nelly, de 40 años, tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (40) y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; Luz (21), Liz (15) y Manuel (12). Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es por eso que cuando se le presenta la oportunidad de un nuevo negocio lo toma, ya que sabe que todo lo realizado con esfuerzo y trabajo siempre tiene su recompensa. Por ello, cuando empezó con la venta de ropa de dormir y polos no tuvo temor, es una muy buena comerciante y trabaja dejando las prendas al crédito. Por otro lado, también vende productos de belleza de una marca reconocida, y como si fuera poco, durante los fines de semana madruga para preparar tamales (platillo a base de maíz) y venderlos afuera de una panadería de la zona donde vive. Estas tres actividades que desempeña le gustan mucho porque se distrae y le generan buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un puesto de ropa en un mercado de su localidad, para tener un lugar estable. Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para empezar con la venta por temporada de verano, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por cumplir. Nelly, 40 years old, has a lot of desire to progress. She lives in her own house with her husband Manuel (40) and her children; Luz(21), Liz (15) and Manuel (12). She is an enterprising and hard working woman, and because of this, when an opportunity to start a new business presents itself, she takes it since she knows that she can accomplish anything with a lot of effort and she knows that hard work always has its reward. Because of this, when she started selling sleepwear and polos she wasn’t afraid, she is a good saleswoman and works selling her clothes to her clients on credit. She also sells a recognized brand of beauty products and if that weren’t enough, on the weekends she wakes up early to prepare tamales (a corn flour based dish) and sells them outside a bakery in the area where she lives. She loves these three activities that she performs because they keep her occupied and they generate good earnings that allow her to help with household expenses. For the future, she plans on installing a clothing shop in a market in her neighborhood in order to have a more stable place to sell. This is the fourth loan she has had from MFP and she promises to be punctual with each payment when the amount is due since she would like to have access to loans in the future. With the money that she’s asking for she will buy a larger quantity of clothes in order to start selling summer clothing since she already has a lot of orders she needs to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Shane Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Jose Edison

texts.en:
Jose Edison P., from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 30 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jose Edison owns and operates a service-based business whose main income is derived from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Jose Edison has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jose Edison joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials needed to provide service, he is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Jose Edison's second loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat A. M. is a 50 year old married father of five children.  He has been operating a taxi business for sixteen years.  He was previously a care-taker in Buruburu Church of God before he ventured into business. He also earns extra income from farming.  Josphat has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and he has previously participated by taking out five loans.  He appreciates that he has been taught by Faulu Kenya how to pay back his loans and to be alert on issues concerning his business.  Josphat has requested a loan of Kes.74,754 to pay school fees for his three children who are still in school. In the future, Josphat hopes to own a plot in Nairobi and to build residential houses.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Benson Wilsham

texts.en:
Benson Wilsham is a carpenter in Bukura town. He is married to Risper Mapesa and they have two children aged 8 and 3 years.

Benson has been in the carpentry business for the last four years and has been able to meet the family expenses out of the profits made.

He is taking his first loan from KADET and he intends to pay it well without default. Benson hopes the loan will enable him to expand his business by buying more timber, timber glue, and nails.

His future dream is to expand his business into wholesale and also to buy some latest carpentry machines in the market to enable him to work fast and efficiently.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wine and drinks to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene  25  años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de ropa desde hace dos años, es por ello que viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima, para comprar su mercadería que luego son llevadas a otras ciudades de clima cálido a vender su mercadería. Desde entonces sus ganancias se perciben cada semana, pese que a veces los constantes  viajes tienen sus riesgos por las excesivas lluvias que se presentan, aún así esta actividad le da mucha satisfacción, por que le permite crecer económicamente. Anhela  crecer su capital y tener mayores ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de polos y shorts al por mayor.
texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old. She is a single mother and she lives with her two children in a rented house. She has been self employed selling clothing for two years. This is why she travels periodically to the city of Lima to purchase merchandise that is then taken to other warm-climate cities to sell. Since then, she has made a profit every week, despite the fact that the constant travelling is risky due to the excessive rain that exists. Even so, this activity gives her a lot of satisfaction, because it allows her to grow economically. She wishes to grow her capital and have higher profits. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her payments, and she considers that this sum will be very useful in her business' progress. She will invest the loan she is asking for in polo shirts and shorts, bought wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts and shorts wholesale.

loans.name: Paloma Blanca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Paloma Blanca. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Toluca en el Estado  de México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes.
Guadalupe C. B.  es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 48 años, estudió hasta el 6° año de primaria,  es comerciante y tiene en total 7 hijos 3 mujeres y 4 varones.  Ella se dedica a las ventas por catalogo que inició hace 15  años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en blancos, tupperware y zapatos andrea: Sus clientes son vecinas empleadas de diferentes lados pues ella se dedica a mostrar sus catálogos cerca de las comunidades y colonias de Toluca además de realizar tandas para que sus clientes puedan adquirir sus productos mas cerca.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta pues ya tiene algunos pedidos.   También espera poder comprar un terreno junto con su esposo para poder ayudar a sus hijos casados.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
CLAUDIA ALEJANDRA JIMENES M.     VENTA DE  ROPA
ANA LIDIA F. B.             VENTA DE ZAPATO POR CATALOGO
OLIVIA B. M.               VENTA DE MEDICINA NATURISTA
ADELAIDA R. C.           VENTA DE EXTINGUIDORES
BRISA NAYELI G. V.         VENTA DE RECAUDERIA
PATRICIA G. G.              VENTA DE DULCES Y TUPPERWARE
AGUSTINA S. B.             VENTA DE PLASTICOS
GABRIELA V. S.           VENTA DE HERBALIFE Y ROPA
MARIA DE JESUS S. B.        VENTA DE PAPELERIA
texts.en:
This group is named Paloma Blanca (white dove). It is located in the community of Toluca in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. Guadalupe C. B. is the president of the group. She is 48, studied up to the sixth year of primary school, is a merchant and has a total of seven children: three girls and four boys. She is dedicated to selling by catalog which she started 15 years ago. She is requesting a loan to invest in tupperware and Andrea brand shoes. Her customers are her neighbors, employed in different areas so she is dedicated to showing catalogs close to the communities and colonies of Toluca in addition to making rounds so her customers can acquire her products close by. At the time of requesting this loan, she feels happy since she already has some orders. Also, she hopes to be able to buy some land with her husband to they can help their married children. The other members of the group are: CLAUDIA ALEJANDRA JIMENES M. SELLING CLOTHING ANA LIDIA F. B. SELLING CATALOG SHOES OLIVIA B. M. SELLING NATURAL MEDICINES ADELAIDA R. C. SELLING EXTINGUISHERS BRISA NAYELI G. V. SELLING PRODUCE PATRICIA G. G. SELLING SWEETS AND TUPPERWARE AGUSTINA S. B. SELLING PLASTICS GABRIELA V. S. SELLING HERBALIFE AND CLOTHING MARIA DE JESUS S. B. SELLING PAPER

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in tupperware and Andrea brand shoes.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn N. is 45 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she operates a small business selling groceries from home. In addition, Sorn N. built a pigpen where she raises a few pigs for extra income. She is widowed and the mother of two teenage kids, both of whom are no longer in school, and they currently work in different field. Sorn N. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time in order to earn money to ensure that the family has a better life. Sorn N. is taking out her first loan to support her in the farming activity and to buy grocery inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To support her in the farming activity and to buy grocery inventory for her shop

loans.name: Diaz

texts.es: Díaz, es un laborioso hombre de 44 años, que está separado de su pareja desde hace 15 años, tiene dos hijos pero sólo vive con el menor de ellos, en su casa propia. A un kilómetro de distancia, desde la comunidad de “Zutzuki”, se encuentran ubicados los hermosos cultivos de yuca, plátanos, frutas cítricas y achiote. Este camino lo recorre diariamente, de acuerdo a los cuidados que tiene que proporcionar  a sus tierras, en el caso de los plátanos, luego de limpiarlos y nutrirlos con abono orgánico espera quince días para cosecharlos. El esmero y los cuidados adecuados que brinda a sus plantaciones, han hecho que sea uno de los mejores productores de la zona y por tal da gracias a su hijo que lo apoyó mucho en el trabajo. Díaz, lleva 20 años en este oficio y lo que más le apasiona es cosechar y vender sus frutos, así como también le disgusta pagar montos excesivos para el traslado de su cosecha a la ciudad. Las ganancias que percibe los invierten en el cuidado de sus tierras y por ello quiere alternar y renovar sus frutos para ganar más utilidades mediante la siguiente productividad. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y asegura que será cumplido en cada uno de los pagos, porque desea seguir progresando y pedir más préstamos, junto a los integrantes de su grupo  comunal con quienes le gusta trabajar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de decenas de plantas de guanábana, frutas cítricas y plátanos, con las cuales renovará sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Díaz is a hard working 44 year old man who has been separated from his wife for the past 15 years. He has two children but only his youngest son lives with him. Located one kilometer away, in the community of Zutzuki, are beautiful groves of yucca, bananas, citrus fruit, and achiote. He travels this road daily in order to be able to care for his land. For his bananas, he clears the land, applies organic fertilizer, and will wait two more weeks before harvesting. The care he gives his plantations have made him one of the top producers in the zone. He is grateful to his son, who helps him very much with his work. Díaz has been doing this for 20 years and what he enjoys the most is harvesting and selling his fruit, although he doesn’t like having to pay the high cost of transporting his fruit to the city. He reinvests his income into the land and he wants to alternate and renovate his plants in order to increase his revenue at the next harvest. This will be his second loan through MFP and he assures us that he will be on time with his payments, because he wants to continue to move ahead and be able to get other loans in the future, along with the other members of his communal group, with whom he enjoys working. He will use the money from this loan to invest in scores of fruit trees with which he will renovate his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit trees

loans.name: Evita

texts.es:
Evita tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Cruz VerD. del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo D. frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a labores asociadas a la ganadería, ella cría ganado ovino y vacuno: las ovejas son criadas para ofrecerlas en venta cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo y las vacas son criadas para comercializar la leche que producen diariamente. Con estos ingresos ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento diario D. la economía familiar.

Evita desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la calidad D. crianza D. sus animales y obtener una mejor producción que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer entragada a su familia y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo D. sus seres queridos, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Evita is 56 years old, married and lives with her husband in the village of Cruz VerD., in the TambogranD. district. This district works mainly in the cultivation of fruits, which are processed for export to other countries. It is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Province of Piura, in the Piura region. Evita has worked for more than five years in activities related to cattle-breeding. She raises both sheep and cattle: the sheep are bred to be sold once they have reached a good stage in development and the cows are bred in order to sell their milk which they produce daily. With this income she supports her husband daily with the family finances. Evita wants to buy feed to improve the quality of upbringing of her animals and to obtain greater production so that she can further her business. To achieve this goal, she has seen the need to request her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $725. Evita is a woman who is devoted to her family who always looks after the welfare and progress of her loved ones. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances regard her as reputable and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for improved upbringing of animals that are to be sold.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a member of the Winners Kitengela group in Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner. He does transport business using his car. He has three years of experience in this business and has one employee. Besides being a businessman, he is a church pastor. 

Richard, who is married with five children, works hard to provide for the family. Currently, his greatest challenge is repairing his car, which is in bad condition. Hence, he is requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts. He hopes to open his own transport company in the future so as to get huge business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en: Nelda C. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old and is married with seven adult children. Nelda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Nelda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar lives in a two room brick house in a small city called Borewala, which is located in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years with her family. Kousar has two sons and a daughter. All are illiterate and could not get an education due to financial problems.

She is a housewife and stays at home to take care of her family. She manages the household chores. She also works part-time as an embroiderer for her neighborhood clients so she can contribute financially to her family.

Her husband is a painter. He paints walls, doors and windows to earn money. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years.

Kousar has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. He will use the loan to buy paint of different colors so he can improve his business.

She is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his income and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To purchase paint boxes for painting business

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jane U., 33 years old, is from the village of Manaring. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary Jane U..

Mary Jane is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Mrs. Eang L., aged 49, is married with 11 children, five of whom are married and six who are single. She is a domestic rice trader who owns a rice cultivating machine inside her home. She provides a plowing service to her neighbors. Her husband works with her in the business. Usually Mrs. Eang L. generates around $5 profit a day to meet the needs of her family. For this crop farming season, she needs capital to buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting. This is why she has requested a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting

loans.name: Gantogoo

texts.en:
Gantogoo D. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hentiy province in Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Both of her elder sons, ages 23 and 21, are students, and her younger three children all attend the local high school. Her husband is a herder and they own 200 head of livestock. 

Gantogoo operates a sewing business with the help of her siblings. She has been engaged in this business for the past five years and has gained much business experience as well as many permanent customers. She usually produces large sized items such as ger covers and ceilings, curtains and layers of felt. She also creates a variety of traditional clothes according to her customers' orders. 

In the future, she wants to have her own workplace. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her children's tuition fees. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase an electronic sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase an electronic sewing machine

loans.name: Rosalia Josefina

texts.es: Josefina trabaja arduamente en sus chacras de la zona rural de Huarochirí, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de tunas y cochinilla, hace mucho tiempo con el esfuerzo conjunto de su conyugue logro comprar dos chacras y actualmente se esmera para rentar dos mas y lograr sus ganancias. La fortuna de que su esposo labore como controlador en ferrovías le ha dado cierta seguridad. Además de invertir en la compra de abonos para su chacras, josefina está interesada en premiar a una de sus hijas que le ha presentado muy buenas calificaciones y por haber logrado ser una de las mejores alumnas en su centro educativo, invertirá en su paseo de promoción de su colegio en merito a su esfuerzo. Una de sus metas es que su otro hijo que se está capacitando como mecánico automotriz  tenga una factoría o taller para que se desenvuelva en su profesión. En nuestra foto se puede apreciar a josefina y  a Matías su hijo menor.
texts.en: Josefina works hard in her fields, located in the rural zone of Huarochirí, where she grows prickly pears and cultivates cochineal [an insect used to make red dye]. A long time ago, she and her husband were able to buy two small fields, and now Josefina would like to rent two more improve her earnings. Fortunately her husband works as a railroad controller, which has given them a certain degree of security. Along with investing in fertilizer for her fields, Josefina would like to reward one of her daughters for earning very good grades. She came out as one of the best students in her school, and Josefina would like to pay for for her high school's graduation trip in recognition of her efforts. One of Josefina's goals is for her son, who is studying to be an auto mechanic, to have a factory or workshop where he can develop his trade. In the photo above, you can see Josefina with her youngest son, Matías.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia T. runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business in Albur, Bohol. She sells vinegar, coffee and other various products. She is asking for a loan to expand her business to maximize her profits buy offering additional merchandise. 

The additional inventory will mean that she will be able to provide for the increasing needs in her household, as well as afford better medical care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase softdrinks and other goods

loans.name: Yader Fernando

texts.es: Yader de 44 años, se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi vive con su hijo de 13 años, que está a su cargo. Inicio como chofer de otro taxi, ya que no tenía suficiente capital, por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Sus servicios los ofrece todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, por lo que no puede trabajar hasta muy tarde por los problemas. El quiere seguir con su negocio para seguir manteniendo a su familia. Por eso necesita el financiamiento para la compra de llantas, repuestos y ciertas reparaciones que tiene que hacer a su unidad.  En el futuro quiere obtener otro taxi y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio.
texts.en: Yader, 44, lives with his 13 year old son, and he has a taxi.  He started as a driver for another taxi since he didn’t have enough capital, but he has always been looking for a way to increase his income.  He works every day from 6 in the morning to 10 at night but he can’t work later because of the problems.  He wants to continue with his business so that he can keep supporting his family.  That is why he needs financing so that he can buy tires, replacement parts, and for some repairs that he needs to make on his car.  In the future he would like to have another taxi and continue offering good service.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam P. is from the village of Libertad, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 31 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Merriam owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. She also runs a business doing videoke or karaoke where customers pays five pesos for every song.  Merriam has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Merriam joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell.  Merriam is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Merriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been in the farming business for twelve years now. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and eggs which she sells to the local market. 

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the living standards of her family. Her primary challenge in farming has been lack of storage facilities for her dairy feed during the dry seasons. She hopes that in the next five years, she will have acquired 6 more dairy cows and be the major supplier of milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

Hellen is 66 years old and married with 8 children who are all adults, two of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vilma Lisseth

texts.es:
Vilma Lisseth L. López  en  1992 inicio a  comercializar de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos, prenda y cosmético. Esta señora trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora ha sido beneficiada por Adim tanto por la oferta de crédito como con los programas de desarrollo empresarial  y autonomía personal que le ayudado a  tener mayor  libertad, a conocer y explotar sus capacidades, estar segura de sí misma y administrar su negocio.  
Ella invertirá su crédito para adquirir mercadería en ropa, zapatos, prendas, tinte, champú, desodorante, perfumes y con ello levantar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In 1992 Vilma Lisseth L. López started selling clothes, shoes, garments and cosmetics as an itinerant street vendor.  This hard-working, enterprising lady has benefited from help from ADIM both through loans and through their business development and personal independence programs which have helped her to have more freedom, to be aware of and to exploit her skills, to be sure of herself and to run her business.

Vilma will invest her loan in acquiring merchandise: clothes, shoes, garments, dyes, shampoos, deodorants and perfumes to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., is from the barangay (village) of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Amalia is a widow and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living Amalia has been working as an OFW (overseas Filipino worker) for over fifteen years and earns approximately $538 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for placement fees for her son. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her work to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For placement fees for her son

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet T. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who is in school.  Juliet has a business of selling table cloths.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Juliet sells her products door-to-door, by means of wholesale.  Juliet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads.  The main business challenges for Juliet include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own permanent business premises, to build her own house, and also to educate her child up to university.  Juliet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads for making table cloths

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda A. is from the village of Flores, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Ermelinda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ermelinda operates a family member's agricultural business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Ermelinda has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ermelinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Ermelinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ermelinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. O. is 24 years old and married to a casual laborer. They have two children aged 5 and 2. 

Her business is located at Manyatta estate in Kisumu, Kenya. Kisumu is the region of Kenya known for production of fish and well known as the lake basin. 

Lydia owns a food kiosk and serves ready-made food to the local people. She has been in that business for the last four years and has managed to employ four employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of KES 25,000 to renovate the business premises in order to attract more business. She hopes to expand her business and open outlets. She also hopes to give her children quality education to the university level. She describes herself as social, kind and boring.

loans.use: To renovate the business premises

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria A. D. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 1 hijo que depende de ella, vive en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 14 años y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia que tiene desde hace 3 años, sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria que no tiene en existencia y que son productos exigidos por sus clientes.
Doña  gloria es una mujer seria y de principios cristianos.
su meta es que su negocio crezca y que sea el mejor de la zona.
texts.en:
Gloria A. D., 40, is married and has one dependent child.  She has lived in the town of Altos de la Cruz for 14 years, and she has had a grocery store for 3 years.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends.  

She will use this loan to purchase groceries that she does not have in stock that are in demand by her customers.

Gloria is a serious woman with Christian values.  Her goal is to have her business grow and become the best in the area.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juice, flour, tortillas, butter, margarine, cooking oil, sauces, pasta, toilet paper, soap, water, candles and batteries

loans.name: Oth

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Oth S., who has been working in this sector for many years. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they generate an income of around US $ 2.50 per day. This humble couple have five single children; three are students, while the other two are employed as sewing workers in Phnom Penh city.
