This family’s living conditions are not so good because their lattices are broken down. To solve the trouble, Oth S. has requested a loan to buy some lattices to use for flooring in her house.

loans.use: to buy some lattices to use for flooring in her house

loans.name: Mti Pesa Group

texts.en:
S. U. is in his early thirties and is married with one small kid. He has a general store where he also sells vouchers for telephones. He has had this business for 4 years and works from 6.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be S.'s eighth loan from Tujijenge Teanzania. He used the previous loans to improve and expand his shop. He has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase the general store inventory. His dream is to one day have a very big general store and to build his own house.

S. will share this loan with his loan group, "Mti Pesa", which has a total of 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, S. is second from left, front row.

loans.use: To increase his general store inventory.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. displays smoked fish on a wooden tray for sale. She is married and has eight dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has been a fishmonger for close to 10 years. 

Helena uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Helena will use the loan to buy fish and firewood to smoke the fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to add the sale of other food items to her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and firewood to smoke the fish for sale.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is single and has a firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and works hard to support her family. 

Gleceria requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy firewood to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de bijoux depuis 2009, Akuvi est mariée à un frigoriste et ils ont 01 enfant. Sa passion c’est de rendre belle toutes personnes et ce prêt lui servira à acheter de nouveaux bijoux pour pouvoir accroitre son stock qu’elle a l’habitude d’acheter au Bénin et à Lomé. Elle veut avoir sa propre boutique pour mieux s’installer et répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: A strolling costume jewelry seller since 2009, Akuvi is married to a specialist in cooling and they have one child. Akuvi's passion is to make everyone pretty and this loan allow her to buy more jewelry to add to her stock which she customarily purchases in Bénin and in Lomé. She wants to have her own little boutique so that she can settle in and respond to the ever-growing demand for her wares.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, de 15, 10 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y las menores en escuela. El marido es chofer profesional.
 
Ella para poder ganar algo de dinero y  sentirse útil se dedica al comercio y al cuidado de su hogar. Ella vende telas y productos naturales, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes a los que vende sus productos, las telas deja en ciertos colegios y escuelas que elaboran los uniformes de los estudiantes y también entrega a costureras y sastres. Trabaja cuatro días de la semana y da crédito a sus clientes. Lleva más de cinco años en esta actividad y la mercadería  le envían desde Quito cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito es para comprar telas de todo tipo y productos naturales. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un almacén
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro community bank meet in 30 de Septiembre neighborhood, in Rocafuerte canton.  This area is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals make.  They are famous all over the country.

Here we meet 36 year-old Ana who lives with her common-law husband and has three children aged 15, 10 and 8.  Her eldest is in high school and her younger two are in elementary school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

In order to earn some money and feel useful, Ana is a saleswoman and also looks after her household.  She sells fabric and natural products door to door.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers to whom she sells her products.  She leaves the fabrics in certain high schools and elementary schools that make student uniforms and also delivers to seamstresses and tailors.  Ana works four days a week and provides her goods on credit.  She has been in this business for more than five years and she is sent her merchandise from Quito when she needs it.

Ana will use this loan to buy all kinds of fabric and natural products.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are easy to obtain.

Ana's dream is to own a store.

loans.use: to buy fabric and natural products

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 22 years old and hardworking business lady.  She has been operating a cafeteria to earn a living.  

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on business management.  This has helped her to improve her business hence raising her standard of living.  She wants in the next five years to expand her cafeteria into a restaurant and be able to generate sufficient income to spend and save.  She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicken for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy chicken for restaurant

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is 25 years old, single, and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jessica is a fisher. She raises fish in a fishpond to earn a living. She raises fish like milkfish and tilapia. She has been in this business for two years. Every quarter, she earns a total average of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fingerlings and fish feeds. Jessica has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jessica hopes to raise fish large-scale and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings and fish feeds.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un homme marié et pere de trois enfants dont les deux fréquentent l’école primaire. Il  est soudeur métallique et récupére du fer et de l’aluminium pour en faire des fourneaux, des marmites et des calebasses.Il utilise ses revenus dans la prise en charge des besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires et sanitaires de sa famille.Il a démaré cette activité en 2003 avec un montant de 150000F pour la location d’un magasin au marché central et l’achat d’outils de travail.Il est sociétaire de l’IMCEC  et sollicite un prêt de 400000F pour augmenter sa production en confectionnant 20 marmites, 100fourneaux,80 fourneaux PM,50 calebasses.Aujourd’hui, son ambition est de réaliser l’extension de son atelier en le scindant en deux parties, l’une pour la confection et l’autre pour l’exposition et la vente. Il envisage aussi d’acquérir du matériel plus moderne et plus performant.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married man and the father of three children, of whom two attend primary school. He is a welder, and he acquires iron and aluminum for making stoves, cooking pots, and calabashes. He uses his income to feed, clothes, and care for the health of his family. He started this business in 2003 with the sum of 150,000 francs for leasing a store at the central market and for buying work tools. 

He is an associate of IMCEC and is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to increase his production by making 20 cooking pots, 100 stoves, 80 'PM' stoves, and 50 calabashes.  

Today, his ambition is to complete an extension of his workshop by dividing it: one part for manufacturing and the other part for displays and sales. He also envisions acquiring more modern and effective tools and equipment.

loans.use: to buy 20 cooking pots, 100 stoves, 80 PM stoves, and calabashes

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 35 years old and married with two children, ages four and 16. For the past three years, she has been running a small cosmetics boutique where she sells cosmetics and beauty products to all types of customers around her shop. Rachel describes herself as obedient.

Rachel is requesting a loan to purchase additional cosmetic and beauty products. This will be her sixth loan with SMEP and she is a wonderful client who repays her loans on time. Rachael hopes to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is 41 years of age and married with four children. Melina owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Melina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Melina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Melina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en: Alfayo is a businessman who is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, he has been selling clothes to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him manage his business. In the next five years, he wants to transform his business into a boutique. His dream is to open an electronics shop. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Armonia 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Armonia II lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha Lorena de 46 años  quien es la coordinadora del grupo. En el 2000 inició vendiendo pozol y tiste luego con las ganancias y los préstamos empezó a realizar tortillas, yoltamal, elotes cocidos, güirilas y hace poco vende chatarra. 

Martha tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo los cuatro menores dependen de ella y son los que le ayudan el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de chatarra principalmente y un poquito en cada negocio. Su meta principal es mejora las condiciones de su vivienda.

Las otras integrantes son Claudia Vanessa de 27 años quien vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos, Debora Rebeca de 23 años  vende nacatamales, frijoles y tortillas desde hace 2 años ½ y María Teresa de 38 años quien vende tortillas y frijoles, cuajadas y leñas.
texts.en:
The “Armonia (Harmony) II” Group is made up of 4 hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is Martha Lorena, 46 years old, who is coordinator of the group. In the year 2000 she began selling pozol (a hominy and pork dish) and later, with her earnings and loans, she began to prepare tortillas, tamales, boiled corn-on-the-cob, and other local specialties; then recently, she began selling scrap metal.

Martha has 6 children, of whom 4 minors still depend on her, and are helping out in her business. The loan will be used principally to buy scrap metal and a  little of the remaining funds will be invested in each area of her business. Martha's main goal is to improve the condition of her house.

The other group members are Claudia Vanessa who is 27 years old and sells tortillas and cooked beans; Debora Rebeca, who is 23 and has sold tamales, beans, and tortillas for 2 ½ years now; and Maria Teresa, who is 38 and sells tortillas and beans, cottage cheese, and firewood.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to recycle.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru: On jenat i imeyt 3 detey. Rovshan 51 qod. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so sovyey semyoy. Rovshan seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Rovshan is married and has three children.  He is 51 years old.  Rovshan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his family in the Fuzuli region.  Rovshan currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and increase livestock quantity.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is applying for another loan to start a new rental house business. She will use this 80,000 Kes loan to purchase timber for roofing, doors, windows an shutters, and other construction materials. In the future, Rebecca aspires to continue improving her business and eventually buy another plot of land for rental houses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Rebecca has built a new home for her family and greatly improved their standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase timber for roofing, doors, windows and shutters, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa is 54 years old. She is married.

Roquesa has a "sari-sari" or variety store which sells food items like canned goods, biscuits, chips, and candies. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, biscuits, chips, and candies.

Roquesa joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items like canned goods, chips, biscuits, and candies which are intended for resale.

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es:
Rubia, esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, ya que necesita comprar abono y herbicidas, también comprara unas plantas de chile, ella se decidió por el nuevo financiamiento debido al buen manejo que realizo en el préstamo anterior, ya que le permitió incrementar la producción y ganar en las ventas.
Su familia continua siempre trabajando, están contentos con los préstamos que Rubia está tomando, pues sirven para el trabajo de todos.
texts.en:
Rubia is now seeking a new loan as she needs to buy fertilizer and herbicides as well as some chili plants. She decided to apply for this new loan as she managed to pay back the first one easily, and it helped her to increase production and make more sales.

Her family continues working too. They are happy with the loans that Rubia is able to obtain as they help with everyone’s work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and chili plants

loans.name: Saf Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Saf Sa jeker a été crée depuis  l inauguration du du banc villageois il est composé de 14 membres,qui sont toutes issus du meme village et partageant des valeurs sociales communes.
Le fondement de ce groupe est basé à partir de leur entente et de l existence de bonnes relations qui les lient depuis longtemps.
Madame Agnès responsable du groupe est une femme veuve agée de 42 ans et mère de deux enfants.
Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis sa formation, elle est debout à droite de la photo.
Agnès fait un petit commerce de détail avec la vente de poissons séchés du mil du mais qu elle revend au niveau de son village lors des marchés hebdomadaire.
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va se procurer la marchandises pré cité pour faire marcher son activité génératrice de revenu .
Les bénéfices qu elle réalisé lui permettront d assurer la dépense quotidienne et acheter des manuels scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en: The Saf Sa Jeker cooperative group was created at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois.  It is made up of 14 members, all from the same village and sharing common social values.  The group's foundation is based on their longstanding relationships and mutual understanding.  Madame Agnès, the group leader, is a 42-year-old widow and mother of two.  She has been a member of this Banc Villageois since its formation, and is standing at right in the photo.  Agnès has a small retail business selling dried fish, millet, and corn, which she resells in her village at weekly markets.  With her new loan, she will buy more merchandise to increase her revenue.  The profit she makes will allow her to meet her daily expenses and buy school books for her children.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, millet, corn, and peanuts.

loans.name: Las Orquideas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Orquídeas esta formado por 6 socias y un socio quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como La Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y de un corazón cálido como nuestras socias quienes son personas luchadoras, muy trabajadores quienes con su sacrificio a diario aportan a la economía de sus hogares para salir con  sus familia.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Ines, tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una niña de 5 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María Ines se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hija que aun es pequeña, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, trabaja sin un horario ni día fijo, vende sus productos a sus amigas y conocidas.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para tener más variedad.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Las Orquídeas [The Orchids] communal bank has seven members: six women and one man. They live in different areas in Cuenca city. This city is known as the city of La Santa Ana de los Cuatro Rios. It was designated a UNESCO World Heritage city in 1999. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind, warm-hearted people, and our group members are no exception. They are strong, hard-working people who sacrifice themselves daily to provide for their families.

Mrs. Maria Ines is a member of this group. She is 23, in a common-law marriage, and has one five-year-old daughter who attends school in the city. Her husband is a taxi driver. They do not have their own home; they rent.

Mrs. Maria Ines does the housework and cares for her young daughter. In her free time she sells various brands of cosmetics. She works without a fixed schedule, and sells her products to her friends and acquaintances.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of perfume, creams, and cosmetics in order to have a greater variety of products.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella administra una panadería, inicio con el apoyo de su madre y su esposo, el negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación, no hay un horario establecido porque depende de la demanda, ya posee experiencia y en el negocio trabajan todos hasta sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan como es harina, manteca, huevos, azúcar, levadura, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar e incrementar la producción de pan, atendiendo mejor a la clientela.
La aspiración de Rosa es que su negocio crezca, adquirir su propia casa y proveer para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and children.  She runs a bakery, which she opened with support from her mother and husband.  The business is located in her house.  Her schedule isn't set, but depends on demand.  She's got experience, and everyone works in the business, even the kids.  

Rosa is seeking a loan to buy bread-baking ingredients like flour, lard, eggs, sugar, and yeast.  This investment will help her improve and increase bread production, offering better service to her clientele.  She aspires to grow the business, get her own house, and provide the necessities to her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, eggs, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 65 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 10 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC TENDAL está conformada  por 11 integrantes entre hombres y mujeres se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la cooperativa.

Vicente  se dedica a la Agricultura a los sembríos de café, cacao, guineo, plátano verde y naranja.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en  San José del Tambo cada mes. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, plantas de cacao, fertilizantes, abonos, líquidos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la producción y tener mejores ingresos para la  familia.

El sueño es  aumentar los sembríos y la producción para tener un mejor estilo de vida.Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado son las vías en mal estado.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir, es respetuoso, responsable y le gustan las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Vicente is sixty-five, married, and has four children.  He lives in Chillanes, Bolívar Province with his wife and children, aged eighteen, sixteen, fourteen, and ten.

The Tendal communal bank has eleven members, both men and women, and is located forty-five minutes from the cooperative.

Vicente is in agriculture: he grows coffee, cacao, bananas, green plantains, and oranges.  He buys and sells in San José del Tambo every month.  He's seeking a loan to buy supplies, cacao plants, fertilizers, compost, and liquid weed-killer.  The loan will allow him to increase production and make more income for the family.

Vicente's dream is to grow more crops and increase production so he can have a better lifestyle.  The challenge he faces is the poor condition of the roads.  

In his free time Vicente likes to sleep.  He is respectful, responsible, and likes the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy supplies, cacao plants, fertilizer, compost, and liquid weed-killer.

loans.name: Nonvitcha 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVITCHA 1 est composé de trois personnes qui vont dans la même église. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rebecca est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Rebecca est âgée de 59 ans et vit au Bénin. Rebecca est mariée à un pécheur du nom de Paul. Le couple à deux enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Rebecca  vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Rebecca vend de façon ambulante, du pétrole et du savon. Rebecca s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rebecca ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVITCHA 1, sollicite un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du pétrole et du savon.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba has a store in her home where she sells basic groceries such as oil and rice. She started off very small when she bought the goods off another market that was going out of business and her business has steadily grown since. She now also sells gas tanks to the local community, which always provides a steady flow of business. She is looking to invest in fresh fruits and vegetables to sell with the loan from Kiva and Mifex. Her goal is to eventually operate her store separately from her home. She takes care of one daughter by herself and aspires to send her to college.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell at her market

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
S. Abra, born December 31 1970 in the Republic of Benin, has lived in Gape-Centre for 15 years. Her commercial activity is primarily the preparation and the sales of a corn based pasta formed in balls commonly called "Akpan." She is married and the mother of seven children, all attending school. The demand from her clientel has increased and has obliged her to ask for her first loan of $300.00 which was re-paid ahead of the deadline. She is asking for a new loan of $600.00 to expand her business and to stock goods to avoid paying for them on credit and to re-pay for them after sales. She is also an active member of a woman's group in the village. If her request is accepted, it will allow her to improve her socio-economic conditions.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

S. Abra, née le 31 décembre 1970 en République du Bénin, elle vit à Gapé-Centre depuis quinze ans. Son activité commerciale repose essentiellement sur la préparation et la vente d’une pâte de maïs en boules appelée communément « AKPAN ». Elle est mariée, mère de sept (07) enfants tous scolarisés. La demande accrue de sa clientèle l’a obligé à bénéficier d’un premier crédit de $300 qui a été bien remboursé avant l’échéance. Elle sollicite à nouveau un financement de $600 pour créer d’autres points de restauration et constituer un stock de marchandises afin d’éviter l’achat à crédit et les rembourser aux fournisseurs aussitôt après vente. Elle est aussi un membre actif d’un groupement de femmes dans le village. Cette demande, si elle est acceptée, lui permettrait d’améliorer ses conditions de vie socio économiques.

loans.use: To stock corn and other primary goods to make Akpan.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu and her husband are 26 and 24 and they have two children who are 1 and 6. They have 9000 square meters where they planted cashew nut trees. The cashew nut trees were only planted two years ago so they don’t give cashew nuts yet. Dieu works as a daily laborer for the local handicraft workshop at her hut. Her husband also works as a day laborer but the work is not stable so they have no capital to buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees. Their income is low at only $7 per person per month. They want to get a loan of $75  to buy fertilizer. They promise to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Dieu would like to buy fertilizer to grow her cashew nut trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in tools for his business

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Mr. Allahverdi is a low income, vulnerable person. He is 40, married, with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli in south-central Azerbaijan.
Allahverdi and his son (shown in the picture) run family business together. Allahverdi sells beef in the local market while his son grazes cattle. The business is promising, and Allahverdi has applied for a loan of US$1000 to the Saatli branch of Normicro. Once he receives the loan, he plans to buy four calfs, breed them and sell in a half a year. The income from each cow will be two times more then Allahverdi will have spent for their purchase (the price of each calf is US$250 while that of a cow - US$500).

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Blessed Restaurant is owned and operated by Mrs. Helen A.. Helen apprenticed in operating a restaurant for 3 months and opened hers in 1988. She is 50 years old, married with five children, and lives in Benin City , Nigeria. Helen is an LAPO client and would like a loan of $400 to buy more foodstuffs for the preparation of local dishes. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru:
Baroat M., 48, is married and has 4 children. Baroat sells clothing for children for 5 years. During the Winter season, Baroat plans to expand the assortment of clothing she sells. She has been a MicroInvest client since 2002 and wishes to receive a loan of 1,600 Tajik somoni.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирмамадова Бароат - возраст 48 лет замужем имеет 4-х детей .Имеет среднее образование ,5ть лет опыта работы в этой деятельности .Бароат продает детскую одежду ,т.к сейчас сезон зимней одежды она хочет расширить свой ассортимент.Она кредитуется в Микроинвесте с2002-го года ,и хочет получить текущий займ в сумме 1600 сомони

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Ricarda has lived in Los Olivos (the olives) Asoc. Portales del Norte for 20 years. When she arrived to that community she lived only with her husband. Five years later, they established a carpentry business.

In addition to offering the best to their three children, Ricarda wants to invest in glass and aluminum to complete some orders. She needs a capital of S/3000.00.

Ricarda has worked with EDAPROSPO since 2003, having started thanks to the invitation of a friend who now works on her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ricarda vive en Los Olivos – Asoc. Portales del Norte desde hace 20 años. Cuando llegó a la comunidad solo vivía con su esposo. Cinco años después, establecerían juntos su negocio de carpintería.

Además de brindarle lo mejor a sus tres hijos, Ricarda desearía invertir en vidrios y aluminio para hacer la entrega completa de sus pedidos. El capital requerido seria de S/3000.00.

Trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde el 2003 y llegó gracias a la invitación de una amiga con la que actualmente trabaja en su alcancía.

loans.use: Expand carpentry businesses offering window-making services.

loans.name: Kikooza A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of fresh foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to purchase more foods for sale. Annet is 40 years old and is single. She has 6 children ranging from age 10 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a new house. Annet is joined in her small group by Prossy K., Christine T., Betty N., and Margret Nakkazi.

Prossy K. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan of UGX 1000000 to buy more kitchen utensils. Christine T. is currently in the beauty salon business and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to buy a hair steamer. Betty N. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan of UGX 1000000 to increase her stock. Margret Nakkazi is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to buy more land for quarrying stones.

loans.use: To purchase more food for sale

loans.name: Jane's Sharom Group

texts.en:
Theresia is a 38 year old married woman with two children, ages 15 and 10. She and her husband also support two other people. Theresia sells clothing, a business she started in 2007. Every day she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, where she earns a monthly profit of up to $50.

Theresia now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a small business selling goods in a shop.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar Domínguez está casado y tiene dos hijas pequeñas que están aun en edad escolar. Oscar cuenta con una despensa bien surtida hace siete años, anteriormente era chofer repartidor de una empresa de productos de consumo masivo después de unos años pudo ahorrar y decidió independizarse montando un negocio en su propia casa.

El negocio ya tiene nueve años de antigüedad y posee una muy buena clientela formada, especialmente por vecinos de la zona. Oscar dice que gracias a los créditos que recibió de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo progresar y mantener su negocio y familia, también adquirió una moto que hoy lo utiliza para realizar repartos a domicilio.

El sueño de Oscar es poder ofrecer a sus hijas la posibilidad de estudiar en la universidad para ser profesionales, ya que él no contó con esa oportunidad; y para ello ya ha empezado a ahorrar.

Oscar solicita un crédito con el que desea surtir de mayor variedad su despensa, de este modo sus clientes no tendrán necesidad a recurrir a supermercados para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad.

loans.use: Compra de harina, yerba, leche, panificados, bebidas en general, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, entre otros artículos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima A. runs a small street cafe in Zanzibar. Halima began her business in 1998 and runs the business each day from 7 AM to 10 PM. Her monthly profit is approximately $285.

She is 39-years-old and is married with five children, ranging from 14 to 21-years-old.

Halima is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for her cafe. She is a member of the loan group Usimtupe, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food products for resale

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en: Nemat H. is 44 years old. Nemat and his wife are raising their three children with love and trying to ensure their kids having everything that a teenager may need. Nemat is working hard to get a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty. He has a workshop where he is providing the service of a master. He is repairing electronic items such as: TVs, tape recorders, radios, etc. At the same time on his day off he sells dried fruits in the local market. Today Nemat requests $950 US Dollars to purchase spare parts for TVs and to increase the range of his dried fruits. He hopes to increase his income and be able to send his sons to university. He promises to repay the loan within 6 months and your support will really help. Be an important part of the growth of Nemat’s business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Nemat would like to purchase spare parts for his electronic repairs company and dried fruits to sell at his fruit stall.

loans.name: Noruega Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto in the zone Huayna Potosí you will find the center Germán Bush. Inside of this center you will find the association named Noruega, 11 members who are part of a unified and organized group. Most of them are principally engaged in selling clothing for all ages (jackets, sweaters, and others) in different streets in the city of El Alto. Now that winter is here, these are the types of products sold most, which is why they are seeking larger loans to be able to purchase more merchandise in bulk, which will generate more income to improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona Huayna Potosí se encuentra el centro focal “Germán Busch” dentro este centro encontramos a la asociación denominada “Noruega”, 11 socias forman un grupo muy unido y organizado. La mayoría de ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta ropa para todas las edades (chamarras, chompas, y otros) en distintos calles de la ciudad del Alto. Ahora que el invierno llego, este tipo de productos son mas vendidos, lo que les lleva a solicitar mayores créditos para poder comprar mayor mercadería al por mayor, así generar mejores ingresos para mejorar su estilo de vida

loans.use: They need capital to purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora Luz started her business because her husband works in the United States, and she had needs she needed to cover and didn't always have the money to do it. This is why she started selling shoes by catalog to obtain income to support her family and to help her husband with their home's expenses.

She needs a loan of $275, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase women's shoes and to have meetings to sell and to pick up more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Dora Luz inició el negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos y ella tenia necesidades que tenia que cubrir y no siempre tenia el dinero para hacerlo, por eso empezó con las ventas de zapatos por catalogo para obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para compra zapato para dama y hacer reuniones para vender y levantar mas pedidos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: For the past eight years, Yaa B. has been trading in the local market of Sunyani in Ghana. She is 30 years old and married with three kids who are in school. She is a busy trader who sells palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: Yaa would like to purchase more supplies for her small grocery stand.

loans.name: La Isla Group

texts.es:
Rosario inicia el negocio hace 2 años vendiendo ropa y zapatos por iniciativa propia, fueron a un viaje León-Moroleón-San Juan de los lagos y surtió mercancía para poderla vender y así ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya que como su esposo nunca ha tenido un trabajo fijo, siempre ha trabajado por su cuenta hay ocasiones en que ella es la que tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo y los gastos de la casa.

Martina inicio el negocio por invitación de una compañera, ya que su esposo los dejo por irse con otra y ya no se hizo responsable de la casa, y ella sola tuvo que ver de que manera poder cuidar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante. Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años impulsada por una amiga para que vendiera joyería.

Hortensia inició el negocio por problemas de salud que ella tenia, padecía asma bronquial y a raíz de eso se le subía mucho la presión, empezó como cliente a consumir producto naturistas y mejoro mucho su salud, hace poco mas de 1 años se hizo distribuidora independiente para que mas gente pueda aprovechar los beneficios de los productos.

Ellas son el Grupo La Isla y necesitan un préstamo por US $850 que pagaran en 3 meses para poder invertirlo en su negocio comprando mercancía.
texts.en:
Rosario began selling clothing and shoes two years ago on her own initiative. She and her husband took a trip to León-Moroleón-San Juan of Lakes and bought a variety of merchandise to sell to help pay for household expenditures, since Rosario's husband has never had a salaried job and has always worked odd jobs. Sometimes, Rosario is the one who has to work to help her son get ahead and pay for household expenditures.

Martina launched her business at the invitiation of a friend, since her husband left her for another woman and no longer helps support the family. She had to see for herself what the best way to care for her children and help them get ahead would be. She decided to start selling jewelry two years ago with the encouragement of a friend.

Hortensia started her business because of some health problems she was having. She was suffering from broncheal asthma, and her blood pressure went up dramatically as a result. She began taking natural remedies and they greatly improved her health. A little over a year ago, she became an independent distributor of these products so that more people can enjoy the benefits of natural remedies.

The three women make up the La Isla ("The Island") group and are requesting a loan of $850, which they will repay in three months, to buy more merchandise for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for individual businesses

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 40 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es madre de 05 hijos (dos mujeres y dos varones), vive en el Jr. Atahualpa Nº  607, del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia  El Collao – Puno y es una de las socias del Banco Comunal  “San Miguel”

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500 aumentó su capital y compró más cosméticos para incrementar su negocio, al mismo tiempo se dedica a alquilar su cochera para la guardianía de vehículos, específicamente se guardan triciclos, carretas, etc. No continuó sus estudios porque decidió formar su familia.

Con este crédito de S/.800.00, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más cosméticos, los cuales venderá en instituciones como el Hospital.

“Gracias al crédito del Banco Comunal obtuve más ganancias e incrementé mi negocio” manifiesto Nancy muy alegremente.

Su mayor deseo es crecer en su negocio y vender en las demás instituciones, tanto Públicas y Privadas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, studied to the fifth year of secondary school, is the mother of 5 children (two daughters and two sons), lives in Jr. Atahualpa Nº 607, of the Ilave District, El Collao Province – Puno and is one of the members of the San Miguel Communal Bank. With the first loan of S/. 500 she increased her working capital and purchased more cosmetics to grow her business. At the same time she works renting her garage to keep vehicles, specially tricycles, carts, etc. She did not continue her studies because she decided to form her family. With this loan of S/.800.00, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy more cosmetics which she will sell in institutions such as the hospital. “Thanks to the loan from the Communal Bank I obtained more earnings and grew my business” expressed Nancy very happily. Her greatest wish it to grow her business and sell in other institutions, both public and private ones.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Mr. Nat M. is the leader of a four-member group; they all live in the Kampong Prasat village, in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a fisherman, but he can only catch a small amount of fish to support the family. To catch more fish, Mr. Nat M. requests a loan to buy more fishing nets for his business. His wife, Mrs. Loch Sarim, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Mr. Nat M. is 32 years old, and has four children; two attend the local school, and two are too young to go to school.

loans.use: Buy fishing nets to catch more fish to sell

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.es: La señora Francisca Antonia M. tiene la edad de 63 años,  habita en el barrio jardines de apoyo, junto a su esposo, el cual le poya con los gastos del hogar, ya que el es comerciante y agricultor, ellos tiene  hijos pero no a su cargo. Los hijos le apoyan con algunos gastos del hogar ya que ellos son casados. Los planes de doña Francisca son ampliar más su negocio, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que con sus propios esfuerzos inicio. Ella solicita un financiamiento para poder incrementa su inventario y  a la vez mejorar su negocio. Alargo plazo es prestar para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su baño que esta en malas condiciones y desea poder mejorar con las ventas al tener productos variados y frescos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Antonia M. is 63 years old, lives in the neighborhood Jardines de Apoyo, together with her husband, who helps with the household expenses because he is a merchant and a farmer. They have children but not under their care. Their children support them with various household expenses because they are already married. The plans of Mrs. Francisca are to increase her business, which is dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables that she started with her own efforts. She is requesting financing to be able to increase her inventory and improve her business. Long-term this loan will be able to improve the infrastructure of their bathroom which is in poor condition and she wants to improve her sales by having various products and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is a member of the Imasumac Village Bank. “Imasumac” is Quechua for “How Beautiful.” Cipriana is 37 years old and is married with four children. She has a small grocery store in the Carmen Alto neighborhood of Ayacucho. Each Friday, Cipriana travels to the countrysiD. to buy lambs so that she can sell their meat. She has had her business for the past six years, and works alone from 6am to 8pm each day.

Cipriana is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy a large freezer to store meat. She says that her goal for the future is to keep working at her store for the rest of her life. Having the store is a nice break from her previous job as a street vendor, which was very tiresome.

loans.use: Cipriana would like to buy a meat freezer to store meat that she sells.

loans.name: Oynisso

texts.ru: Камолова Ойниссо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. дова , осталась одна с семью детьми. Работает на рынке в Курган-Тюбе.Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы арендовать другую торговую точку . где-то в центральных рядах рынка. Там больше людей и торговля двигается лучше.Это поможет увеличить ежедневную выручку и таким образом доход . Погасить кредит сможет  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Oynisso K. lives in Kurgan-Tube. Oynisso is a widow with 7 children. She works at the local market. Oynisso asks for this loan to rent another stall at the market to expand her business. Oynisso K. will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Mrs. Samean M. is a villager in Ta Suon village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Veasna, is a teacher in the local school.

To provide better conditions for their family, Mrs. Samean M. is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income. She is a 40-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income

loans.name: Heidy Melina

texts.es:
Heidy es socia del Bancomunal Las Rosas del  Valle.
Heidy es  conviviente, tiene 27 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años que esta en la escuela estatal.    
La mamá de Heidy le enseño  desde que Heidi tenia 20 años, sobre como trabajar  con arpiería – cuadros  ella se dedica armar los cuadros, los pinta los adorna y los venden en la ferias artesanales; por las noches trabaja como azafatas para eventos.  
Heidy  desde que esta en Finca, ha podido invertir y tener mas capital, ha podido abrir otro negocio, aprendió a valorar las cosas, recibe capacitación que le han ayudado a como vender mejor sus productos.   
Heidy necesita 1000 soles, para la compra de material para la confección de cuadros, yute, hilos, telas, algodón.
El sueño de Heidy es ser ingeniera de sistemas, por eso esta poniendo otro negocio para poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Heidy is a member of the Las Rosas del Valle community bank. She is partnered, 27-years old and has a 6-year old son who is enrolled in public school. Heidy began learning from her mother how to work with "arperia" [I can't find a good translation for this but it's evidently some kind of local craft] when she was 20-years old. She pieces together the frames, paints and decorates them, then sells them at crafts fairs. At nights she works as a waitress. Since she started with Finca, Heidy has been able to invest and save money, open another business, learn the value of things, and receive training that has helped her to better sell her products. Heidy needs 1000 soles to buy material for making her crafts: jute, thread, cloth, cotton. Her dream is to be a systems engineer and she's setting up another business to further her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for crafts business.

loans.name: Zakya Group

texts.en:
Qanda Agh is the group leader of the Zakya group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her business.

Qanda Agh and Mayla want to take a loan for their tailoring business and they want to complete their business and make their shop large. Zakya wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store business; he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

They are grateful for this loan process in Afghanistan, especially for Kiva and AFSG that help poor people.

loans.use: To make their businesses larger

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal is a widow and lives with her daughter in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a nineteen-year-old student at a local university. Otgonjargal has a small business making processed milk products, such as cheese and ice-cream. She was briefly trained in making milk products in 1981. In 1998, she decided to use her previous training and to pursue a business making milk products.

She started the business with 400,000 MNT of working capital ($1 USD=1,500 MNT) and sells her products from outside her house, which is located next to the road. An advantage of selling her products outside her home is that there is no rent. Her business capital has increased to 1,600,000 MNT. The business usually peaks during the summer time. As the summer approaches, she is requesting a loan to purchase more milk.

loans.use: To purchase milk

loans.name: Katete E Namusoke Teddy Group

texts.en:
N. Teddy is 22 years old and married with two children, both of them going to school, and two dependents, one of them going to school.

N. Teddy is using the loan to purchase chemical for hair relaxing, hair oil, hair spray, hair treatment, etc. for her salon business. She dreams of prospering in her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemical for hair relaxing, hair oil, hair spray, hair treatment, etc. for her salon business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 43 años, es natural del departamento de San Martín, es soltera, y vive con su hija Milagros de 8 años de edad. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual instauró en su propia casa, negocio que le permite cubrir los gastos de su hogar y también la educación de su pequeña hija, la cual la apoya en las ventas Elisa requiere salir. Es así, que juntas salen adelante en busca de progreso, y a ambas les gusta el negocio, ya que es muy tranquilo y la mayoría de clientes son sus vecinos y vecinas, los cuales también son sus amigos. Lamentablemente a veces le resulta muy cansado permanecer durante todo el día, debido a que ha empezado la temporada de invierno y el frío es cada vez mayor. Aún así ella lucha muy duro para conseguir sus metas, que son de expander su negocio hasta tener un bazar grande donde pueda ofrecer mercadería más variada. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera cumplir con puntualidad cada una de las cuotas encomendadas. Con el dinero solicitado quiere abastecer su bodega de los productos que ya se le están acabando, comprando por sacos para economizar y lograr mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elisa is 43 years of age and is a native of the Department of San Martín. She is single and lives with her eight-year-old daughter, Milagros. The last nine years have been devoted to taking care of her general store which she runs out of her home. This business allows her to cover her the expenses for her household and also for the education of her little girl. Her daughter also tends the shop if she has to step out. That's how they are working together to get ahead in search of progress, and they both like the business since it is very pleasant and most of the customers are neighbors, oftentimes friends. Unfortunately, at times it can be very tiring to remain there all day long, because the winter season has begun and it's getting colder all the time. Even so, she is struggling very hard to reach her goal, which is to expand her business until she has a large bazaar where she can offer a wider variety of merchandise. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she hope to punctually complete every one of the agreed upon payments. With the money she has requested, she wants to stock up her store with the products that are running out, buying them in quantity in order to economize and bring in greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build up her inventory.

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.en:
This committee is in its tenth cycle, and is an exemplary group.  It is made up of 16 women.  One of the participants, Mrs. Rogelia G., has five younger children, two of whom are in daycare and the other three stay at home while she works.  She works collecting recycling in Asunción.  On the weekends Rogelia participates in actitivities with the committee in order to create more group savings. Mrs. Rogelia G. is very dedicated to her children and does everything possible to help her partner with the living expenses of the family.  They have a small house, constructed by the government, in a marginal and dangerous neighborhood.   

1	Rogelia G.- 	Recycling 
2	Roque F. A.- 	Food sales 
3	Felicia M.-	Food sales 
4	Petrona V.-  	Meat sales 
5	Nicolasa D.- 	Recycling 
6	 Cynthia Delgad-  	Manicurist 
7	Georgina A.- 	Recycling 
8	Miguela C.- 	Undergarment sales 
9	Daysi D.- 	Charcoal sales 
10	Lilian V.- 	Candy sales 
11	Juana V.-	Comestics sales 
12	Clara V.- 	Clothing sales 
13	Alejandra O.-	Food sales 
14	Marisa S.-  	General store 
15	Shirley A.- 	Food sales 
16	Cecilia V.-  	General store

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for sale and raw materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de unos parientes. Desde hace un año realiza bellos bordados, se inició en esta actividad debido a la invitación de una de sus amigas que le enseñó esta labor. Ahora trabaja independientemente en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y a sus hijos. Por ello tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados, ya que por la complejidad puede demorar hasta un mes en bordado. Teniendo como resultado una bella prenda típica que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente le compran al contado. La época más rentable de su negocio es durante las festividades típicas de su región, llamadas “la fiesta del Santiago”. Para el futuro, Victoria desea hacer crecer su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar a otras personas que la ayuden con el bordado. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha de ser una nueva integrante en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable con la devolución del préstamo. La razón de su crédito es poder adquirir más telas e hilos de diversos colores, los cuales son materiales básicos para aumentar la producción de sus bordados.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and she lives with her husand and children in a house belonging to her family. For the past year she has been creating beautiful embroidery. She started this business through an invitation from one of her friends that showed her the trade. She has been working independently from the comfort of her home, so that she can maintain her home and care for her children. She has a fixed work schedule, having very steady work carrying out her craft. Given the complexity of some of the embroidery work, she can take up to one month to complete. The fruit of her work is a beautiful traditional piece that is admired by her clients. They ultimately purchase her pieces of work. The most profitable time of year is during the traditional festivals in her region called "la fiesta del Santiago", meaning the Feast of Santiago. In the future Victoria wishes to increase the number of embroidered skirts she makes and to contract out some work to help out with the embroidery. This is the first time she has requested a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to be a new member of the Community Bank. She has committed herself to be very responsible in the repayment of this loan. The loan will be destined to purchase more fabric and threads of various colors, which are basic materials to increase production.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en: KH. H., 27, operates a sewing business that generates a typical income of $2.60 US per day in the province of Takeo. H. and her husband work hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for their family. H. and her husband are blessed with two young children who have not yet attended school. Her husband is a shoemaker who operates from their house and usually earns around $13.30 per day. H. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase animal skins to produce more shoes for her husband's customers. By doing this, she hopes that her husband will be able to produce more goods to sell at markets to increase their income. They will then be able to cover their family expenses and save to support her children’s future education.

loans.use: Purchasing animal skins for shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle.

loans.name: John Igwe

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et habite le quartier de Bè Kpéhénou à Lomé. Depuis 1998, il a pu trouver un marché très rentable de la vente des sacs de friperie. Ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge et de lancer des commandes de bals de sacs en provenance d’Italie. Pour réceptionner un nouveau stock, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour lancer une nouvelle commande de 25 bals de friperie. Il compte beaucoup sur sa longue expérience pour rembourser ce prêt. Cet homme n’a pas d’enfant.
texts.en:
This man is married and lives in the Bè Kpéhénou neighbourhood of Lomé. Since 1998, he has found a very profitable market for secondhand bags. This business allows him, above all, to support himself and to order bags from Italy. He is requesting a loan to order a new stock of 25 bales of used merchandise. He is counting on his extensive experience to repay this loan. This man does not have any children.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used bags

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn A., a mother of two children, is involved in a farming and hog-raising business. She used to borrow money at very high rates of interest, but since joining CEV less than a year ago, her borrowing costs have been lower, and she has used the money to buy farm necessities and pigs. She is grateful for how CEV has helped her whole family through its financial support of the business.

Jerlyn is now requesting a loan of Php12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farming materials and feed for her hogs. This loan will help Jerlyn to grow her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es: Juan Ángel R. de 52 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán junto a su esposa. El posee una venta de frutas, la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante en gran parte de la zona de Perquín. Juan solicita un préstamo para poder brindarle mantenimiento a su vehiculo, ya que es este el que le permite realizar su trabajo, así mismo lo solicita para obtener el dinero para poder comprar más fruta para su negocio. Juan es una persona muy honrada, el cual trabaja arduamente para obtener lo necesario para tener una vida digna junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan Ángel R. is 52 years old and lives in the departament of Morazán with his wife. He sells fruit commercially as a street vendor in a large part of the area of Perquín. Juan is applying for a loan to maintain his vehicle which is what allows him to work and obtain the money to purchase more fruit for his business. Juan is a very honorable person who works tirelessly to gain the necessities to lead a dignified life together with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La sra. Cristina tiene un consultorio donde brinda los servicios de enfermería, ella es auxiliar en enfermería y está tramitando sus papeles para su título profesiónal en la universidad, tiene un hijito de 10 años de edad, que está estudiando, ella sola se dedica a su manutención; su consultorio esta ubicado en la plaza Garita de Lima, una zona muy comercial de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito será invertido en la compra de un balon de oxigeno, una centrofumigadora, un electrocauterizador ya que estos son instrumentos que le hacen falta en el consultorio. Es una cliente muy responsable y muy puntual.

loans.use: COMPRA DE INSTRUMENTAL PARA EL CONSULTORIO

loans.name: Ijairo Augusto

texts.pt:
Ijairo M. nasceu em Panda, na Província de Inhambane, tem 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 15,13,12,11 e 2 anos de idade, os 4 mais velhos frequentam a escola. Fez nível médio profissional, vive na casa própria com a família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Panda em 1995 para Maputo com a sua família, transferido pelos serviços. É funcionário do estado no Ministério da Educação como Docente há 14 anos, faz em media 8 por dia e ganha um salário de 9.000.00mt por mês. É também dono de um negócio, trabalha com a sua esposa vendendo refrigerantes e outras bebidas. Conseguem arrecadar cerca de 10.000.00mt, a 15.000.00mt por mês e poupam algum no banco, todos os meses.

Já teve empréstimos no Banco comercial BIM e decidiu não continuar quando conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos para o seu negócio (refrescos, cerveja e vinhos). Os anteriores valores foram de 11.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

Enfrenta dificuldades falta de energia eléctrica para desenvolver a sua actividade e é que obrigado a usar congelador a gás, que é pouco económico. Mas, com este empréstimo vai aumentar bastante mente a sua receita, através da aquisição de mais produtos para satisfazer o seu mercado.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial, residência e adquirir um meio de transporte próprio.
texts.en:
Ijairo M. was born in Panda, in the province of Inhambane. He is 35 years old, married and the father of five children aged 15, 13, 12, 11 and two years old. The four oldest children go to school. He completed professional middle school, and lives in his own house with his family and does not support any others.

He left Panda with his family in 1995 for Maputo, transferred by work. He has been a state functionary for 14 years as a teacher in the Ministry of Education, working on average eight hours per day and earning a salary of 9000 Meticais a month. He is also owner of a shop, and works with his wife selling sodas and other drinks. They manage to bring in between 10,000 and 15,000 Meticais monthly, and save something in the bank every month.

He had loans from the commercial BIM bank, and decided not to continue when he learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is a client of the organization. This is the third loan, in the amount of 25,000 Meticais, with which he intends to buy products for his shop (soft drinks, beer and wines). The previous amounts were 11,000 Meticais and 18,000 Meticais, both for the same business.

He encountered difficulties growing his business due to a lack of electricity, which obliged him to use an uneconomical gas refrigerator. But with this loan he will increase his income sufficiently, by acquiring additional products to satisfy his market.

In the future he plans to request additional loans to improve his commercial establishment and residence, and to acquire his own means of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of soft drinks

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Doña Juana T. tiene 31 años de edad, es casada de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Pantalones”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, de 2 maquinas llevan 6 años ya  laborar   su residencia que se encuentra en San Francisco el Alto del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Juana T., 31, is married and is a tailor. “Confección de Pantalones” (Trouser Manufacturing). She lives with her husband who is also a tailor. They have a small, two-machine, workshop and have worked for the past 6 years in their home located in San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, demand from their customers has increased but their financial situation is insufficient for her to increase her working capital. For this reason she has called upon Asociación ASDIR for financing to buy raw materials to allow her to increase her sales hoping, too, to get her family ahead as well as providing better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

La señora Juliana no estudió y tiene 9 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 meses atrás, y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado como ovejas.

Su deseo para el futuro es sacar a sus hijos profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las charlas que recibe.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Manuelas de Hoy II Communal Bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 50 and married. She buys and sells livestock. Juliana does not have an education. She has nine children. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years. She used her first loan for 500 PEN to buy livestock. She is asking for a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy livestock like sheep. Her wish for the future is to have her children become professionals. The things she likes most about her organization are the savings and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Lep

texts.en: Lep A., 39, is a widower and the father of four children. Three of his children are married and have already started new homes, while other is single and lives at home. Lep A. lives with his older mother, who sells traditional medicine to earn a living. To make a living, Lep A. sells silk that he orders in bulk from weavers. He sells his goods in various provinces and earns an average of $6 a day. Lep A. wants to sustain his business growth and is asking for a loan to accumulate a larger amount of silk to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger amount of silk to sell

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana Beatriz S. G. de 26 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Jorge, en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como cobrador de buses, y junto a su hijo de un año de edad. Ella posee una venta de paletas y helados, los cuales los comercializa en su hogar, esto los vende por unidad y así mismo los vende por mayor a los vendedores ambulantes. Ana es una persona la cual trata de esforzarse día con día, ya que es consiente que el sueldo de su esposo es muy poco para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más helados y paletas, de manera que pueda contar con más cliente que compren el producto al por mayor, de esta manera ella espera aumentar las ventas y brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana Beatriz S. G. is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jorge, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband, who works as a bus conductor, and their 1 year-old son. She has a business selling popsicles and ice cream from her home; she sells these individually, and also sells wholesale to street vendors. Ana is a person who tries to work hard day by day, since she is aware that her husband's income will not cover all of the household expenses. For this reason she requests a loan which she will use to buy more popsicles and ice cream, so that she can increase her wholesale business. In this way she hopes to increase her sales and provide the necessary support to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ice cream and popsicles

location.town: Municipio de San Jorge, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her 5 children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her two oldest sons, 28 and 25, help her to operate a family construction business; her daughter, 21, attends university, and her two youngest sons, 17 and 14, both attend a local high school. While her children were all growing up, she taught them how to make boots and also how to build houses.

Since 1998, she and her children have made boots which they sell in Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. During the warmer months, she and her oldest sons build houses. During the last three years, she and her sons have built eleven two-storey houses in Zuunmod, the capital city of Tuv province, and they have already received two orders for houses this upcoming summer. Because of her and her children's success, they were able to build their own two-storey home and are quite comfortable and happy in it.

Bayarmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (approx. 1380 USD) loan in order to furnish the second storey of her home so that her family can be more comfortable and in order to purchase more boot-making supplies.

loans.use: to purchase more boot-making supplies

loans.name: Rosa María De Lourdes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector La Compuerta del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de diez años. Cría diversos animales: aves de corral, cerdos y cuyes, los cuales ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona donde vive. Este negocio le provee de ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a su familia.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para críar, así como también en la compra de alimentos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer muy conocida y estmida por los vecinos del lugar donde vive. Ella es muy responsable y trabjadora. Adicionalmente trabaja apoyando en un colegio del lugar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the La Compuerta sector of Oyotún District, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. Rosa has been raising and selling animals for more than a decade. She raises a variety of animals, including poultry, pigs and guinea pigs. She sells her animals to the buyers who frequently visit her neighborhood. This business allows her to generate the necessary income to cover her personal expenses and help her family get ahead. Rosa would like to expand her business by buying more animals to raise as well as more animal feed. She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1200 Peruvian Soles in order to achieve this goal. Rosa is a very well-known woman who is held in high esteem by her neighbors. She is very responsible and hard-working. She also works as support staff at a local school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: To buy animals to expand her business

loans.name: Bakit

texts.en:
Bakit J. is currently in the business of selling food in a hotel and is requesting a loan to stock crates of soda and beer to sell. Bakit is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has two children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open shop in another hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights, as well as legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock crates of soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Amudat

texts.en: Amudat is married with 3 children and she is 35 years old. To support their home, her husband also works. She sells crayfish and foodstuffs in the market in Oyo town. Crayfish is a major soup ingredient in Nigeria. She has been in this business for 6 years. Amudat is requesting a loan to purchase more crayfish and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crayfish and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Peter Njuguna

texts.en:
Peter, a farmer, is 43 years old. He is married to Judy and they have one son and three daughters; aged 2 ½ years, 6 years and 12 years respectively. Peter has been  farming for the past eight years.

Peter was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. He has applied for a loan and plans to buy a dairy cow. With the extra profit generated from the business he intends to buy more dairy cows. 

He hopes to be a reliable dairy farmer and he describes himself as a hardworking and ambitious businessman.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jefter

texts.en:
Jefter is 51 years old and married with four children, ranging in age from 19 to 26 years old. Only his youngest child is still currently enrolled in school. He has run a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for the past ten years. His primary income comes from the sale of beans, vegetables, milk, and timber to the local market and re-sellers. Overall the main challenges to success are transportation of products to market and lack of steady access to markets. 

Jefter requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help improve the living standards of his family and allow for better education for his children. In the future, Jefter would like to become a big supplier of milk and he would also like to purchase a posho mill, a machine for grinding maize into flour.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca F. A. está agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo elaborar la barda y poner el piso. 
Es nuevamente solicitando un préstamo ya que le está haciendo falta varios acabados del interior de la casa y también desea impermeabilizar el techa.
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que le realizara la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo que tiene limpiando casa particular.
texts.en:
Francisca F. A. is grateful for your help with her previous loan, which made it possible for her to build a wall and install the floor in her home. She is now asking for a new loan, since she still has to finish the interior work in her home and also wants to make the roof waterproof. Francisca does not have the money that she needs to purchase the material and to pay the person who will make the improvements. She plans to pay off the loan with the income that she receives from her job cleaning a private home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the interior work and waterproofing the roof

loans.name: Chaskañawi Group

texts.es:
ESTA BANCA DE EMPRENDIMIENTO ESTA COMPUESTA POR 10 INTEGRANTES 9 MUJERES Y 1 VARON, EL NOMBRE DEL BANCO SIGNIFICA PESTAÑAS REVUELTAS O LINDOS OJOS,  FUE FORMADA POR  LA SEÑORAS ELIZABET (PRESIDENTA) JANETH (ES LA SECRETARIA DE ACTAS) QUIENES LOGRARON REUNIR A 10 CLIENTES CONFIABLES, TRABAJADORAS Y RESPONSABLES TODAS CON ACTIVIDAD EN EL ALTO.

LA SRA. ELIZABETH SU PRESIDENTA REALIZA VENTA DE CELULARES Y CD's, VIVE EN LA ZONA DE ALTO LIMA EN ALQUILER, SU ESPOSO ES VIAJERO CON LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD Y SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES TENER SU CASA PROPIA POR LO QUE LES INTERESO MUCHO EL AHORRO QUE SE LES OFRECE TRABAJAN CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD YA VARIOS AÑOS ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y SIEMPRE VELANDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA CELULARES POR CANTIDAD ULTIMOS MODELOS Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO.

LA SECRETARIA DE ACTAS, LA SRA. JANETH REALIZA EL COMERCIO DE ROPA INTERIOR, ES SOLTERA Y AÚN ASI ES EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE COLABORA A SU MAMÁ Y HERNANA MENOR CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, A PARTE DE TENER SU NEGOCIO, TAMBIEN ESTUDIA Y SE ESFUERZA, EL MAYOR ANHELO QUE TIENE ES ENTRAR A LA UNIVERSIDAD Y LOGRAR SER PROFESIONAL, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA POR DOCENAS PARA DE ESTA MANERA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO.

ESTE GRUPO ES MUY UNIDO, SE APOYAN ENTRE SI LA SRA. CAROLINA ES LA TESORERA VENDE ANTICUCHOS ESTOS SON TROZOS DEL CORAZON DE LA VACA COCIDOS AL CARBON, VAN ACOMPAÑADOS DE PAPAS BLANCAS Y UN AJI DE MANI MUY PICOSO, ESTE NEGOCIO LE PERMITE AYUDAR ECONOMICAMENTE EN SU HOGAR, A SU ESPOSO QUE ES  PLOMERO Y NO GANA MUCHO, TIENEN UNA NIÑA ADOLESCENTE A LA QUE QUISIERAN VER PROFESIONAL CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS RIQUISIMOS ANTICUCHOS.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 10 members: 9 women and one man. The bank’s name means “Tangled Eye Lashes” or “Beautiful Eyes.” It was formed by Elizabeth (president), Janeth (recording secretary) who managed to gather 10 trustworthy, hard-working, responsible people from El Alto to join. Elizabeth, group president, cells CDs and cell phones. She rents her house in the Alto Lima neighborhood. Her husband is a traveling salesman of the same items. Her greatest wish is to have her own house so she is very interested in the savings that working with this activity makes possible. She has collaborated with us for several years now.
