She is a very hard-working person who is always watching after her family’s wellbeing. She will use the funds to buy large amounts of the latest models of cell phones so that she can thus increase her working capital. Janeth, recording secretary, is an underwear merchant. Although she’s single, she’s her family’s sole source of support because she helps her mother and younger sister with the household expenses. Besides her business, she’s also studying and trying very hard. Her greatest wish is to get into the university and become a professional. She will use the funds to buy merchandise by the dozen so that she can thus increase her working capital. This is a very unified group; they support each other. Carolina is treasurer and she sells anticuchos (skewered grilled beef heart served with potatoes and spicy chili peanut sauce). This activity makes it possible for her to help support the family because her husband, who is a plumber, doesn’t earn very much. They have an adolescent daughter that they’d like to see become a professional. She will use the funds to buy ingredients for her delicious anticuchos.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital.

loans.name: 06.02.09 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Dung  H. T. (51) is a 35 year-old femaL. living in the town of H. Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Dung  is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.02.09 H. Hoa. Dun  is married and has two school-aged children. She sells rice products which she has done for over 5 years and earns approximately 35000000 VND a month.

In 2002, Dung  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dung  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Hoa (13) is a 25 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  V. T. Hong (50) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.


3.  L. T. Manh (39) is a 49 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Dung  H. T. (51) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa ,Thanh Hoa.  Dung  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.02.09 H. Hoa (06.02.09 H. Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Dung  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dung  kiếm được khoảng 35000000 VND.  Vào 2002, Dung  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dung  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Hoa (13) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  V. T. Hong (50) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  L. T. Manh (39) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa M. is a 54-year old married woman who lives in Brgy. Kaongkod, Madredijos, Cebu City. She earns her living by engaging in livestock raising and farming.

Luisa’s husband, Porperio, is a 60 years old farmer, and they have 5 children who are between 12-28 years old.  Two of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.  They have 1 married child while the other 2 are working.

Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by raising livestock and farming.  Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 3,000 from her business activities.

Luisa is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 18,000 was used to fund operations of her livestock rising and farming, and it has had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th loan in the amount of Php 18,000, which she intends to use on her livestock raising and farming business. Luisa is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro 2 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of her group, Creciendo hacia el futuro (progress to the future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities incluD. the free trading zone and a cement factory. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable, and she makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children.

Xiomara is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to buy equipment and supplies for the cafeteria. She will use the profits to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to invest in the school cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase products (bananas, cooking oil, and beans)

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn C. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Arlyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, salt and tomato sauce in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania S. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she  raises pigs to sell. Epifania has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2002, Epifania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Epifania is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc T. M. V. is 52 years old. She has two children who are in high school. A member of our credit program for seven years, she has used her loans effectively. Her main business activities are raising pigs and growing jasmine for sale. Currently, she wants a loan of 9.810.000 VND to buy food for pigs and fertilizer. She says that micro-finance plays an important role in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a business-lady who sells cereals.   She has been engaged in the business for eight years.  She has managed to employ one person.  Elizabeth hopes to expand her business with the profit from her business.  She has really benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has developed a saving culture.  

She has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables.   Elizabeth sees herself owning several stalls for her business in the future.  (photo taken at a friend's business)

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Paulina Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. I. Álvarez es modista y habita en el Municipio del Viejo.  
Ella va a utilizar el credito para mejorar su vivienda y Reparar lo que es el techo de la casa donde habita.

Este es el séptimo  credito que tiene con la institución los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma.
La Sra. I. manifiesta sentirse muy contenta con todos los créditos que ha tenido con CEPRODEL,  ya que le han servido de mucha ayuda tanto para mejorar en su servicio de modesta como su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. I. Álvarez is a dressmaker and lives in the city of Viejo. She is going to use the loan to improve her home and to repair her house’s roof.

This is her seventh loan that she has had with the institution and she has repaid all others on time. Mrs. I. Álvarez is very pleased with all the loans she has had with CEPRODEL. They have offered lots of help with her dressmaking as well as her family life.

loans.use: repair and improvement of the home( to buy zinc sheeting)

loans.name: Acuario Azul Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama  Acuario Azul, tiene este nombre porque ellas se identifican con él, ya que consideran que así como es un acuario es su grupo tiene la mejor gente, la cual ha sido seleccionada, y sobre todo porque así es su amistad, todas van por el mismo camino. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo, está conformado por 9 integrantes. La Sra. Norma C. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 32 años, estudió hasta la primaria, tienen 4 hijos de 9 años, 8 años, 4 años y el mas pequeño de 1 año de edad, de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian la primaria en su comunidad. La Sra. Norma se dedica a la venta de vajillas y de colchas que inicio hace 4 años, ella necesita este crédito para la compra de utensilios de cocina y de colchas ya que es la temporada en que vende más su producto, ella lo que espera de este crédito es que su negocio crezca y así poder seguir apoyando con los gastos de su casa.Otra  integrante del grupo es la Sra. Felipa Álvarez, ella es muy humanitaria es honesta totalmente leal, le gusta planificar y sobre todo que lucha por sus sueños. Tiene  55 años, estudio la primaria, no tiene dependientes económicos, ella vive en unión libre con el Sr. Álvarez Ángeles José que se dedica a la fabrica de block. La Sra. Felipa Álvarez Z. se dedica a la venta de materiales para la construcción que inicio hace 11 años. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de material como; la varilla, el cemento y el mortero en general, para así tenerlo a disposición en cuanto sus clientes lo requieran.
texts.en: The group is called Acuario Azul [Blue Aquarium]. It has this name because they identify with it. They think that like an aquarium, their group has the best people, who have been selected, and that it how friendship is, all of them on the same road. The group is located in the state of Hidalgo. It is made up of 9 members. Norma C.  is the president of the group. She is 32 and finished primary school. She has 4 children aged 9, 8, 4 and the youngest is 1. Two of them are in the community's primary school. Norma has sold dishes and blankets for 4 years. She needs this loan to buy kitchen utensils and blankets since htis is the season that she sells the most product.  What she hopes is that with this loan her business will grow and she will be able to continue helping out with the household expenses. Another member of the group is Felipa Álvarez. She is very humanitarian, honest and totally loyal. Above all, she fights for her dreams.  She is 55 years old, went to primary school, and has no financial dependents. She is in a common law marriage with Mr. Jose Álvarez Ángeles, who manufactures blocks. Mrs. Felipa Álvarez Z. has sold construction materials for 11 years. She is asking for the loan to buy materials such as: rods, cement and mortar so that she can have it at her disposal when her customers need it.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and improve business

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina O., 52, is married and lives in the town of Baclayon. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store, selling vinegar, soy sauce and other kinds of products.  Vivina said her store help to provide for her family's needs.  She hopes to expand her store. 

Vivina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Vivina is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Isatu.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 17, 14, and 5. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her. They are a brother and sister and need  assistance in their schooling.  In 2008, Isatu established her provision business. She began her business because she believed it could provide more income to support her family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,597,200SLL every month from this business. 

Isatu needs a loan of 4,000,000  in order to buy additional cartons of baked beans, sardines, and sugar. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 319,440SLL. Isatu intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children and  buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional provisions such as cartons of baked beans, sardines, and sugar

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a resident of Litein Town in North Rift Kenya.  She is twenty seven years old and married with three children between the ages of five and nine years old.  She has been doing mixed farming for eight years and has employed three farmhands.  She produces tea and milk.  The milk is sold locally.

Janeth has applied for a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She hopes the income generated will enable her to pay the school fees for her children.  She is planning to purchase a parcel of land where she can plant animal feed for her animals.

Her challenge is animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Philip Waruingi

texts.en:
Philip has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. He is 53 years old, married to Rebecca Gathoni. They are blessed with a 15 year old daughter, who is a student.

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by the KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru. This will be his fifth loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 80,000 in full and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs, fertilizers, seedlings, land preparation and to boost his hardware stock.

In the future, Philip hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, fertilizers, seedlings, land preparation and also boost his hardware stock.

loans.name: María Armita

texts.es:
María Armita es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos. Ella cuenta con un quiosco situado frente a la posta de salud de su localidad. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes ceviches, papas rellenas (platos típicos de la zona), gaseosas y comida en general. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que María prepara sus alimentos y a la amabilidad con la que los atiende. Las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

María Armita desea adquirir más insumos para poder preparar más platos de comida, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Armita is a 40 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural district located in Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María Armita makes and sells food.  She has a kiosk opposite her town's local health clinic.  There she offers her customers 'ceviches' (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic) and 'papas rellenas' (fried, stuffed potatoes) which are both traditional meals in this area.  She also sells soda and food in general.  Her business is very popular with her customers because of the good flavor of María's food and the kindness with which she serves her customers.  She uses the profits that she makes from this business to help her husband cover their family expenses.

María Armita would like to acquire more supplies so that she can prepare more meals, increase her sales and make more profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Adquirir más insumos para poder preparar más platos de comida.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina, who is married and has two children, started working as a market vendor 8 years ago and today runs her own business selling candies and sweets. After the economic crisis reached Tajikistan, purchasing prices rose so Zarina needed a loan to maintain her inventory. She has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity, having repaid every loan received from IMON International without any defaults. This time, Zarina is asking to borrow 10 000 TJS to purchase candies and sweets wholesale. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and develop her trade even more.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase candies and sweets wholesale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine M. lives in the Makerere neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Christine    has a restaurant.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Christine     sells her food at the market.    

Christine has requested  a loan of 300,000   Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and 10 kgs of rice. The main business challenges for Christine   include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms.  

Christine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken,  and 10 kgs of rice

loans.name: Leticia Henriette

texts.en:
Leticia Henriette P. is from Barangay Vista Hill, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Leticia Henriette is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leticia Henriette has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $138 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leticia Henriette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Leticia Henriette is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Vista Hill, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds, as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en: Nicodemus is 28 years old and a single father of one.  He runs a green grocery shop for a living. He started the business in 2005.  He was previously selling sugarcane for a living.  He also runs a barber shop to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has opened another grocery shop.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in five years.  He dreams of owning a pick-up and a piece of land in the future.  He has requested for 50,000 Kes to buy bananas, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy bananas, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 27 años y su querida hija Tania de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los hermosos campos del poblado natal de Elizabeth, han sido en su vida el lugar que la ha visto crecer y forma su familia, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus papas, arvejas y habas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 27 year-old Luis, and her beloved 3 year-old daughter Tania, who she would like to provide with a better future.  The beautiful countryside surrounding Elizabeth's home town has been an important place in her life.  This is where she grew up and also where she formed her family.  When she was a very young girl, Elizabeth's parents taught her to work on the farm and now she has her own land which she works with a lot of care and sacrifice.

What Elizabeth most enjoys about her work is growing her potatoes, peas and beans.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to the market in Tarma where she sells them.  Over time, Elizabeth would like to buy new farmland, in order to increase her production.

This is Elizabeth's eighth loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make all of her repayments on time and she is prepared to do this.  Elizabeth is always up to date with all the agreements that are reached in her community bank.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanty nagar for the past six years in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to B. who is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to the passengers. The rickshaw he drives is rented and he wants to buy his own to earn maximum profits. 

Aasia is very supportive in nature. She carries out the responsibilities of a housewife and makes the utmost effort to bring comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband buy a new rickshaw. The owned rickshaw will help him to earn the whole fare for his struggle. 

Aasia is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and she will be able to enjoy a better financial life as a result. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Aasia.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: 5 Tân Sơn 1 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Liên N. Thị (19) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Liên is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each m ember of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 5 Tân sơn 1  Nam Ngạn (10.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Liên is married and has 2 school-aged children. She works in a family member's business which provides mechanical services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


In 2011, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting 5.787.900 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Hồ Thị Phương (20) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


2.  Lê Thị Phượng (21) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Liên N. Thị (19) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 5 Tân Sơn 1  Nam Ngạn (10.1.5  Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ cơ khí cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2011, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Hồ Thị Phương (20) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  Lê Thị Phượng (21) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab R. is 55 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Dimi, Imereti Region. Merab lives with his big family consisting of himself, his wife, Nani, two sons (28 and 32 years old), two daughters-in-law and three grandchildren (two grandsons are two years old and the granddaughter is one year old). 

Merab is leading the agricultural activities of the family. In particular, they have three milk cows and sell cheese on the local market. Also the family owns vineyard (400 grape vines). Grapes are sold locally. 

With the requested credit Merab plans to construct a greenhouse where vegetables will be grown during the whole year. Harvested vegetables will be sold on the local market. This will significantly increase the income of the family. The profit will be reinvested in further development of the greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old married man with a child. He is living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a motorcycle driver and also a part-times teacher for five years now. After realizing that the meager salary of a primary teacher could not support his family, he bought a motorcycle, and he is proud of the benefits he's reaping. He has a challenge of mechanical breakdowns, and his desire is to own at least three motorcycles. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Nida'a

texts.en: Nida'a is a 40-year-old married woman from Amman, Jordan. She is a tailor. Nida'a is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase materiA. to make more clothes and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase material to make clothes.

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va, 44 years old, is a construction worker with her husband. Both of them can earn $6 per day for their income. She has six children, three are studying and the other three are also working as construction workers. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $26 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy female pigs to feed instead of working as a construction worker. The reasons she wants to stop working are because she wants to stay home to take care of the children and because feeding pigs can make more income. She plans to repair her house and send the rest of her children to study so they can at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed at home

loans.name: Masimukele Group

texts.en:
Philile, a 48-year-old single mother of three, has been selling clothes out of her home and around her town for about one year. This is her only source of income.  With the loan that she has requested from WDB, Philile will purchase more clothes for her business, which she hopes to grow over the next five years. Customers who take her stock on credit and do not repay on time constitute her biggest challenge.

Philile, shown in the photo raising her hand, thanks WDB and Kiva for helping her. She says that this loan will help her business to grow and improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Irenea has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Irenea has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Irenea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and married. He has three children. 

He has been a mixed farmer for the last ten years. He was introduced to KADET by a registered client.

This is his third loan, with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs  such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un père de famille polygamme qui vit avec ses trois épouses dans son village, en milieu rurale.C'est un paysan qui exploite chaque année un champ de mil dont la production est essentiellement destinée à la consommation et un autre d'arachide dont la récolte est vendue pour rapporter des revenus à la famille.Parallèlement à cela, il achète chaque année trois veaux qu'il revend au terme de 6 mois de stabulation. Avec ces deux activités, il parvient à assurer correctement l'alimentation de sa famille et à pourvoir aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et épouses.Toutefois, depuis trois ans, il a arrêté l'élevage à cause du vol de ses deux bœufs à quelques jours de leur vente.Aprés avoir sécuriser son étable, il a décidé de reprendre cette activité et sollicite ainsi un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'IMCEC pour l'achat de 2 veaux. Leur vente lui apportera des revenus supplémentaires pour continuer à s'occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne de construire une clôture assez élever et d'augmenter ainsi le nombre de ses animaux.
texts.en:
The borrower is the father of a polygamous family; he lives with his three wives in his rural village. He is an agriculturalist who plants a field of millet every year whose produce is essentially destined for home consumption and another of peanuts that are sold to bring in income for the family. Besides that, he buys three calves every year and resells them after six months of fattening. With these two activities, he manages to feed his family appropriately and cover the daily needs of his  children and wives. However, in the last three years, he has not raised any cattle because two cows were stolen a few days before they were destined to be sold. 

After having made his stable secure, he has decided to take up this activity again and is therefore asking for a loan of 300,000 francs from U-IMCEC to use to buy two calves. Their sale will bring in supplementary income so he can continue to care for his family. His ambition is to build a corral so that he can continue cattle-raising and add to the number of animals he raises.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Ana Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comuna Sector 3 María, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. La arquitectura de Cuenca se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno lo que le hacen una ciudad muy especial.

La Señora Ana tiene 62 años es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, cuatro de sus hijos son casados e independientes, sus dos hijas solteras traban y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo es jubilado y pasa en casa, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Ana es de profesión costurera, realiza el arreglo de todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y también cría cerdos, cuye y pollos a los que los vende  en su comunidad.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en sus dos negocios, va a comprar telas e hilos para su taller y alimento para sus cerdos. 

Su meta es crecer en todas sus actividades.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana, 62, is a member of the Sector 3 Maria community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate, but happy and friendly people who value their culture and traditions.  The local architecture is a mix of colonial and modern, one of the things that makes Cuenca very special.  

Sra. Ana is married and has 6 children, all grown.  Four of the children are married and independent.  Her two single daughters work and help out with family expenses.  Her husband is retired and spends his time around the house.  They own the house where they live.

Dona Ana is a seamstress.  She makes all kinds of clothing.  She runs the house and still finds time to raise pigs, cuye and chickens, all of which she sells locally.

She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years and she will use this loan to supply her two businesses.  She will buy fabric and threads for her sewing business and feed for her pigs.

Her goal is to grow both businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business and feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años es casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales tienen 12, 10 y 1 año de edad; vive con su familia en Atuntaqui. Se considera como una persona emprendedora con deseos de superación.

Trabaja con su esposo e hijos en la crianza de animales, empezó con su negocio desde hace 7 años. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cuyes y cerdos para aumentar su negocio de la crianza de animales lo cual le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos al mismo tiempo.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno grande para criar todo tipo de animales de granja para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 10 and 1.  She lives with her family in Atuntaqui.  María considers herself to be an entrepreneurial person who has a desire to do well.

María works together with her husband and children raising animals.  She started her business seven years ago.  This is the first time that she has worked with FODEMI and she will use the loan that she is requesting to buy guinea pigs and pigs to increase her animal-raising business.  This will help her to increase her sales and profits at the same time.

María's dream is to buy a large plot of land so that she can raise all kinds of farmyard animals for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and pigs

loans.name: Oscar Napoleon

texts.es: Oscar Antonio de 29 años, tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi y venta de pan. Comenzó hace 2 años con su negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo con ambos negocios, ya que todos los días se dedica como mucho empeño, es así obtiene más clientes nuevos. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche  todos los días. Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar llantas, asientos, cadenas, lona, plásticos entre otros productos para su triciclo. En el futuro quiere seguir adelante con este medio de vida que le proporciona a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Oscar Antonio is 29 years old. He has a business which is providing tricitaxi service and selling bread. He began with his business two years ago and with the passing of time both businesses have been growing since every day he is dedicates himself with a lot of effort. In this way he obtained more new customers. He works from 6 in the morning until 8 at night every day. In order to be able to continue with his business, he wishes to buy wheels, seats, chains, canvas, and plastic, among other products for his tricycle. In the future, he wants to continue ahead with this way of life that provides his family with the necessary income.

loans.use: to purchase wheels, seats, chains, canvas, and plastic, among other products.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 22-year-old man from Madaba, Jordan. 

He has a party supply shop and he is requesting a loan of 1,500 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to purchase chrome chairs for parties instead of the ones that he rents from outside. 

Thaer is looking to expand his business by purchasing more supplies and moving the shop downtown.

loans.use: To purchase chrome chairs for the shop

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is aged 24 and married with 4 children between the ages of 11 and 1. She has been farming for 10 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk and maize for the local market.

Joan has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi, a Kiva partner, to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She sees herself being a large scale dairy farmer. She hopes she will generate enough income to provide her family with basic needs.

She says the high cost of feeds is a great limitation in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris is a married woman and has two children. Iris is 28-years-old residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Iris owns and operates a motorcycle transport to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. Iris has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Iris wants to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional  vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Concepcion Del Carmen

texts.es:
Concepción, vive con sus familiares, es soltera, no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la costura, elaborando prendas de vestir, tiene más de tres años de dedicarse a este oficio, esto lo aprendió en una academia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la costura como telas, hilos, botines,  broches, ciper, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener en el taller todo lo necesario para la confección de vestidos, blusas, faldas, ayudándole a brindar un mejor y más rápido servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de Concepción es ampliar el taller de costura, comprarse más equipo y tener más demanda.
texts.en:
Concepción lives with her relatives. She is single and has no children. Concepción is a seamstress who has been making clothes for more than three years. She learned this trade at an academy and now works every day from 6am to 7pm.

Concepción is currently requesting a loan to buy materials for sewing such as fabrics, thread, buttons, clasps, and zippers. This investment will help maintain her workshop by providing everything she needs to make dresses, blouses, and skirts. In addition, she will provide better and faster service to her customers.

Concepción has aspirations of expanding her workshop, buying more equipment, and generating more demand.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, clasps, and zippers.

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es: El joven Juan tiene 26 años y soltero, es egresado de la carrera de Administracion de servicio de hoteleria, actualmente trabaja en un restaurante de prestigio donde cumple la funcion de Mozo  y a su vez prepara tragos,  para subir de nivel en su trabajo le estan pidiendo una especializacion de bartender para que aprenda a preparar variedad de tragos es por ello que solicita el prestamo, su sueño de Juan es tener un buffete y ser reconocido. Sabemos que Juan  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: The young Juan is 26 years old and single. He is a graduate with a qualification in Hospitality Services Administration. He is currently working as a waiter at a prestigious restaurant where he also prepares drinks. In order to be promoted, he is required to take a course in bartending so that he can learn how to prepare a variety of drinks and it for this that he is asking for a loan. Juan's dream is to have a selfservice restaurant and be recognized. We know that Juan will achieve his goals with hard work and effort and the loans from Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to specialize in bartending.

loans.name: Filber

texts.es:
El señor Filber, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de thajras  del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja en la agricultura y produce: papa, arveja y cebolla  y los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a las comerciantes de la misma población de mizque.
Es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de su familia.
El Sr.F ilber está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas y fertilizantes, para aumentar más superficies  de cultivo y mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Filber is 36 years old and lives in the Thajras community in the municipality of Mizque, department of Cochabamba.

He works in farming and produces potatoes, peas, and onions which he sells from his home to his customers in the town of Mizque.

He is very respected in his community for his dedication to his work and his responsiblity for his family.

Filber requests the present loan to buy more seeds and fertilizers to increase his acreage, improve the quality of his crops, and increase production to make more income and thus improve the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Frank Howard

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Frank; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el socio tambien esta trabajndo en una empresa privada en el area de limpieza y sigue estudiando en la carrera de turismo,el socio quiere terminar de estudiar y poder salir adelante,su sueño del socio es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,aceite y leche al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Frank is 25 years old, single, and has one child. He continues to manage his grocery business, but he also works for a private company in the cleaning department. Frank is continuing his studies toward a degree in Tourism. He wants to finish his education so that he can get ahead. His dream is to expand his grocery store. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy products for his store such as rice, sugar, oil, and milk in bulk.

Frank is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: La señora Ana Lucia a sus 54 años de edad es madre de cinco hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujer a sus principales clientes quienes son sus familiares y conocidos, adicional a esta labor, la señora Ana Lucia tiene que cuidar dos días a la semana a un sobrino para aumentar sus ingresos puesto que esta separada del padre de sus 5 hijos y no cuenta con el apoyo de este para la manutención de su hogar. La señora Ana Lucia requiere de la compra de surtido con la esperanza de aumentar sus ventas y así sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. El sueño de la señora Ana Lucia es tener su propio almacén y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is 54 years old, and she has five children.  She sells women’s clothes to her main customers who are her relatives and acquaintances.  In addition to this work Ana Lucia has to take care of a nephew two days a week in order to increase her income.  She is separated from the father of her five children, and she does not have his support in maintaining her household.

Ana Lucia needs to buy stock in the hopes of increasing her sales.  This way her income to support her household will increase.

Ana Lucia’s dream is to have her own store and to generate direct employment in her community.

loans.use: to buy stock of women's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 23 year old single woman who has 5 family members from Irbid Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell.In the future she hopes to open a shop and she wants to buy a computer.
Since Noor is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan.
Noor prefers not to display her photo in the internet,thus the above photo is of her father

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell.

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI  est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yvette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yvette est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Yvette est mariée à un électricien bâtiment du nom de Aristide. Le couple à trois enfants, tous  scolarisés  et  à leur charge. Yvette  vit ensemble avec  ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Yvette vend par la méthode de distribution de l’huile d’arachide. Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu,  Yvette ensemble avec les membres du  groupe BIDOSSESSI, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de l'huile d'arachide

loans.name: Bether

texts.en:
Madam Bether A. is a dynamic and imposing young woman. She was born in Tsévié (district of Zio) in 1966. She is married does not have any child yet, because of reproductive health problems. But she raises her elder sister’s two (02) children. Coming from a very poor family, she had many problems because of the lack of support from her parents. But with eagerness to get out of her miserable situation, she never stopped struggling. In spite of her illiteracy, she is amazingly skillful, and owing to her many efforts, she succeeded in earning a little amount of money and begun a little clothing and other products business (toilet roll, can, generic products, etc.). After a hard beginning, she invested all of her energy and expertise in her activity. That is why she has a little place at the market of Nukafu where she sells to make some money for her survival. Her burning desire is to increase her sale and her source of income so that she can come out of her poverty. The credit of $ 850 she requested will help her buy cloths and essential products (soap, can, milk, etc.) which products are easily marketed in this festive end of year period.

Madame A. Bether est une jeune femme dynamique et imposante née à Tsévié (Préfecture de Zio) en 1966. Elle est mariée mais n’a pas encore d’enfant pour problème de conception. Elle a par contre à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa grande sœur. Issue d’une famille très pauvre, elle a connu beaucoup de difficultés à cause du manque de soutien de la part de ses parents. Mais voulant à tout prix sortir de sa situation misérable, elle n’a jamais cessé de se battre. Malgré son analphabétisme, elle dispose d’une habileté étonnante, et grâce à ses multiples efforts, elle réussit à gagner un peu d’argent et commença avec $ 55 un petit commerce de pagne et de produits divers (papier hygiénique, boîte de conserve, produits générique etc.). Après un début pénible, elle met toute son énergie et tout son savoir-faire au service de son activité, ce qui lui permet de disposer aujourd’hui d’un petit emplacement au marché de N’kafu où elle exerce son petit commerce pour sa survie. Son désir le plus ardent à ce jour est de pouvoir élargir son commerce et augmenter sa source de revenu afin de sortir de son état de pauvreté. Le crédit de $850 qu’elle sollicite va servir à acheter des pagnes et des produits de première nécessité (savon, boîte de conserve, lait, etc.) lesquels produits s’écoulent facilement en cette période des fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: To buy cloths and essential products (soap, can, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Somégna

texts.en:
Born in 1969 to a poor family, Ms. Somégna N’TSOUGAN is a married mother of three. She contributes toward the household expenses through income earned by raising goats. Her husband, a traditional blacksmith, has lost his ability to work due to a long-term illness. This has left Ms. N’tsougan solely responsible for the needs of the home. She is seeking a loan of $750 to construct an enclosure for her animals, install troughs and for the long-term storage of feed sacks. The implementation of this project will contribute to the adequate development of her animals, the sale of which will generate income that will likely alleviate the suffering she and her entire family endure.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 d’une famille pauvre, Madame N’TSOUGAN Somégna est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle contribuer aux dépenses du foyer à partir des revenus de son élevage de caprins. Son mari, forgeron traditionnel, a perdu sa force de travail à la suite d’une longue maladie ce qui laisse Madame N’TSOUGAN Somégna seule devant les charges du ménage. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour construire un enclos pour ses bêtes, installer des abreuvoirs et stocker des sacs d’aliments sur une longue période. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera au développement harmonieux des bêtes dont la vente périodique procurera des revenus susceptibles d’alléger les souffrances de cette femme et à travers elle toute sa famille.

loans.use: Construction of an animal enclosure, installation of troughs and food storage.

loans.name: Gulbas

texts.en: Gulbas M. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. She is a 52 year-old widow with two children. She has been in the business of selling fresh produce, such as parsley, spinach and radishes, at the local bazaar for over a decade. After receiving her first loan from Normicro last year, she was able to expand her sales. Gulbas is now requesting a loan to purchase more goods from her local agricultural suppliers in order to offer more fresh vegetables and fruits to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Rita Isela

texts.es:
Rita is single and she has two children. She came to Mérida five years ago looking for better opportunities and also to take care of her elderly mother. Since then, in order to make an income that would allow her to provide for her family, Rita has been selling costume jewelry and silver. The good quality of the products, which she makes herself, and her originality, have helped her business to grow. Demand for her products grew quickly.

In order to meet demand from her customers, Rita is requesting a loan of $475.00, which she will use to buy materials that she needs to make her products. She will return the loan in 6 months. Your help would be a great help to this family. Rita thanks you sincerely for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita es soltera y tiene dos hijos, desde hace cinco años llegó a Mérida, Yucatán en busca de mejores oportunidades y para poder cuidar de su madre que es de edad avanzada, desde entonces para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su familia Rita inició con la venta de bisutería y plata, la buena calidad de los productos que ella misma elabora y su originalidad le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio, pronto la demanda por sus productos se fue incrementando.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Rita está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra del material que necesita en la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, Rita agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a hard-working man. He's married and has two young daughters, ages 6 and 12. Household expenses increased by a lot when his daughters started school, and to offer his family a higher quality of life, Francisco decided, along with his regular job, to start a business selling footwear and jewelry two years ago. His wife helps him with the sales, and together they have been able to grow the business. They started out with few supplies but thanks to good response from their clients they have decided to increase the variety and quality of their products.

To increase their merchandise, Francisco is requesting a loan of $475, which he plans to repay within five months, with the hope of meeting his customers' demands and continue growing. With your support, you can help this family and their business. They are very grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador, está casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, de 6 y 12 años de edad, los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron mucho con las colegiaturas de sus hijas y para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, además del empleo que tiene Francisco decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de calzado y joyería hace dos años, su esposa le ayuda en las ventas y juntos han logrado hacer crecer su negocio, iniciaron vendiendo poca mercancía pero al ver que era bien aceptada por sus clientes han decidido incrementar la variedad y cantidad de los productos que comercializan.

Para poder surtir mejor su negocio Francisco solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Con tu ayuda podrás ayudar a esta familia, ellos necesitan y agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: I am Samina K.. I am the mother of four children all of whom study. My husband is a lawyer and currently he operates from one of his friend’s office. My husband is able to get a suitable number of cases and he now feels a need forhis own office. However, he does not have the required start up finances to set up his own office. We therefore require a loan  that we will add to our savings and will arrange for an office.

loans.use: Get an office to rent

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar is 37 years old. She is a mother of three kids and has a higher education. For the past 10 years, Dilbar has been an entrepreneur. When she first started her business, Dilbar sold clothes in different markets. Currently she is renting a space in a department store. Because of inflation, Dilbar decided to apply for a loan with MicroInvest. She wants to expand her inventory and open a new point of sale in the future.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Дильбар возраст 37 лет ,мать троих детей, имеет высшее образование. Уже 10 лет как она занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Раньше она торговала на базарах,а сейчас арендует отдел в магазине. Но в связи с инфляцией она хочет расширить ассортимент. И решила кредитоваться в Микроинвесте. В даоьнейшем хочет открыть еще один отдел.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Luzdelia

texts.es:
Mr. Vicente, his wife Luzdelia and his three kids have been very well-known by their noble artisan work in clay. Vicente and Luzdelia start their daily work at 8:00 am and finish at 8:00 pm. They have increased their popularity thanks to their detailed work.

They work really hard to pay their three kids college tuitions, since their three kids are currently attending to Puno College. Vicente and Luzdelia would like to maximize her clay and plaster art skills and generate extra income with the help of this loan they will buy raw materials to increase production and fulfill the demand of their beautiful artisan work.

Translated from spanish to english by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

La familia de don Vicente y su esposa Luzdelia, siempre ha sido muy conocida por la noble labor artesanal que realizan.Este fascinante oficio lo heredaron de sus padres, quienes con mucha agilidad y habilidad realizaban cada una de las piezas que adornaban sus objetos de la línea Ornamental que ofrecían sus familias y que Vicente y su esposa actualmente con el mismo amor y paciencia inculcan en sus tres queridos hijos.Luzdelia y su esposo inician su labor diaria basada en arcilla a las 8:00 de la mañana, culminándola a las 8:00 de la noche, debido a que constantemente tienen gran cantidad de solicitudes por los novedosos y finos acabados de sus trabajos.Estos encantadores padres realizan muy contentos este arte, con el objetivo de generar ingresos extras y solventar la carrera profesional que cada uno de ellos ha elegido en la Universidad de Puno. El deseo de Luzdelia y Vicente es hacer de su trabajo el mejor, con excelentes acabados y novedosos modelos, es por esa razón que desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de materia prima, arcilla y pintura con el objetivo de seguir produciendo su divino arte.Ayudemos a cristalizar los sueños de la señora Luzdelia y su esposo Vicente.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material: clay and paint

loans.name: Kikooza G(Iv) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Gertrude N..  She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 1000000 to expand her stone business.  Gertrude is 42 years old and is divorced.  She has 3 children, ranging from age 20 to 16 and her children go to school.  Each week, Gertrude hopes to be able to buy a new house.  Gertrude is joined in her small group by Jesca M., Vicky N., Naiga Namubiruu, and Alice N..  Jesca M. is currently in the business of piggery and poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 1000000 to buy more piglets.  Vicky N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to invest in her stone business.  Naiga Namubiruu is currently in the drug shop business and is requesting a loan of UGX 200000 to purchase more drugs for sale.  Alice N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 200000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in the stone quarrying business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is single and has one child.  She supports her child buy selling food products and rice at Abura market in Cape Coast.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy additional food products to stock her food stand.  Veronica hopes this loan will increase her profits.

Veronica is also a member of a lending group called “Faith Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana

loans.use: To buy additional food products to stock her food stand.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
a señora Luz Marina C. L. D. Escudero pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” vive en la Región San Mrs. Luz Marina C. L. D. Escudero is a member of the “Banco Comunal, Manos Unidas”, she lives in the Region of San Martín, Province of San Martín, District of Morales, and her address is Fonavi Mz “F” Lote 2, where her business of groceries – general store is located. The opportunity of a loan from the “Banco Comunal” will allow her to develop her business and to stay with her children, reason why she left a previous job. She is grateful to the “Banco Comunal” for being able to expand her business and she feels satisfied and happy with strength to go on expanding her business and to set up a restaurant in the premises. She also works with delivery service.

With the loan of S/.3,000.00 ( $1,100.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase sacks of rice, sugar, personal care and home care products, soft drinks, different variety of candy, and thus meet the needs of her customers. Doña Luz Marina is 48 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children. Her children assist her in serving the customers and in the delivery service.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz Marina C. L. D. Escudero pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Morales, su domicilio está ubicado en Fonavi Mz “F” Lote 2, donD. también se ubica su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes – bodega. La oportunidad D. un préstamo en el Banco Comunal le permite desarrollar este negocio y poder estar junto a sus hijos, motivo por el cual dejó un trabajo. Agradece al B.C porque pudo ampliar su negocio y se siente realizada y feliz, con mucha fuerza para seguir ampliando el negocio e instalar a la par un restaurante en su mismo local. Asimismo trabaja con servicios D. delivery.

Con el crédito D. S/. 3,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará sacos D. arroz, azúcar, productos D. aseo personal y D. limpieza para el hogar, bebidas gaseosas, golosinas en diversas variedades, y así satisfacer la necesidad D. sus clientes. La señora Luz Marina tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, en el trabajo le ayudan sus hijos en lo que respecta a la atención al cliente y los servicios D. delivery.

loans.use: Purchase more products to make business grow and be able to set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Hostensia

texts.en:
Hostensia S. is single mother with four children. Faced with the challenges of being a single mother, she found it difficult to take care of her children, especially paying for schooling. In addition she sustained a serious accident, which placed her in abject poverty. Because of her lack of education she could not secure a good job for herself and she decided to try her hand at farming. Unfortunately, she didn't know how to improve on traditional farming techniques before coming to GHAPE.

After joining GHAPE, she learned farming techniques which have helped her improve yield. She has a successful history with previous loans, which she managed successfully and repaid in full.

Given a new loan, she plans to continue to invest in farming and embark on two new ventures: selling shoes and running a drug store. These activities are going to help her community, which needs a reliable supply of food, footware, and medication.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of farm equpment, shoes, and medicine

loans.name: Rafiya

texts.en:
Rafiya T. is 42 years old and married. She is the loving mother of three children. Her eldest daughter is studying at the university and her sons are of school age. Her husband is a teacher of chemistry. Rafiya is a seamstress. She sewsthe national style of dresses for women and girls. Rafiya works at home, accepting orders and creating them. She has been in this business for more than six years. Rafiya purchases the fabrics required for sewing by herself in the market. Rafiya is a very popular seamstress and has lots of orders. The business is stable, generating considerable income for the family.

Rafiya is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 US Dollars) for the term of 10 months to purchase a new sewing machine. Rafiya thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan repayment.

loans.use: Rafiya would like to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Limpia

texts.es:
Limpia is married to Bernardo, and they have three young children who are devoted exclusively to their studies. Limpia travels to sell clothes. She started the business with the support of her husband. Bernardo is a professional mechanic and has been in this industry for a long time.

People in the area are very fond of both of them as they are both very hard-working and helpful. The loan Limpia is looking for is to cover the costs of some client's orders, asshe sells in cash and on credit. This is the reason why she needs a constant injection of capital in order to increase her sales.

As her children are young she continually needs income to support them and in this way help them to become professionals. According to what she tells us, her children are very studious but education is very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Limpia es casada con el señor Benardo, tienen tres hijos menores quienes se dedican exclusivamente en el estudio. La señora Limpia se dedica en el ramo de venta ambulante de prendas de vestir. Ella inicio el negocio con el apoyo de su marido, pues, el señor Benardo es mecánico profesional y se dedica en el ramo desde hace tiempo.

Ambas personas son muy apreciadas en la zona ya que son muy trabajadores, además, muy serviciales. El crédito solicitado por la señora es para cubrir algunos pedidos de sus cliente, ya que la política de venta es al contado y a crédito, razón por el cual necesita de una inyección constante de capital y así poder aumentar sus ingresos

Como sus hijos son menores ella necesita de esos ingresos para poder apoyarles constantemente y así lograr que sean profesionales pues, según nos comenta, sus hijos son muy estudiosos, pero la educación es muy cara.

loans.use: To purchase jeans of different sizes and colours for both men and women.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed, 22 years old, is a single man. He lives in the north of Lebanon.

Mohamed owns a small shop, which is next to his home. At the shop he sells and repairs cell phones. He needs a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more goods for his shop.

Mohamed is very ambitious and motivated. His priority in life is increasing his income to ensure a successful future. He wants to get married and raise a family.

This is the first time Mohamed has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase cellphones

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Maritza E. has been living in the Adolfo Reyes neighborhood ever since she was a child, and she still lives there with her husband. She is 43 years of age and has two children, ages 1 and 13. Her husband owns and operates a taxi cab in order to help with the household needs. Maritza owns a kiosk in which she sells fast food, soft drinks, candy, and much more. She has been in business for 4 years, and has experienced highs and lows. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase more snacks in order to fill her kiosk and offer her customers a variety of products. Her dream is to be able to improve her family’s quality of life and support her daughter with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maritza habita en el barrio Adolfo Reyes, desde muy pequeña ahí ha crecido con su familia y todavía ahí sigue habitando con su esposo, ella tiene 43 años de edad, y tiene dos hijos de 1 y 13 años de edad, su esposo es dueño de un taxi y lo trabaja para ayudar en todas las necesidades del hogar. Maritza tiene un kiosco en donde vende comida, refrescos, gaseosa, golosinas, y mucho más, tiene cuatro años de estar en las ventas, algunas bajas y otras se superan. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar mas golosinas y llenar el kiosco para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su sueño es poder mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y apoyar a su hija en los estudios.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafía llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 años, él se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigragia como lo son:  tazas, llaveros, impresión de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos.  El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.  Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atención y administracion del negocio.
