El préstamo él lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta época hay muchos pedidos.

Su deseo es hacer cada día más grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la protección económica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 32 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores satisfactoriamente, es soltera, vive en el Jr. Independencia Nº 617 del distrito de Ilave, provincia  El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos para su tienda, como champú, perfume, productos de limpieza, etc. A los 18 años de edad empezó a vender jugo en el mercado. Posteriormente cambió de negocio por la venta de cosméticos y regalos como peluches, joyeros, joyas, artículos de perfumería, etc.

Con este crédito S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más artículos para su perfumería.

Su gran deseo es ser empresaria y tener muchas tiendas para generar trabajo a los demás.
texts.en:
Vilma is a single 32 year old woman who completed her higher education. She lives at Jr Independencia number 617 in the Ilave district in the El Collao province of Puno, and is a partner in the San Miguel Community Bank. She used her initial 300 sol loan to purchase items for her store, including shampoo, perfume, cleaning products, etc. She began selling juice in the market when she was 18 years old. later she changed her business and began selling cosmetics and gifts, including stuffed animals, jewelry boxes, jewelry, perfume products etc. With this 500 sol loan which she will repay in 3 payments, she will purchase additional items for her perfume stand. Her greatest desire is to be a business woman and to have many stores that provide jobs to others.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of purfume and related items.

loans.name: Ameena M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Ameena Baji is the wife of M. M. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 40 years. She is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are drivers by profession. Ameena Baji is a seamstress and shares her earnings with her husband to meet the house expenses. Her husband is also a driver. They have a vehicle named “Shahzore” which they use to deliver (vegetables and fruits) from one place to another. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bashiran Baji wants loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rasoolan Baji wants a loan to buy material (beads and colored thread and cloth) for her decorative embroidery business. Nusrat Baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair computers. Samia Kalsoom Baji wants a loan to buy a digital camera for her photo-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle named "Shahzore"

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Viller de 15 años y Fany de 9. Se dedica a la venta de tunas desde hace 10 años, optó por incursionar en este negocio por la gran demanda que tiene peculiar fruta, ya que resulta muy agradable al paladar. A Ninfa le gusta su trabajo, ya que es muy tranquilo y puede disponer de su tiempo de acuerdo a lo vendido, por ejemplo si acaba con la venta de tunas puede retirarse a su hogar más temprano. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que lidiar con las espinas que se le introducen en las manos cuando pela estas ricas frutas. Ninfa se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de tunas para aumentar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos para esta navidad.
texts.en:
Ninfa, 37, is a single mother of two children: Viller, 15, and Fany,9. She began selling prickly pears 10 years ago. She opted for this business knowing that prickly pears are in great demand for their great flavor. What Ninfa likes about her job is that it is peaceful and if she finishes her sales early, she can go home early to care for her children. The hardest part of Ninfa's job is to avoid the thorns on the prickly pears, which hurt her hands when she peels the fruit. This is Ninfa's first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase a larger number of prickly pears to increase her income in this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing larger number of prickly pears

loans.name: Francisca Johanna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el municipio de El Viejo, se encuentra la señora Francisca L. el cual se ha desempeñado en su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son elaboradas por ella misma y a la vez ella misma las vende con el propósito de mantener a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

La señora L. ha acudido a Ceprodel por la razón de que requiere un crédito para la compra de la leña y del maíz y para esto ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the municipality of El Viejo, one can find Ms. Francisca L., who has worked to make and sell tortillas that are made and sold by herself to maintain and support her family with her much-needed support. Ms. L. has approached Ceprodel for the reason that she needs a loan to purchase firewood and corn and for this she has come to Ceprodel to apply for credit and thus succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw goods

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two girls and three males. One of her children has completed junior high school. The rest are still in school. Abena’s husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and her children in a rented apartment in a small town called Koforidua near Offinso. It is a farming as well as a commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Abena is a businesswoman. She trades to support her husband in taking care of the family and undertaking projects. She deals in cereals (maize). Abena buys bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding villages. She sells to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market to food vendors. Abena has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to be able to procure maize in large quantities so she can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Thach

texts.en: S. is a local primary teacher, age 57. He is married to Mrs. Hay, 56 years old, who raises chickens at their home for sale. They have eight children who live together in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. The family's daily income is not enough for other expenditures, so S. is asking for the loan amount of US$ 300 as capital to run a grocery store out of their home. The loan will help improve the family finances. (S.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To run a grocery store out of their home

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Tomás y su hija de 15 años llamada Roxana, la cual es su principal apoyo en su negocio, ellos viven en su casa propia. Se viene dedicando a la venta de frutas desde hace 9 años en el mercado de “Pachacutec”, que está ubicado en su misma localidad, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingresos. En este trabajo la ayuda su hija Roxana la cual atiende el puesto cuando su mamá sale a comprar más mercadería o se le presenta algún contratiempo. A Susana le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que siempre está en contacto con la gente y ha hecho muy buenas amigas con sus vecinas del mercado, además las ganas que le pone y la alegría con la que atiende, hacen que la venta sea buena y le arroje ganancias satisfactorias. Pero como toda una microempresaria, Susana quiere expandir su negocio y hacer que sea mucho más próspero, para lo cual quiere ponerle un techo nuevo a su puesto. Susana ha trabajado con MFP desde aproximadamente 3 años, siendo una cliente muy puntual y responsable en sus pagos, ahora tiene un préstamo individual, pero trabajó primero con un banco comunal con el cual estuvo muy feliz, ya que hizo buenas amigas y todas eran muy responsables. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más mercadería y en arreglar su puesto para brindar una mejor atención a su clientela, Susana está muy feliz y espera seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana is 45 years old and lives with her husband Tomás and her 15 year old daughter Roxana who is her principal support in her business; they live in their own house. Susana has dedicated herself to the sale of fruits for the past 9 years in the market in “Pachacutec”, which is located in her same neighborhood given that this is her principal source of income. Her daughter Roxana helps her in this work by taking care of their stand when her mother leaves to purchase more merchandise or has some setback. Susana enjoys her work very much given that she is always in contact with people and has become good friends with her neighbors in the market. In addition, the effort that she puts forth in her job and the happiness with which she attends her customers make for good sales and give her satisfactory earnings. Like with any micro-enterprise, Susana wants to expand her business and to make it much more prosperous, for which she needs to install a new roof on her stand. Susana has worked with the MFP Bank for approximately 3 years, being a punctual client and responsible with her payments. She now has an individual loan, but first worked in a communal bank with which she was very happy, given that she made good friends who were all very responsible. She will invest the money requested in the purchase of more merchandise and in repairing her stand to offer better service to her clients. Susana is very happy and hopes to continue progressing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise, and repair her stand.

loans.name: Rukhsana Akbar Ali Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is twenty-nine years old and has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the last eight years. Her husband, A. A., sells construction supplies. He has three years of experience in this business. Rukhsana baji is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters are in kindergarten. Rukhsana baji is applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies, such as cement and sand, to help her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Zeb-un-nisa baji wants a loan to buy supplies (books, pencils and notebooks) for her book shop. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sakina baji wants a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt D. is 43, married, and the mother of two. Both her children go to an elementary school.

Since 2006, she has been running a clothing sales business at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Tuvshinjargal, helps her and sews women's topcoats. Erdenetsogt sells only women's apparel sewn by herself and her husband. With their business profit, the couple has bought a plot of land to live on. They now live in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent), and are planning to build a house.

With this loan, Erdenetsogt will buy raw materials such as cotton, zippers, and buttons. Their dream is to expand their family business and have their own large tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as cotton, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат- женщина торгующая женской и детской одеждой. Она берёт кредит для увеличения своего бизнеса. По бизнесу ей помогает её муж, который торгует в отделе женской одежды. Следующий займ хочет использовать для закупа летнего ассортимента. Мамлакат благодарит всех инвесторов Микроинвест за сотрудничество и своевременное финансирование.
texts.en:
Mamlakat is a woman who sells women's and children's clothing. She takes out loans to increase her business. Her husband helps her with the business by selling in the women's department. She wants to use her next loan to buy a summer assortment of clothes. Mamlakat is thanking all the MicroInvest lenders for partnership and timely financing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer assortment of clothing

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El Señor Joel López tiene 46 años de edad, habitante del barrio Memorial Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene dos hijos ambos estudiando. Como todos padres preocupados por la seguridad de sus hijos  la culminación de construir su vivienda es una prioridad.Don Joel trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada del país, siendo un trabajo muy estresante y de alto riesgo. Pero es un recurso económico que le genera el ingreso para sustentar a su familial los planes a corto plazo es seguir con la construcción de su vivienda y con el préstamo que solicita, es para comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines y bloques para seguir con su proyecto. Agradecido con Afodenic por el apoyo y la confianza con que le ha otorgado los préstamos este es su onceavo ciclo y se siente contento por los beneficios ya que gracias a los créditos va poder tener una casa digna la cual es un anhelo para su familia ya que su casa es insegura y ya esta en malas condiciones.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su casa de concreto

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cleotilde G. es una dama muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de frutas comercializadas en su establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua ofreciendo todo tipo de frutas como lo son melones, papayas, granadillas, entre otros. 

La razón por la que la señora Cleotilde ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y de esta manera comercializarlas en su localidad y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Cleotilde Garcia is an industrious lady who sells fruit from her stall at the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She stocks all types of fruit such as melons, papaya, passion fruit, amongst others.

Mrs. Cleotilde has come to Ceprodel in order that she can benefit from a loan to buy fruits and then sell them in her local area and thus move forward with her business, which is in such need of investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi C., 37, is a domestic farmer who owns a hectare of farmland in the village, where she grows rice. She has been in this sector for more than 20 years. She is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are students in the local public school. Her husband is responsible and works as a local building worker. Yi C. will be using the loan money to purchase a water buffalo in order to help with plowing her farmland during this rice-growing season. This will alleviate the hard physical labor of growing her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo

loans.name: Mdawi-2 Group

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the "Mdawi-2"  borrower group in Kiborilon, Kilimanjaro. She is a 28-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of 1 child. Her child is 3 years old. She also cares for 1 other dependent. 

Neema started her own business selling shoes and fabric 2 years ago. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Neema’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shoes and fabric. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Neema hopes to save money and expand her business. 

Fortunata, another member of the "Mdawi-2" borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business of selling vitenge and kanga (kinds of traditional fabric).

Oliva, also a member of the same group, requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai S. is a 51-year-old woman living in Faleula Fogaa. She is married and has six adult children. Fenumiai owns and operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She recently opened her store and is earning approximately 650 WST a month in business.

Fenumiai joined SPBD to gain access to their financial services designed to improve her living situation and business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 4400 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase additional inventory for her store. Fenumiai is now requesting a loan of 3250 WST which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Fenumiai from SPBD.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life for people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells provisions and has been in the business for the past ten years.

Alex hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mr. Seu Lorng Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mr. Seu L. of the Mr. Seu L. Village Bank Loan Group lives in Kdei Ta Hok in Kandal province where he is president of the village bank. He has selected ten villagers to participate in the bank’s loan program, all of whom are using their loans for different purposes. Five members in this group have end-of-term loans while the rest have conventional loans requiring monthly payments.

Seu is a farmer who cultivates rice on his land. His wife, Mrs. Cheiv Breuch, is a weaver and pig breeder. Now she wants to expand her pig breeding business by purchasing more piglets. Mr. Seu L. is requesting a loan for this purpose.

About AMK:

End-of-term (EOT) loans are Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea's (AMK’s) main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan’s term. It allows them, however, to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely A. is from the village of Tugas. She is 57 years old. Mely is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mely owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mely has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mely is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marvin Wilfredo

texts.es: Marvin Wilfredo A. B. reside en Sacacoyo en el departamento de La Libertad. Marvin tiene tan solo 21 años de edad se encuentra acompañado con Verónica que tiene 23 años de edad. Esta joven pareja lleva dos años dedicando a la venta de verduras de manera ambulante, Marvin carga todos los días su carro a las 5:00 am, para empezar su largo recorrido  hasta llegar a su destino, pueblos y cantones donde sus verduras son demandadas y  rápidamente vendidas, el deseo de Marvin es surtir su carro con mayor cantidad de verduras y así incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremetar su inventario

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget, 43 years old and married with four children, has sold ladies' clothes at retail prices to her customers for a long time. Since this is the high season for her business, she hopes to meet the demands of her customers through a loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Bridget hopes to own a boutique in the future.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' clothes to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 64 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive junto a su esposa, su madre y un nieto en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la carpinteria desde hace más de 17 años. Empezó fabricando ataúdes en el taller de un amigo de su padre, poco a poco conoció mas de este oficio y empezó a trabajar en sus propios pedidos. Actualmente fabrica camas, roperos y puertas para luego venderlas en la ciudad de Trujillo y en Casagrande.

Sus trabajos son bastante solicitados debido a la calidad y responsabilidad con que los elabora. El está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más madera y de una sierra circular.

El es un padre honrado, responsable y muy trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es seguir equipando su taller para seguir sacando adelante a los suyos y brindarle las calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
. Eugenio, 64, has 4 children and lives with his wife, her mother and a grandson in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a carpenter for the past 17 years. He began building coffins in the shop of a friend of his father's. Little by little he learned more carpentry skills and began to work on his own orders. Currently, he makes beds, wardrobes and doors for sale in the city of Trujillo and in Casagrande. His items are quite popular due to their quality and workmanship. He is asking for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa: 1,000 new soles to buy more lumber and a circular saw. He is an honest, responsible and very hard-working father. His greatest desire is to continue to equip his workshop so that he can continue to see his loved ones get ahead and offer them the quality of life they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber and a circular saw.

loans.name: Lidubina

texts.es:
Lidubina tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros. Junto a su esposo se encargan de velar por los animales, para que mientras permanezcan en su establo estén saludables. Asimismo, él conoce algunas técnicas para la inseminación de las vacas y así tengan más becerros y produzcan más leche, la cual venden diariamente
Lidubina y su esposo sueñan con tener un terreno propio donde puedan construir su casa y tener un establo más amplio. 

Esta es la tercera vez que ella tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
Lidubina, 24, lives with her husband and 6-year-old son in her parents' house. For the last 6 years she has raised cows and bulls. She and her husband care for the animals so that they will be healthy while they are stabled. Also, he is skilled in certain insemination techniques so the cows will have more calves and produce more milk, which are sold daily. Lidubina and her husband hope to have land of their own where they can build their house and a larger stable. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of a communal bank so she commits, once more, to be punctual with her repayments. The funds requested will be used to buy a cow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita M. is from the village of Talakag in Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Arcelita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Arcelita sells  cooked bananas and other snacks to eat during the day. Arcelita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Arcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to buy ingredients for her snacks. Arcelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to buy more raw ingredients to sell. This will be Arcelita's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Pahxi Gricelda

texts.es: Pahxi es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene dos hijos y los dos  están  a su cargo. esta señora dio inicio hace 12 años, su actividad es la compra de ropa dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su familia. Ella ha buscado la manera de salir adelante por lo que cada día se preocupa por mostrar sus productos a sus diferentes clientes. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Pahxi is a very happy and responsible woman. She has two children for whom she is responsible. She began her business 12 years ago buying clothing and kept this job because when she began to work as a dedicated and responsible mother she decided to help provide her family’s income as she had to ensure her children’s future. She has looked for a way to be successful so every day she makes sure to show her products to different customers. Today she seeks financing to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits because the Christmas season is near and she has many orders. Her wish is to continue strengthening herself so that her children have their basic needs met.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her busines

loans.name: Oumar

texts.en:
Mr. Oumar Kassé, though only 27, has worked in barber shops for almost 15 years. As a student, he worked part-time at his father's shop and, after leaving school at age 17, he began working full time. Mr. Kassé says he enjoys the daily interactions with his customers, but notes that he has a lot of competition as his shop is in the busy Grand Thies market, where there are many barber shops.
Mr. Kassé will use his loan for a personal use: renovating his bedroom in his family's small house. He says the roof leaks and there are a number of other small problems which, with this loan, he can finally fix. Oumar does not yet have a family of his own, but supports his mother and sisters. He will pay back the loan with the revenue from his barber shop.

loans.use: To repair and renovate his bedroom

loans.name: Beatrice Clay

texts.en: Beatrice Clay K. owns a retail shop in Nambale, Busia district. She started this business in the year 2007 after a previous business as a door-to-door vendor. She buys her stock once a week from Busia town.  Beatrice would like a loan of Kshs. 10, 000 to use in increasing the stock in her shop.  She joined Kiva partner K-MET in order to empower herself both health-wise and education-wise. Her future plan is to to achieve self-reliance and guarantee education for her children.

loans.use: To increase her business stock.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie N. is from the village of Molatuhan Bajo in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie is an employee in someone else's laundry business. Elvie has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to use as additional capital to renovate her house. This will be Elvie's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation

loans.name: Aboubakrine Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aboubakrine Moussa B. est âgé de 60 ans et gère une famille composée de sa femme, ses 7 enfants et de ses 4 frères.   Spécialiste en chaussures depuis 1968, Monsieur B. est formateur en chaussures au lycée Maurice De La Fosse de Dakar. C’est par amour qu’il a embrassé ce métier et pense que  seul  l’aspect  protecteur et l’élégance sont les aspects les plus importants de son travail. Souciant de la nécessité de s’autogérer, Monsieur Aboubakrine B.  en parallèle de son activité compte mettre en place son propre atelier afin de confectionner des produits (chaussures, sac, ...etc)destinés à la vente et de former des jeunes qui n'ont pas la chance d'aller à l'école. 
Ainsi, pour l’avancement de son travail Monsieur B. souhaitait un financement de 150 000 FCFA auprès de sa caisse Jammi Xaleyi d’U-IMCEC Thiès. Cependant il compte acheter des matières premières pour les 95 000 FCFA et les 55 000 FCFA qui restent régler des besoins personnels (payer la facture d’électricité de sa maison, location…). 
Enfin tout en remerciant d’avance les prêteurs, Monsieur Aboubakrine pense que le crédit va lui permettre d’assainir ses passifs et de créer des produits (comme par exemple le sac dans la photo  qu’il a confectionné pour lui-même) destinés à la vente.
texts.en:
Mr. Aboubakrine Moussa B. is 60 years old and is in charge of a family made up of his wife, his seven children and his four brothers. A specialist in shoes since 1968, Mr. B. is a teacher of shoe-making at the Maurice De La Fosse high school in Dakar. He took up this profession out of love and believes that the protective element of shoes and their elegance are the most important aspects of his work. Concerned by the necessity to manage his affairs by himself, Mr. B. is planning to run a parallel activity by setting up his own workshop and making products (shoes, bags) to sell; he plans also to train young people who do not have the opportunity to go to school. Thus, in order to advance his work, Mr. B. would like a loan of 150,000 FCFA from his savings bank, Jammi Xaleyi, which belongs to U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) in Thies. He is planning to buy basic materials for 55,000 FCFA, and the balance of 55,000 FCFA will be used to cover personal needs (to pay the electricity bill for his house, rent..). Finally in thanking his lenders in advance, Mr. B. thinks that the loan will allow him to settle his debts and to create products (such as the bag in the photo, which he made himself) for sale.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get supplies of basic materials and pay expenses

loans.name: Sosina

texts.en:
Sosina  Suilaulau is 56 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sosina  has 3 years of experience in this business.  Sosina  needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 560 talas or US $233 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sosina  joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sosina 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD :http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Agustina B's Group

texts.en:
Agustina B B. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 46 years old. Agustina B is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Agustina B is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Agustina B joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Agustina B from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 42 años, vive con su madre y su hija en su casa que es propia. Hace mas de 8 años trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de cosmetología a domicilio, ya que sus clientes necesitan de un tratamiento capilar, corte, peinado y teñido de cabello. Su trabajo es de todos los días y siempre esta muy al pendiente de sus clientes, por lo que también ofrece productos de belleza para complementar su servicio. Esta actividad le permite tener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, es por ello que se proyecta a tener su salón de belleza con todos sus equipos. Este es su 24 crédito con MFP, disfruta ser parte de su grupo comunal, además es muy responsable con sus pagos  y considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de secadora de cabello y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old. She lives with her mother and daughter in her own home. She has been providing in-home cosmetology services for more than eight years; doing hair treatments, haircuts, hair colorings, etc. She works every day, always being attentive to her customers, to whom she also offers beauty products to complement her services. This business allows her to have the income necessary to cover her family expenses. This is why she wants to start her own, well equipped, beauty salon. This will be her 24th loan thorough MFP. She likes being part of this communal group. She has demonstrated great responsibility with her repayments and she feels that this loan will be very useful in helping her to grow her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a beauty salon

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen C. V.  tiene 50 años, es casada,  tiene  8 hijos que se llaman Raúl de 30, David de 27,  Janeth de 24, Agnelio de 23, Mercedes de 20, Salomón de 18, Saúl de 16 y Nancy de 13 de  años  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Carmen trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, tomate.   Vende los productos en el los mercados de Guaranda y Riobamba. 
Carmen solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para los sembrios.  Su meta es  que sus precios no estén bajos al momento de la cosecha.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son la sobreproducción de maíz y ahí es cuando los precios se ponen malos. Carmen manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta conversan con los vecinos sobre la ecuación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen C. V. is 50 years old, married, and has eight children: Raul (age 30), David (age 27), Janeth (age 24), Agnelio (age 23), Mercedes (age 20), Salomón (age 18), Saúl (age 16), and Nancy (age 13). They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Carmen has been farming all of her life as the main source of income for her family. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, and tomatoes. She sells her products at the markets in Guaranda and Riobamba.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies for her crops. Her goal is to avoid earning low prices during harvest season. Her challenges include overproducing corn when prices are not favorable. In her free time, Carmen says she enjoys talking with her neighbors about her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie M., 51, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Jose M., a Barangay Councilor, and they are blessed with two children. Annalie makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been into managing their own Internet cafe for quite some time now.

Annalie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business. 

To ensure the success of her business, Annalie would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying additional computer units for their Internet cafe.

Annalie dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education and be able to acquire their own house and lot.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer units for her Internet cafe

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru J. M. is an entrepreneur and a married businesswoman. She runs a pharmacy at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her business goods from the wholesale pharmaceutical shops at Kariakoo City shopping centre and other shops around. She manages to meet her family’s daily needs from her business income.

Nuru is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Eduviges Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Eduviges Antonio H. F., es casado tiene 38 años de edad, y su familia es de 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos, él labora como docente en Tecuantepe tiene a 12 años de experiencia en esta actividad.

Ellos habitan en una vivienda muy humilde, debido a sus condiciones limitadas económicamente es para su hogar que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la edificación y sobretodo la reparación de su hogar, con el crédito compraran piedra, hierro, cemento, piedrín, con este material se edificara un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda y se embaldosara el patio, debido a que en la temporada de invierno los insectos traen muchas enfermedades que amenazan con la salud de sus hijos adolecentes, es para la satisfacción de sus hijos que desean realizar este esfuerzo económico, asi como la proteccion de los miembros de la familia debido a que habitan en un àrea de la ciudad, que no goza de mucha seguridad social.
texts.en:
Eduviges Antonio H. F. is 38 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works selling food and beverages. He works as a teacher en Tecuantepe and has 12 years of experience in this field. They live in a very humble home due to their limited finances. For this reason, they seek a loan to purchase construction materials that will allow them to improve and above all repair their home. With the credit, they will buy stone, iron, cement, and gravel to improve the wall behind their home and to tile the patio, because in the winter insects bring many illnesses that threaten the health of their young children. It is for the satisfaction of their children that they wish to see through this economic feat, as well as the protection of their family members since they live in an area of the city that does not enjoy good security.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, iron, cement, gravel for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials (zinc, iron, cement, etc.) & pay for labor

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra T. is from the village of Miputak. She is 44 years old and is married with two adult children. Isidra owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Isidra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Isidra is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Marady

texts.en:
Mr. Marady M. ( in the photo), is 24 year-old and his wife, Mrs. Sreynet Kong, 22 years old, have been married since 2007 and have just had a young son. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Marady has been a driver for two years, while his wife is a garment factory worker. The couple spend a lot of money for traveling cost and do not have their own transportation for commuting. Marady decided to ask for his first loan in the amount of $500 purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor P. is 52 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. He is from the village of Rizal within the municipality of Quirino, Isabela Province on the islands of Luzon. To make a living, Victor plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been in business for over 35 years and earns approximately 28000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Victor joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Victor is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Victor from ASKI. He plans to use all additional revenue to improve his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: God Gift Group

texts.en:
Mary S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Gift.  She is 34 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 7 and 29 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For eight years, she has been selling fufu (a locally produced food made from cassava) in Congo Town Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of fufu. 

She describes herself as a respectful woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of fufu

loans.name: Martin Antonio

texts.es:
El cliente Martin Antonio V. L.. Vive en la comarca petaquia sálales del municipio el Sauce Del departamento de león.
Su principal actividad es compra de novillos para el desarrollo, el cliente es casado tiene 6 hijos a su cargo.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de 5 terneros para el desarrollo.
Esto le permitirá obtener un mejor ingreso para su familia y fortalecer las ganancia, es una persono muy conocida en la zona y el municipio.
texts.en:
Martin Antonio V. L. lives in the Salales area of the municipality of El Sauce, located in the department of León. He is married and has six children under his care. His main business is purchasing young cows to raise.

The loan is for the purchase of five calves to raise. This will allow him to have a higher income for his family and increase his earnings. He is very well known in the area and in the municipality.

loans.use: To purchase young cows to raise.

loans.name: Luisa Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Luisa tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada, de  esta relación bendecida por Dios tiene tres hijos de 15- 11-y 9 años, el mayor esta en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo hace 11 años, en la cual a pasado duras temporadas pero que ha sabido sobrellevar, en la actualidad el negocio ha mejorado y dice que en parte gracias a los créditos que ha recibido ya que con ellos ha ido adecuando y surtiendo mas su tienda ahora nos dice que casi tiene de todo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00. Sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos para su local y un congelador para guardar: carnes, pescado y otros productos que requieren mantenerse congelados. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, le gusta por la facilidad para cancelar las cuotas y por la ayuda recibida.
 
Su sueño es tener un mini Marquet mas elegante.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, a place famous for its Panama hats and for being the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, the “Old Warrior.” 

Luisa, 33, is married and from this union blessed by God were born three children who are 15, 11 and 9 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the two youngest are in elementary school.  Her husband is a laborer.

She has had a grocery store for the last 11 years where she has had some difficult times but that she has managed to overcome.  Currently, the business has improved thanks in part to the loans she has received with which she has been stocking and equipping the store.  She tells us that now she has almost everything.  She is open for business daily from 6am until 8pm.  She takes delivery of her products at the store.

She wants to use this loan to buy more products for the store and a freezer to store meats, fish and other products that need to be stored frozen.  

She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the ease of repayments and for the help received.

Her dream is to have a more elegant minimarket.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Graham

texts.en:
Graham is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is house rent.

He operates a cobbler business, making shoes for his neighbors and passersby. Graham hopes to establish a shoe shop to sell shoes in the future.   

He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business. With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more shoes and purchase leather equipment to design shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and leather equipment to design shoes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 37 años, convive con Miguel, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas, Liz, de 18 e Ingrid, de 15 años. Los cuatro como una gran familia viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Kivinaki. Desde las primeras horas del día, Vilma, se dirige a la escuela de la localidad, donde hace algunos años enseña a los niños de la ciudad Boca de Ipoki. Pero todos los fines de semana desde hace 8 años; junto a su esposo e hijas, viene sembrando cítricos como: naranja, mandarina, frutos que comercializa a gran escala en la capital del país. Pero los deseos de Vilma, es comenzar su cultivo de café y plátano; para ello ya compró 7 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, con lo que planea comenzar a sembrar, estos productos que tienen mayor demanda. Vilma, es una mujer responsable y como presidenta de su banco comunal, es muy puntual en los pagos a MFP. Ya es el séptimo crédito que tiene y está feliz de poder salir adelante.
Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá adquirir más plantas de café y de esa manera poder trasplantar en su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old.  She lives with Miguel who is 40 years old.  They both have 2 daughters, Liz who is 18 and Ingrid who is 15.  The four live in their own home which is located in the community of Kivinaki.  Very early in the mornings Vilma heads off to the local school where for several years she has been teaching children from the town of Boca de Ipoki.  However, every weekend for the last 8 years, together with her husband and daughters, she has been growing citrus fruits such as oranges and mandarins, fruits which she sells on a large scale in the country's capital city.

However, Vilma wishes to start growing coffee and bananas.  For this reason, she has already bought 7 hectares of farming land which she plans to start sowing with these crops which are in higher demand.

Vilma is a responsible woman and, as president of her community bank, she is very punctual in her repayments to MFP.  This is already her 7th loan cycle and she is happy to be able to get ahead.  She will use her loan to acquire more coffee plants and, in this way, be able to move her plants into her land.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 39 years old. Leonila is married and has 3 children aged 9, 7 and 6. To make a living, Leonila owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish in the market. Leonila wishes to have enough money for her children's education. She hopes to be able to pay for their studies until college.

Leonila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Munyoki

texts.en:
O. is 40 years old married to Esther Mueni who contributes to the family's income. He buys and resells cattle for income. He has been in the business for a period of nine years with an income of about Kshs. 20,000 per month. 

This is his first loan with Kadet and wants to use the loan to buy more cattle for resale. He hopes to give his children a quality education and buy a piece of land for permanent residence.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca D. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Rebecca is married and has one child. To make a living, Rebecca raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rebecca does her best to make her family happy.

Rebecca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children, who are attending school. He owns a car repair shop and he specializes in rebuilding engines. He is the only source of income for his family. He obtained his first Kiva loan and was very satisfied with the results.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to complete his work and buy required tools so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Halako

texts.en:
Halako O. is a married lady. She is the mother of four children whom she loves very much and for whom she works hard every day to ensure she gives them a good education up to the university level. 

Her business is located at Magongo estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. She has been selling shawls for the last three years to local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more shawls to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future and even satisfy the demands of the women of the Magongo area. She describes herself as a very patient lady.

loans.use: Shawls

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur. Kasur city is famous for its leather industry.  Kosar owns a 4-room house there and has been living in the area of Faqeerwala with her family for over 5 years.  She is 50 years of age and is married to M. Y., who makes and sells shoes. He deals with different shoe shops in the city and fulfills their orders on time to earn an income for the family. He is very well known in his community and among his clients as a master in his work. 
Kosar supports her family by doing embroidery. She receives orders from her community members and fulfills them on time. She utilizes that money for paying utility bills. 
Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase leather, nails, shoe polisher, etc., in larger quantities. This will help him to finish larger orders on time and make better profits.  He has been doing this business for the past 5 years, and Kosar is confident that a loan investment will bring better profits to him and help him to expand his business.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Kosar".

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and shoe polisher for shoe making & selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Grimaldo

texts.es:
Grimaldo tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores. Vive con su familia en su casa propia en Macuaco, una pequeña comunidad en el distrito de Nueva Arica ubicado a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la cultivación de arroz. Vende su producto a los comerciantes y al público en general en el mercado local. Desea comprar fertilizantes para lograr una mejor producción de arroz y así venderlo a mejor precio en el mercado.  Por ello, solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1,500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes. Grimaldo es muy trabajador y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Grimaldo is 47 years old, married, and he has 2 young children. He lives with his family in a house that they own in Macuaco. It is a small community in the district of Nueva Arica, located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

For the past 10 years he has been cultivating rice. He sells his product to merchants and to the general public in the local market. He wants to purchase fertilizers to achieve a better rice yield and to sell at a better price in the market. For this reason he requests a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Grimaldo is very hard working and he has very good personal and work-related references.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Mirian Guicela

texts.es:
Mirian Guicela R. B. tiene 29 años, vive en Unión Libre vive con el compañero  y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.   Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Santa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño tener una casa propia.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Mirian Guicela R. B. is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and two children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Mirian is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  Mirian is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Mirian enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a very supportive lady. Along with her household responsibilities, she also operates a sewing business. She receives orders from neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits for her family. She is married to J. M. and has four children. Three of them are studying while youngest one is only 5 years old and has not started getting an education yet. Her husband sells wheat and cotton. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family. He is 26 years old and in the same business as J. M.. 

Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete her work in less time and produce good quality clothes. She has been in her business for the past eight years and is very confident that an investment will be productive for her business and take her business to a more profitable position. 

Noreen lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living in the Marzipura area in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El señor Rosendo es cliente antiguo, el trabaja en el servicio de amplificación por la zona de apaña y otras zonas aledañas, el equipo que tiene, por el traslado de un lugar a otro se fue deteriorando por lo que solicita este crédito para comprar otra mezcladora de música, el ameniza todo tipo de acontecimientos, el joven en los días particulares trabaja manejando un radiotaxi, el cual esta en miras a comprarlo, el vive en domicilio en anticrético por la zona de villa apaña, tiene una hija pequeña y otros por venir, por lo que la esposa solo se dedica a labores del hogar, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a long-standing client.  He provides sound system services in Apaña and neighboring areas.  The system that he currently owns has been wearing out due to the fact that it gets moved around from one place to another.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy another mixing panel.  Rosendo livens up all types of events.

During the week, Rosendo drives a radio taxi which he is looking to buy.  He lives 'en anticrético' in Villa Apaña (note: 'anticrético' is a type of rental agreement where both landlord and tenant agree that the tenant will live in a house for a specified period of time, after which the landlord will return the money received at the start of the contract).  Rosendo has a young daughter and hopes to have other children in the future.  His wife is a housewife.

Rosendo is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy an audio mixing panel

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a mini market since 1990. She sells perishable and non-perishable goods and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. She obtained her first Kiva loan and has been a very punctual client. She has actually repaid her loan in full several months earlier. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. She has high hopes for the future of her business and always tends to be in the requisition of her customers.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 31 years old and a single mother of one. She runs a cyber cafe to earn a living. She has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. Her dream and aspiration is to open a computer training college. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a computer and a generator.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a generator

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 35 years old and married. She has seven children who are aged four to fifteen years old; the youngest two are not yet in school. 

Charlotte works with her husband selling cassava and has been doing so for the past two years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. The profits have also enabled her to expand her business.

Charlotte is asking for a loan of 300,000 RWF to buy more cassava to sell and make more profits in order to support her children.With the profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Ore

texts.en: Ore is 41 years old. She works for the government as a consultant in her village. Her husband is a rice seller, and they both can make $6.50 per day in income. They have 5 children who are all studying. Every month, Ore has to spend $88 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy fertilizer for her field. Ore plans to buy a stock of rice to sell when the price is high.  She is working hard for a higher income to be able to send her children to school until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, vive en Condega municipio de Estelí, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada, es madre tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y también es comerciante. Comenzó en esta actividad desde temprana edad ella logro estudiar para ser maestra y dar clases a niños de primaria que habitan en su comunidad combinaba esta actividad con las labores domesticas de su hogar. Con el paso del tiempo compro un molino para triturar maíz y ofrecer este servicio en su comunidad, su esposo le ayuda a ella a sembrar frijoles que es otra actividad que realiza.
Ella solicito el crédito para sembrar 1 manzana de frijol, 1.5 manzana de maíz, compra de insumos, fertilizantes, fungicida  para evitar las plagas y pagar mano de obra. Con esta inversión va a darle un buen mantenimiento a sus cultivos, mejorar el nivel de rendimiento de sus siembras, sacar ingresos que le permitan seguir trabajando para progresar. En sus próximos planes quiere criar gallinas para vender y seguir mejorando en su preparación como maestra para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in Condega, in the municipality of Estelí. She 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She works in agriculture and also sells things. She began in this line of work at an early age. She managed to study to become a teacher and give classes to primary school-aged children in the community. She combines this work with her domestic work at home. Eventually she bought a mill to grind corn and she offers this service to the community. Her husband helps her to plant beans, which is another economic activity she engages in.

She requested a loan to plant one manzana [unit of land a little smaller than a hectare] of beans and 1.5 manzanas of corn, to buy inputs such as fertilizers and fungicides to prevent diseases, and to pay for labor. With this investment she will give good care to her crops, improve her production, and earn income that will allow her to continue working and making progress. For her future plans, she would like to raise chickens for sale. She would also like to continue improving in her education as a teacher so she can improve her family’s quality of life, and also that of her community.

loans.use: to plant one manzana of beans and 1.5 manzanas of corn, to buy inputs such as fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en: Beberly, 38, is married with four children, aged 8 to 21. She is a farmer and helps her husband till their rice farm. Beberly has been engaged in farming for 21 years. She also provides tailoring services to her community. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. Beberly hopes for this loan to help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 14 and 7. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material (fabric) or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to create new lotions and increase stock.

loans.name: Angel Esteban

texts.es:
Angel Esteban tiene 46 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y sus cinco hijos de ceinte y dos, veinte y uno, dieciocho, quince y cinco años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Angel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y poder comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca y poder sembrar aún más para aumentar los ingresos. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Esteban is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife and five children (22, 21, 18, 15, and 5 years old) in the Pueblo Viejo canton in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

The members of the community bank Unido Somos are located in the El Marañón area of the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  This group works with short cycle farmers who plant corn, rice, and beans.

Angel is a farmer who plants corn, rice, and beans.  He purchases his products at the Karlita Agricultural Supply store and sells them at Castillo's store.

He is asking for this loan because in order to plant corn, rice and beans, he needs to buy seeds, urea, supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer for the crops.

The support of this loan will help him financially be able to meet the needs of his family.  He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases, and climate variation, and with the help of the loan, it will be easier to purchase supplies.  

His dream is to be able to purchase a farm and plant more crops to increase his income.  In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y alimenticios, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tienen casa propia, el inicio el negocio con su familia hace 15 años, actualmente es el que le cubre todas sus necesidades, dicho negocio trata sobre la venta de productos naturales medicinales, también suplementos alimenticios.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos, medina natural, cereales para dietas, suplementos alimenticios,  que le ayuden para mejorar su servicio para con los clientes.
El objetivo de francisco es que con la inversión, estará más capaz para atender la demanda de los clientes y velara mejor por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco sells medicines and food products.  He lives with his wife and children and they own their own home.  He started this business with his family 15 years ago and it currently covers all his needs.  His business is selling natural medicines and also food supplements.

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines, diet cereals and food supplements which will help him to improve his service to his customers.

Francisco's aim is, as a result of this investment, to be more able to meet his customers demands and look out for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines, diet cereals and food supplements

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro  de educación secundaria.
Su primer préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta de zapatillas, desodorantes, pinzas, etc, estos productos los vende en a ciudad de Arequipa, también se dedica a la crianza de ganados como ovinos y vacunos, trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de cuatro años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará semillas de papa, avena, cebada para el sembrío, sus hijos y su esposo se dedican a la chacra y al ganado.
La señora desea tener mejor el negocio y más seguro que le asegure ganancias diarias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "La Yunguyeñita” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She studied up to the third year of her secondary education.

Rosa's first loan was for 300 soles.  She invested that money in her business selling slippers, deodorants, hairpins, etc.  She sells these products in the town of Arequipa.  She also raises livestock such as sheep and cows.  Rosa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than four years.

Rosa will use this new loan for 500 soles to buy potato seeds, oats and barley to sow.  Her children and her husband work on the farm and raise livestock.

Rosa would like to improve her business and make it more secure so that it guarantees her daily profits.

What Rosa likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan, the savings and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, oats and barley

loans.name: Mammadaga

texts.en:
Mammadaga is 53 and married with two children. Since he was a child, he has dedicated himself to the cattle and sheep breeding industry. He has been described as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his family. Mammadaga raises livestock to sell. His business provides the only income to support his family and they really need it. His monthly profit is 200 USD and his wife helps to raise and look after the cattle and sheep. 

Mammadaga is requesting an 800 AZN loan to purchase more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Moses has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and household supplies.
