To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy essential commodities like rice since it's now in such high demand, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and pay school fees for their child who has just entered school. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business in the village. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy essential commodities like rice.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Kamene is 35-years-old and married to Kamene. Together they have three children aged ten, six and four years old. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 13,000 from the business.

This is his third loan term in KADET. He paid his previous loans successfully.He will use the loan amount to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for use on the farm. He will use the anticipated profits to educucate and feed his family. His dream is to own a motorcycle

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José, vive con sus cinco hijos de las edades de 24, 22, 18, 16, 14 años, él es viudo, dos de sus hijos estudian, los demás le ayudan a él en su oficio que es la crianza de cerdos y ganado, José aprendió este oficio por la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos, lo atiende desde las 5:00am.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vaca horra y además comprara concentrado para los cerdos, este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar el número de ganado y para tener disponible la alimentación para los cerdos, el riesgo que corre es en el verano que aumentan los precios en el alimento para el ganado y los cerdos.
La aspiración de José es mejorar sus pastos, aumentar el ganado y ayudar a sus hijos, enseñándoles el oficio de la ganadería y permitiéndoles estudiar.
texts.en:
José lives with his five children who are 24, 22, 18, 16 and 14 years old.  He’s a widower.  Two of his children go to school and the rest help him in his business which is raising pigs and cattle.  José learned this occupation because he needed to support his children.  He starts work at 5am.

At present, he asks for a loan to buy a grazing cow and also to buy feed concentrate for the pigs.  This loan will help him increase his herd size and to have feed available for the pigs.  The risk he runs is that feed prices for cattle and for pigs rise in summer.

José’s goal is to improve his grasses, increase his herd size and help his children teaching them animal husbandry and allowing them to study.

loans.use: to buy a grazing cow and pig feed concentrate.

loans.name: Darly

texts.es: Darly, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, con mucho carisma y deseosa de progresar. Vive  con Eduardo, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hermosos hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Darly es la confección de prendas de vestir, de todos los modelos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, oficio que aprendió en un centro ocupacional. A ella siempre le ha gustado esta actividad, en un incio contaba con una maquina de coser a pedal, luego fue creciendo y con mucho esfuerzo se compró una maquina eléctrica, con la actualmente elabora sus confecciones, logrando atender a todos sus clientes. Lleva tres años realizando esta actividad, y gracias a ello puede percibir un ingreso económico para su familia. Mas adelante desea montar una boutique en su casa, para exhibir sus productos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de contar con el apoyo de un crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por eso asegura será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse muy cómoda con su grupo, ya que los considera buenas personas y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la confección, como telas, hilos, elásticos, cierres  y demás.
texts.en: Darly, 36, is a hard-working, cheerful woman with a lot of charisma and a great desire to get ahead.  She lives wtih Eduardo and they have two beautiful children, ages 13 and 7.  They live in their own house.  Darly earns a living as a seamstress and makes all kinds of women's, men's and children's clothes.  She learned her skill at a vocational center.  She has always enjoyed her work and started out with a pedal sewing machine.  As her business grew, and with much hard work, she bought an electric machine which she now uses to make her products and attend to customers.  She has been in business for three years, providing an income for the family.  In the future she would like to open a boutique in her home to exhibit her products.  This is her fourth loan through the MFP institution.  She is happy to be able to count on this loan to grow her business and is committed to paying it back on time.  She also feels very comfortable in her group because she thinks the members are kind and supportive.  The loan she has requested will be used to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, elastic, closures and other items.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic and closures.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been married for seven years, and is blessed with three children. Until now her family has not been very fortunate, even though they do have some income. Together with her spouse, who is a farmer in the village where they live, they plant and harvest rice which they sell. They have been doing this since they got married. They cultivate a hectare plot of land which they inherited from her in-laws. 

She is now asking for loan because she wants to improve her crop production. She is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use on their farm. 

She hopes this loan will be granted to her as it will help to develop her business and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use on her land.

loans.name: Tavenyika1 Group

texts.en:
Herbert is 30 years old. He is married with one four-year-old child who does not yet attend school. 

He has been in business for two and a half years and has no employees. He has a stand at the Garikai flea market in town. He buys his products from South Africa. He does not have any other source of income.

His major challenge is exchange rate fluctuation. In the next five years, he would like to own a shop in town. The loan would help him to generate enough profits to cater for his family's needs as well as save for his child's future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, solar panels, TVs, DVDs, and inverters

loans.name: Migna

texts.es: Migna,  de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo  Vladimir de 36 años y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar Joseph de 14 años y Jhon de 09 años de edad. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propia casa. Migna, dice que todo lo que viene con el nombre de cacao genera negocio, es por ello que trata de darle el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de cacao, y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de su producto. Sin embargo ella trata de esmerarse lo mas posible que pueda; es por ello que le dedica mucho tiempo a su producto, conjuntamente con la ayuda de su esposo, sin embargo en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción  de su producto final y fruto; gracias al esfuerzo que hace está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente su producto de cacao los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio razonable. Este será su crédito numero 08 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo sugerido y  esta muy contenta  de pertenecer a su banca comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes y abono para hacer el mantenimiento de cacao.
texts.en:
Migna is 33 years old, and lives with her husband Vladimir who is 36 years old. She has 2 children who are students, Joseph who is 14 and Jhon who is 9 years old. They live together in the town of Santa Rosa where they have their own home. 

Migna says that everything that comes with the name of cocoa creates business. This is why she tries to give the best care to their cocoa plantations, under the premise that her buyers have been satisfied with the quality of her crops. Then again, she does her very best and that is why she spends so much time in her work, together with her husband’s help. But during the harvesting she needs day workers, in order to reap the harvests, and by these efforts obtaining a good financial position. She usually sells her crops in the neighborhood collection centers at a good price. 

This will be her 8th loan through MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she can obtain financial help so she can feel secure buying the items she proposes and she is very happy to be a member of the community bank. With the 1,000 soles she will buy fertilizers and compost in order to care for her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Graciela is the coordinator of her group, Cristo la Fuente 1, 2, 3 (Christ the Source). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to buy a house and to return to Haiti as she has been living in the Dominican Republic. She came to the Dominican Republic to work and to get a better future. In the meantime, she plans to continue attending church.

Graciela is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for almost 8 years, and it was started with a loan from a family living in the Dominican Republic. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothing, cosmetic products and shoes. She has been saving her profits because she wants to make her dreams come true. She wants to have her own house and to move back to Haiti.

Graciela's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, cosmetic products and shoes

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es: la Sra. Marciana  se dedica a la venta de repuestos para vehículos como ser muñones, juntas, ponchillos, cremalleras, grasas y otros, el esposo de la Sra. es mecánico y trabaja al frente de la tienda el cual esta ubicado en la zona de tembladerani en donde existen varios talleres de mecánica por lo que la venta es buena ya que tiene mucha clientela,  el crédito solicitado estará destinado al incremento de capital (compra de repuestos para vehículos), gracias a la visita que le realizamos pudimos observar que la Sra. tiene su tienda en un lugar estratégico el cual genera buenas utilidades por lo que asegura que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas ya que es un apersona es responsable y trabajadora se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marciana sells vehicle spare parts, such as pivots, covers, racks, lubricants and other items.  Her husband is a mechanic and works across from the shop which is located in the area of Tembladerani where there are several mechanical workshops.  Therefore sales are good and she has many customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase working capital to buy vehicle spare parts.  Through our visit we were able to observe that Marciana's shop is in a strategic, useful location which ensures that she will be punctual in her loan payments because she is responsible and hard-working.  She is content and grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To increase working capital to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 49 year old woman from Al- Bayader, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to buy a new sewing machine. She has had an ongoing project of sewing clothes to sell which started off small, but has bene developing. She hopes that in the future she can have an exhibition of her products or have a permanent bazaar space.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Irene, who, with her partner (Isaac), has become a very good smallholder farmer. They didn't just get together romantically; they joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 7 years and has gained so much experience. 

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her four children, she has been selling milk and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated, and the demand for cereals such as maize is very high. Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her cereal business and she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy cereals. 

Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more cereals for sale. As a result of the loan, she will sell cereals to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. 
This smallholder farmer is looking for a little support to accomplish big things, and with this loan you can help him reach her goals.
Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Assaba

texts.en:
Born on 4th May, 1952 in Kara, North of Togo, Madam Assaba O. early begun retail sale to supply her own needs. Married and mother of one (01) child, she showed skill in the activity she has done for the past 20 years with good management practices. Madam Assaba O. began her activities in very hard conditions with an initial capital of $30. But thanks to her capacity of management and mainly to her good sense of business, her business took a very encouraging step which needs supporting funds. Her honesty and good will have been proved when she paid her first credit back without problem. This trustworthiness can lead to other financing so that she can increase her business and income, and improve her living conditions. Therefore, the credit of $ 550 will help her buy plastic items (cups, bowls, buckets etc.) for sale during this Christmas period.

Née le 04 Mai 1952 à Kara dans le Nord du Togo, Madame O. Assaba s’est très tôt lancée dans le petit commerce pour pouvoir survivre. Mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle a fait preuve de la maîtrise de son activité qu’elle gère depuis plus de 20 ans avec toute la rigueur d’une gestion responsable. Madame O. Assaba a débuté ses activités dans des conditions très difficiles avec un capital initial de $30. Mais, grâce à sa capacité de gestion et surtout son sens d’affaires, son commerce a pris une ampleur très encourageante qui nécessite des financements d’appoint. Son honnêteté et sa bonne foi ont été démontrées lors de son premier crédit remboursé sans difficulté. Cette confiance peut lui valoir d’autres financements pour augmenter ses affaires afin d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer des conditions de vie. Ainsi, le crédit de $550 va servir à acheter des objets en plastiques (gobelet, bassine, seau…) pour leur revente en cette période des fêtes de noël.

loans.use: buy plastic items (cups, bowls, buckets etc.) for sale during this Christmas period.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is just 22 years old, and has done menial jobs to keep himself going since elementary school. With the little money that he saved, he managed to start a small communications shop which he is running.

Kwame wants to use a KIVA loan to secure a small structure from to operate his communications business. He is preparing for the TEACH learning sessions to be conducted by KRABAN very soon.

loans.use: Capital to secure a structure

loans.name: Bakhrom

texts.en: Bakhrom has 5 children. His wife and two of his girls help him in their family café. They have been managing this business for over 10 years. Besides his family, Bakhrom has two assistants who work for him. In their café they cook national dishes. He would like to receive a loan to purchase a refrigerator for meat and soft drinks. Bakhrom is a handicapped person (his hand is broken) and he is from a poor family. He is a very hard-working man and tries the best to make a living for his family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Amparo Estela

texts.es:
Amparo is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works for a government organization as a civil servant. She hopes to invest the loan in setting up a grocery store to help support her family. Amparo belongs to the group Angeles 4. Other members of this group include Rosa Jiménez López (raises and sells pigs) and Rosalba H. López (has a grocery store) who would like to invest their loans in their businesses: Rosa wishes to buy more pigs while Rosalba would like to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

AMPARO TIENE 40AÑOS , CASADA 6 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UN ORGANISMO DE GOBIERNO COMO EMPLEADO PUBLICO.ELLA ESPERA INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO EN COLOCAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES PARA AYUDAR AL PRESUPUESTO FAMILIAR .PERTENECE AL GRUPO ANGELES 4.SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON DOÑA ROSA JIMENEZ LOPEZ (CRIANZA Y VENTA DE PUERCOS ) Y DOÑA ROSALBA H. LOPEZ (TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) QUIENES ESPERAN INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO EN SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO MAS PUERCOS DOÑA ROSA Y DOÑA ROSALBA MERCADERIA PARA SU TIENDA.

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
T. Maria is 67 years old and a mother of five. T. is an enterprising lady who supports herself through various sources of income despite all her children being financially dependant.

She has a small hall which she rents out and in which she screens English Premiership matches and Nigerian video shows. This earns her $85 per month. She has also installed a water tank in her home and sells water at $0.056 per 20 litres. In addition to this, she has a grocery stall in front of her house from which she earns about $2 a day.

T.'s video hall needs renovating to attract more customers and earn more rent. The hall needs plastering and some parts of the floor need to be cemented. Thus, T. is asking for a loan of $800.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for renovating her video hall.

loans.name: Gulab

texts.en: Gulab A. is a 24-year-old married woman who raises livestock for meat production. She started her business recently, in 2006. Gulab purchased one calf and is going to raise it for meat purpose in the near future. She already sold two calves and it brought her good income. She lives with her husband and two children in the small village near to the Saatli region. Selling livestock is the only  financial source in her family, since she and her husband are unemployed. Raising children is expensive and it is very hard to live a normal life without additional sources of income.  Gulab has applied for a 1000 USD loan to expand her business and purchase three calves and fodder. The estimated cost for one calf is 200-300 USD and with the rest of loan she will purchase fodder.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo is highly skilled lady who works in a bazaar and in her home, sews dresses tailored to her country's national heritage. Her dresses are popular, because she sews very beautifully. Sometimes she sells the dresses she hand makes in the bazaar, but mostly those are sewn from orders. In the bazaar, she sells women's clothing to demanding clients. She is requesting a loan of $1,025 so she can improve the assortment of the clothes she sells, and increase her business.

loans.use: To improve stock and expand business

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
I am a widow, Naseem B.. I am married and a mother of two sons. I live with my family in Multan, a mid-size town in Pakistan. One of my daughters-in-law died few years ago and left three kids. Now, I am the caretaker of these kids. My elder son is the breadwinner of our family and he is a rickshaw driver. Now, he requires a loan for rickshaw maintenance.

There are two other members in my loan group; all of us are mutually responsible for each other’s loans. Koser P. requires a loan for her beauty salon. Tasleem F. requires a loan to expand their fruits business.

loans.use: Get rickshaw repaired

loans.name: Namunina A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hellen K.. She is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to expand her business. Hellen is a 23 year old widow. Each week Hellen makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to buy more land for laying and making bricks.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Florence N., Annet N., Sarah N., and Zam N.. Florence N. is currently in the business of fishing. She is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to to purchase more fishing nets. Annet N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to re-invest in the stone quary business. Sarah N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying as well. She is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to add to her stone business. Zam N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to increase her inventory stock.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Paquita Angelica

texts.en:
Paquita Angelica has a business making “Cecina” (smoked pork) and pork sausage. She lives in the neighborhood Parta Alta in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She prepares her meats in her house and sells them in the region of San Martin and often takes orders from friends living in Lima and Iquitos. She started the business four years ago with $50 and a pig after years of running a business selling shoes. Although she didn’t have any experience making sausage she worked hard and learned quickly.

Paquita is 51 years old, happily married, and has 4 children. Three of her children are grown and the other is studying hard to become a professional. She started the business because she knew their would be a market for delicious sausage and she wanted to work from home. Although she is very busy and has many responsibilities her family is first priority. She organizes carefully so she can have time to spend with them.

A member of the community bank Las Orquideas, Paquita is requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 to repay over 6 months. With the money she will buy pigs so she can make more sausage. She dreams of continuing to grow until she has her own store and butcher shop.

loans.use: She wil buy pigs

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Mr. Hernán G. González is from Jejui - Chore, a neighbor city to Santaní. He is 25 years old. He is the father of a beautiful boy and is married to Mrs. Carmen Figueredo López, who is 22 years old.

Hernán is very hardworking young man. Since he was very young he has worked and saved; he bought his own home through his own effort. He owns a business where he sells CD's, MP3's, DVD's and VCD's. The store has been functioning for more than 2 years now; he runs it from a rented space. In addition to the store Hernán and his wife also run, in the same space, a dining room where they serve food to the workers in the area. His wife works with him and together this young couple is seeking to move themselve ahead.

They have many projects. Hernán is a very enterprising man eager to progress. Despite the fact that he was not able to finish his studies he looks to get ahead through his hard work.

Today they are requesting a loan which they will invest in the business, especially in beverages such as soft drinks, juices, dairy products, and beer, along with meat, eggs, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Hernán G. González es de Jejui – Chore una ciudad vecina de Santaní, él tiene 25 años, es padre de un hermoso niño y esta casado con la señora Carmen Figueredo López de 22 años de edad.

Hernán es un joven hombre muy trabajador, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado y ahorrado y hoy día ya ha adquirido su casa con su propio esfuerzo. El posee un negocio de ventas de cd´s, Mp3, dvd´s y vcd´s, el local está funcionando hace ya más de dos años y es alquilado. Además de ello también habilitaron en el mismo un comedor en donde dan de comer a gente trabajadora de la zona. Su esposa trabaja con el él y juntos esta pareja joven busca salir adelante.

Ellos tienen muchos proyectos, Hernán es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de progresar, a pesar de que no pudo culminar sus estudios el busca salir adelante con arduo trabajo.

Hoy ellos solicitan un crédito que lo invertirán en el negocio especialmente bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, lácteos, cerveza, carne, huevos, leche, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, dairy products, beer, meat, eggs and milk, among others.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 2 years old. Fatuma owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. sells palm oil. Palm oil is very popular in Ghana. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjoa and her four dependents. Demand for her palm oil is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio is married to Ninfa López and they have four grown children, all of whom are studying in the university. Ninfa is a home maker who also works in house cleaning. Additionally, she oversees her children’s education. Dionisio sells charcoal in small bags up to one kilo in size.

The children help their father with packaging of the charcoal; Dionisio sells it on the street. The family’s goal is to be able to buy a vehicle with which to sell their merchandise. They have a good customer base built up. They have had this business for the past 6 years and opened it with capital that they obtained by selling a piece of land.

The loan that Dionisio is requesting is for buying merchandise that will allow him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Dionisio esta casado con la Sra. Ninfa López y tienen cuatro hijos mayores, todos estudian en la universidad. Ninfa es ama de casa y trabaja en la limpieza y con la educación de sus hijos. Dionsio se dedica a la venta de carbón en bolsas pequeñas de hasta un kilo.

Sus hijos le ayudan al padre en el empaquetado del carbón y Dionicio es quien sale a realizar las ventas en forma ambulante. El objetivo de la familia es poder comprar un vehículo para la venta de su mercadería ya que tienen buena clientela formada. Ellos tienen el negocio desde hace 6 años, con un capital que consiguieron al vender un terreno.

El crédito solicita para la compra de mercaderías para su venta y así aumentar su ingreso.

loans.use: To buy bags for charcoal.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. is a grocer in Preak Pang Village in Kandal Province. Because her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Srey P. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Morn Nuon, is a house builder. His work generates a small income that supports the family. Mrs. Srey P. is 48 years old and the mother of two children; one is employed in a garment factory, and the other is attending school. Mrs. Srey P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell to her customers to expand the business

loans.name: Maurilio

texts.es:
Maurilio is 46 and lives with his wife and five young children. He grows potatoes in the local community, where he was born and learned agriculture as a boy through his parents, who taught him everything he knows relating to this activity. He had to assume new responsibilities since he got married.

Agriculture has helped him support his family, and he is grateful to his parents for teaching him how to work the land. Without a doubt, he enjoys selling the products that he hardly works on during months. Specially during harvest; selecting the products is the most tiresome part of being a farmer.

Maurilio’s family is the reason for him to be better every day. Now, he wishes to invest in seeds and fertilizer, both very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Maurilio tiene 46 años, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos jóvenes. Está dedicado al cultivo de papa en su localidad, donde nació y desde pequeño aprendió la labor de agricultor por sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo concerniente a esta actividad y desde que contrajo matrimonio tuvo que asumir nuevas responsabilidades.

La agricultura es la actividad que le ayudó a mantener su hogar, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido con sus padres quienes le instruyeron en ello.Sin duda, lo que le agrada, es el momento de comercializar sus productos agrícolas, a los que se dedicó por muchos meses, sobre todo en la cosecha, la selección de los productos es lo más tedioso para todo agricultor.

Maurilio tienen en sus cinco hijos y su esposa las mejores razones para ser mejor cada día. Ahora, desea invertir en la compra de semillas y abonos, los cuales son muy costosos.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos de diferentes edades y nivel de estudios.
Anteriormente se dedicaba solo a los oficios domésticos, y acompañaba a su esposo en la actividades agrícolas, viendo ella la dificultad de que con los ingresos del esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos de la familia, logro tener una pequeña crianza y venta de pollos, esto le ha ayudado a darles educación a sus hijos.  También ha criado marranos, y también cuenta con una vaca lechera.  Además aprovecha esto para hacer queso, y los fines de semana hace y vende tamales, atol y comida.  Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, hasta su esposo la admira y aprecia por el éxito que ha tenido en sus negocios.
Ella no tiene estudios académicos, pero se ha superado gracias a su esfuerzo y que también ha aprovechado todas las oportunidades que ha tenido.
Con su préstamo ella quiere invertir en la compra de marranos y en el alimento, es una actividad que le puede dejar muy buenas ganancias. Su sueño es ver a todos sus hijos como profesionales con un buen estudio, que logren terminar sus carreras, y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 42 years old, married, and has eight children of different ages and educational levels. Previously, she focused only on domestic duties and accompanied her husband with agricultural activities. Seeing the difficulty her husband had covering the family's expenses with his income, she started a small breeding business and selling chickens. This has helped to provide her children with an education. She has also bred pigs and has a dairy cow, which she uses to make cheese. She also makes and sells tamales, atol (a beverage made from corn flour), and meals. She is a very enterprising person and her husband admires and appreciates the success she has had with her businesses.

She doesn't have any formal education, but she has succeeded thanks to her effort. She has also taken advantage of all of the opportunities that she has had. With this loan, she wants to invest in pigs and feed, which will provide her with very good earnings. Her dream is to see that her children have a good education, become professionals with successful careers, and are good people.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 12 pigs for breeding and sale and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Erick Daniel

texts.es: Don Erick habita en un barrio que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene 29 años de edad, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, que esta estudiando el preescolar su esposa es ama de casa y esta pendiente de su familia. El Sr. Erick trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como responsable de bodega, también alquila un cuarto desde hace un año para obtener otros ingresos y poder seguir ahorrando y con la solicitud de los préstamos hacer una casa que tenga las condiciones para su familia que sea segura. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en su casa. A largo plazo es terminar su casa y dar estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Erick lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación. He is 29, and he and his wife have a 5-year-old son, who is studying in preschool. His wife is a housewife and takes care of their family. Erick works at a company where he is in charge of a warehouse. He also rents out a room to make extra income and to be able to keep saving. With the request for loans, he will build a house with conditions that will keep his family safe. This loan will go towards the infrastructure of his house and the purchase of construction materials to make improvements to his house. His long-term goal is to finish his house and to educate his son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Komi A. is a recently married man who runs a taxi-moto business.  He does not yet have children, but hopes to in the near future, after he has saved up enough money to provide for them.  Komi lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Because of Wome’s location, which is somewhat isolated, many residents of Wome take taxi-motos to nearby villages and Komi’s services are always in demand.  Komi picks up passengers along the road, as seen in this photo, and drops them off at their destination.  Kofi has hopes to use this loan from Kiva to buy a newer, more comfortable motorcycle, so that he may better serve his clients and earn more money.  With the profits he will earn from this improvement, Komla can better provide for his wife and save money for his future family

loans.use: Buy a new moto

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet shoulders the responsibility as both mother and father of her family as she is married to Apolinario, who is an overseas contract worker. She lives in Brgy. Magassi, Cabagan, Isabela, a peaceful place where villagers’ primary work is in farm land. They have three children: Mark Anthony, 13, a second-year high school student; Apolinario Jr., 11, a grade six elementary student, and the youngest and only daughter, Lovely Rose, 8, a grade three student.

As a beautician, Janet’s daily routine is to go throughout the village looking for customers who might want manicure/pedicure service. Janet is now requesting a loan to replace her manicure tools including her nail cutter, nipper, cuticle remover, nail brush, towel and nail polish. Part of the loan will also be used to buy new sets of school uniforms for her children.

Janet does this type of work in order to earn income for her children’s needs because her husband cannot always remit money, and she dreams of ultimately enabling her children to get college educations.

loans.use: To buy replacement tools for her manicure business.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married and has two children. She is a very kind and hard working person. She sells electronic home equipment like tea castles, coffee makers, irons, and so on. She has invested 15,000 UAH in her goods; her profit is 2,000 UAH per month.

Vera has been in this business for four years. She rented a kiosk at the central market in hopes of selling even more electronic home equipment. Her good location at the market, and Vera's good character has helped her to attract many clients and increase her sales.

Vera would like a loan of 3,000 UAH for two months. She needs to increase the assortment of her inventory, so she can provide better choices to her clients. Additional income will help Vera to take better care of her family.

loans.use: Increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Laurès

texts.fr: Monsieur D. Laurès est né le 03 Décembre 1983 à Cotonou. Il a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de seconde.Après l'abandon des classes ,il a suivi une formation en maintenance informatique pendant 2 ans et a reçu son parchemin de fin de formation. Parrallèlement à son métier,il est très entreprenant et a ouvert des cabines téléphoniques, il vend également les cartes de recharges.C'est dans le souci de renforcer et diversifier ses activités que M. D. sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Laurès D. was born on December 3, 1983 in Cotonou. He attended school up to 10th grade. After he left school, he took a computer maintenance training course for two years and received his diploma at the end of the course. Along with this trade, he is quite an entrepreneur and opened telephone booths. He also sells rechargeable phone cards. It is to bolster and diversify these businesses that Mr. D. is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 40 rechargeable phone cards for all available networks

loans.name: Sambaur

texts.en: Mrs. Sambaur L. is single and lives in Ba Koung Khang Koert village in Takeo province. She is a hard-working woman. Since her work place is far from the house, Mrs. Sambaur L. usually spends a lot of money on transportation. Therefore, she would like to take out a loan to be able to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos; Yoel de 13 y Yenny de 7, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Ella es una joven madre de familia que desde muy niña aprendió el arte de transformar la totora en piezas artesanales, este arte lo aprendió de sus padres y actualmente se dedica a venderlas, lo hace de manera ambulatoria, ya que no tiene un lugar fijo donde vender sus obras artesanales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que tiene la libertada de elegir a qué horas trabaja y qué horas dedica a su familia. Lleva 15 años en esta actividad y se siente muy feliz realizándola, y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar por las calles en busca de clientes, es por eso que anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus artesanías con mayor comodidad y así atender mejor a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y tiene todas las ganas de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para eso tenga que juntar poco a poco sus ganancias del día, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan las demás socias. Julia invertirá el dinero que solicita en comprar más lana, alambres, hilo, adornitos, etc., materiales primordiales en la fabricación de sus piezas artesanales.
texts.en:
Julia, 37, is a very cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and two younger children. Yoel is 13, and Yenny is 7, both of whom are the motivation for all her efforts. She's a young mother who learned early on the art of transforming reed mace (cattails or bulrush) into handmade craftwork. She learned this art from her parents and currently sells them. She does this as a traveling saleswoman, since she has no fixed place where she can sell her craftwork. What she enjoys most in her work is that she has to liberty to choose which hours she works and which hours she dedicates to her family. She has been doing this for 15 years and feels very happy carrying out this work. What she least likes is having to walk the streets in search of customers.

For that reason, she desires to have a store where she could sell her crafts more comfortably and thus better serve her customers, since she knows that the success of her business depends on them. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has every desire to pay it on time, even though to do so she may have to collect her daily earnings little by little. In her communal bank she's very responsible and is always up-to-date on the agreements reached by the other members. Julia will invest the money she's requesting in buying more wool, wire, thread, ornaments, etc., essential materials for her handmade crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for crafts

loans.name: Batoma

texts.fr:
Madame  Batoma   Singaré  est âgée de 28 ans,  mariée  et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans la famille paternelle de son mari avec plusieurs autres ménages au quartier Darsalam  près de l’hôpital  Famory Doumbia   de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle débuta ses activités génératrices de revenus auprès  de sa mère qui vendait du poisson. Après 5 ans  passé  auprès de cette dernière, elle décide de s’installer à son propre compte en continuant  la vente de poisson séché au marché Château depuis 5 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans son lieu de vente et même dans son quartier. Elle reçoit fréquemment des commandes de Bamako et Kayes où elle a des clients.
Ses poissons sont  soigneusement conservés à l’abri d’insectes (mouches et cafards).
C’est dans le double souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de renforcer son commerce qu’elle  a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel  avec cette dernière.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 150 kg de poissons séchés sur place à Ségou auprès des pêcheurs et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes  et d’hommes.  
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA, qui  servira à aider son mari à prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales.
 Son ambition est d’avoir une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Batoma Singaré, 28, is married and the mother of 4 children; she lives with her husband's father's family with many other people, in the Darsalam neighborhood near the Famory Doumbia hospital of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She began working to earn money together with her mother who sold fish. After 5 years spent in business with her mother, she decided to set up for herself and has gone on selling dried fish at the Château market for 5 years. She has a good reputation in her marketplace and even in her district. She frequently receives orders from Bamako and Kayes, where she has customers. Her fish are carefully kept away from insects (flies and cockroaches).

With two goals in mind, satisfying her clientele's demand and bolstering her business, she came the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is on her first individual loan.

She expects to use this loan to buy 150 kg of dried fish right in Ségou from the fishermen, and sell her wares for cash or credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which she will use to help her husband cover certain family expenses.

Her ambition is to have a home of her own.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing dried fish for re-sale

loans.name: Maseiga

texts.en:
Maseiga I., 42, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

She had 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Maseiga’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools and supplies

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr: VERONIQUE B. EST UNE FEMME MARIEE ET MERE DE QUATRE ENFANTS.ELLE EST NEE LE 9 JUILLET 1971 ET HABITE AU QUARTIER MBOUR 1 DE THIES .APRES LES TRAVAUX MENAGERS ELLE FAIT DU PETIT COMMERCE DE POISSONS SECHES POUR SUBVENIR AUX BESOINS DE SES ENFANTS.AVEC CE PRET ELLE VEUT RENFORCER SES STOCKS AVANT L'HIVERNAGE.
texts.en:
Véronique B. is a married woman and the mother of four children. She was born on July 9, 1971 and lives in the MBOUR 1 district of THIES. After doing the housework, she does a bit of commerce in dried fish in order to provide for her children. With this loan, she wants to bolster her inventory before the off-season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell dried fish

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: La Señora Luisa Pérez, de 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casada, tiene tres hijos los cuales  tiene como objetivo prepararlo en los estudios y que mejoren su nivel de vida. Junto con su esposo trabaja comercializando utensilios plásticos que vende ambulantemente, desde hace16 años, iniciando con fondos propios. Incrementar sus ventas con mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. Con el préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: mallas, cementos, hierro y perlines. Para enmallar su vivienda y ofrecerle mayor seguridad y protección su familia.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para enmayar su vivienda

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena O. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 61 years old. Elena is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy N., 49, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Koim, 48, live along National Road Number Two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and other three are in school.

In the past, Phy stayed at home to take care of her children. Then she started to grow rice. Mr. Thoeun Koim has been working on a crocodile farm for over five years. Because they don’t have their own well, they have to ask to use their neighbor’s well. Now Phy is asking for her second loan of US$400 in order to dig one well for her family's use and to connect to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To dig a well and connect to an electricity utility service

loans.name: Neminda

texts.en:
Neminda M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 53 years old. Neminda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Neminda owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pork and beef products commonly known as "longganisa" in the local community. Neminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Neminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Neminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Neminda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Neminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ramado

texts.en:
Ramado B. is from the city of Dapitan. He is 43 years old. Ramado is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ramado owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing products in the local community. Ramado has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ramado joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramado has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ramado is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ramado from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Eliud Chege

texts.en:
Eliud N. is a dairy farmer. Eliud sells milk to the traders in his center and his neighbors. He is married with two children. He lives in Kibiciku, a small center on the outskirts of Nairobi.

Eliud was introduced to KADET by a friend; he has never borrowed from other sources. This will be his second loan and he plans to buy more cows so that he will be able to supply many shops and traders. He wants to add at least six to ten cows. With that, he believes his business volume will definitely increase and he will double his profits.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows for milk production

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 24 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 7 and 4 years old.


Felista has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzanian shillings.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Felista hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more kanga  and vitenge

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Chheang Group

texts.en: The group loan consists of six people living in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal Province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. The group loan leader, Mrs. Vanny C., a 37-year- old mother of three children attending the local school, owns a small store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods in order to increase income to better support the family.  Her husband, Mr. Moang Leang, assists her in the business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her store
